one_reviews_text: Oculus quest, it's amazing I love it.  provides you amazing experiences.  The first day I got dizzy and a little nauseous but then you get used to it. Personally I recommend it, you will not regret it, it is worth paying for the game
Very nice.handiness and easy to use.it's very cool look like.

As always the packaging and unboxing is an experience in itself, and it's fun to get setup and turned on but honestly the pairing process was frustrating. 

One issue I had during setup was on my app it didn't show an option for Quest 2, and the app was up to date. So without any indication why it was because I didn't merge the FB account at first so it just wouldn't acknowledge the option of a Quest 2 even existing let alone pairing. This was frustrating for about 10 minutes and wish they'd made this clear this is how it would restrict non-FB access. 

Once setup, first impression were that the head strap included didn't adjust as dynamically to let me fit it more uniformly on my face, and with the removal of the eye adjustments and changing it to only 3 static settings, I see permanent edges on the edge of my vision now which is annoying when I notice it, although during play my brain blocks it from my conscious site. 

Once setup and in play, the headseat is lighter which is a big plus, and controllers feel a bit wider for a better grip, the image quality is smoother and cripser being higher resolution and refresh rate, and the load times are much better for the games I've played on both this and Gen 1. 

Overall if this is your first VR headset you will absolutely love it, but ultimately having both I've found myself using the Gen 1 more and letting my wife use the new one.

Awesome investment! I’ve always wanted something different besides the average game console, AND I FOUND IT! Huge difference In game play between Xbox, PlayStation etc. If you’ve never tried VR  DO IT, it’s awesome. For the price the quality, and on top of all that, it’s mobile! Worth the money.. I think the only complaint I have is the battery only gives you about 45-1.5 hours of play time, so I had to purchase an external battery pac for it. Also when you have been on it for quite some time it does start to get a little warm/hot and does start glitching or freezing while on a game or whatever you may be doing at the time. other that that it’s a super buy.

Excellent stand alone VR headset, no PC required, easy to travel with, take it anywhere (dry) Can also play PC VR games if you connect to a PC. Charge it, download your games and play. Once games are downloaded, no WiFi needed. Multi player mode available online with friends, not all games.
The oculus quest 2 is AWESOME I would totally recommend for anyone it is the best thing that has EVER entered this earth
This is insane, new experience i'd recommend this to everyone.

This is exactly what I wanted out of a VR headset. The stand alone portion of the Quest 2 is an excellent alternative to needing a strong gaming PC. Quest 2 optimized games are so far fluid and with great detail. The upgraded 90Hz refresh rate does make a nice  difference over the original Quest's 72Hz for smooth movement in games and applications. I have no regrets in purchasing this headset. My only gripe is the stock head strap is a little flimsy and doesn't really provide a great fit for extended use. I definitely recommend purchasing the Elite Strap for comfort and fit. The photos I've uploaded are with the Elite Strap installed, not the stock one.

Aside from the built in VR hardware you can use the Oculus Link cable for a pretty great PC VR experience. I've played many games via the Link and all have been great. It works equally well with SteamVR as it does with the Oculus software. I played Halflife: ALYX via SteamVR perfectly fine with the quest 2. The visual quality using the link cable is very nice. Just make sure your USB 3.1 drivers are up to date and Windows 10 has it's latest updates installed.

The included controllers are as good as any other VR controllers I've used. They are a little less cumbersome than the PSVR wands. They are also as good as the original Quest controllers. The battery life is better than the original Quest's. Make sure you use the attached hand straps to avoid throwing your controllers. Seriously, just use them.

My only regret, and I knew this going in, is the Oculus software and link are only supported on recent builds of Windows 10. I would love to have some sort of Linux support, even if minimal. But like I said I knew this going in so I didn't have unrealistic expectations. There is always the off chance the hardware will be reverse engineered and community created Linux support may be possible. But don't buy this headset with the hope of this happening.

Let me start with this. If you want to get an amazing VR headset, standalone or PC, without shelling out the big bucks, I highly recommend this.

Pros:
Lighter on your face
Higher resolution (1832x1920 per eye)
90Hz refresh rate (is currently locked to 72Hz but can be unlocked with some tinkering, will be enabled more easily in future update)
Amazing tracking
Up to 256GB of storage

Mehs:
Strap is uncomfortable (I’m picking up an elite strap today and will edit the review if I can)

Cons(?):
Facebook login required (I don’t really mind this but I understand that some people aren’t comfortable with this)
IPD adjustment (3 settings instead of a slider fixed at 58, 63, and 68 mm)

I had the Oculus Quest (1) 
The first difference that I noticed is the material of this device, you can see a huge difference this white one does not looks pricey, it lighter you can really feel this while playing and that is the best, If I had to tell someone if they need to change your old device for the new one, I would says do it, sale your currentone and with that money the nee one, so you will be ready for the next games.

This is my first venture into VR and I couldn’t be happier. I’m not a big gamer and it was a week before I even tried one since I spent so much time looking at VR scenery around the world and watching concerts in virtual reality that made it seem like I was there. The exercise apps are also incredible and I am getting good home workouts. Once I tried a few games, I found them to be incredible and am now becoming a gamer. 

I also got the Logitech G333 VR earplugs that I recommend as they are designed for this device and can be left permanently  attached. 

This is a great device for gaming but even if you are not a gamer, it is worth getting.

My sons love this addition to their gaming, they use it as an exercise equipment. 
I didn’t understand until I gave it a whirl, makes a workout fun!!
Exactly as ordered. Could not be more pleased with the products. We have 3 Oculus Quest 2 and my family loves them.
The best purchase ever! We love it! And the peace of mind Warranty we got with it!

I've never had VR before but I am really enjoying the Oculus Quest 2.  I find it's very comfortable to wear.  It's also very lightweight.  Just waiting for more games to come out. The virtual hands are really out of this world.
Excellent addition to our home gaming area l.we are happy with out purchase as our rep was very helpful with setup instructions after purchasing this.
Everyone Absolutely loves this Game! Saved our Christmas! Besides, New Xbox & PS5 ‘s were sold out..
Amazing headset. My wife enjoys it! The investment was worth it.
This was our family gift for us.  Very fun to play!

I have done several VR games in physical locations and absolutely love this next level gaming style.  So naturally, when the Oculus Quest 2 came out, I did some extensive research on the product (youtube channels), and made the decision to purchase. 

I swear, this is probably the best purchase I could have made. As a huge star wars fan, I absolutely love the Vader Immortal episodes. There are 2 games I havent started yet, out of respect for my fiance and the fact that she wants to do this together, which are Thrill of the Fight and Pathogen. 

I usually lift weights in the evenings and after Im done, I'll put on the Oculus 2 and finish off with a light cardio at the light saber dojo. Make sure you place the settings for 360 attack. Another awesome feature that I have just figured out is that when Im fighting against droids and a laser is about to be shot in my back, I can move the light saber over my head and deflect the shot, then turn around and take out the remote droid shooting you. 

My fiances birthday is coming up in a week and I have ordered her an Oculus 2 and other accessories as there is a movie app called Big Screen in which we both can watch movies together in a virtual reality environment (movie theater, drive-in theater, campfire, etc), when I am gone on a business trip. 

Best part about this is that on long flights, I can put on the headset and watch stored movies and shows through the BigScreen movie App and completely immerse myself in the movie environment. I bought seperate battery from VRcover that gives an extended 8 hours of play to add onto the 2 hours you get with the Oculus Quest 2. Throw on a power bank and youll be playing for hours. Give the Oculus some time to cool down every hour or so. Other than that, absolutely perfect!

Another awesome feature is that I can sync my desktop from my laptop using the Desktop App, lay in bed, and undergo additional I.T. training as if Im sitting on a computer and studying. This thing is freaking awesome! 

Ive had this since the end of march and the more I use it, the more Im realizing its capabilites.

Santa got this for my 16 y/o son. I don't have much experience in VR, but this system blows me away. The controls are tricky to get used to, especially for the kiddos who are used to XBox controllers. If you have a weak stomach, you might not want to dive too deep. The tutorial was enough for me. Besides, just watching someone else do it is hilarious. For the price, whether it's the 64 ($299) or the 256 ($399), it would've been nice if it had at least ONE game included.

Great purchase! I had it shipped to my house without any problem. I got notified ahead of time letting me know when it would be delivered so it didn’t get stolen off my porch! Yay! In my opinion, The Quest 2 is way better than the Original Quest, with the exception of the controller button pad having the circle shape vs. teardrop shape on the original. The bigger circular pads keep you from being able to fully wrap your thumb around the controller. It only allows you to rest your thumb on top of the button pad next to the buttons, which makes it feel like you don’t have a solid grip when playing games where you want to swing the controllers as hard as you can (like Echo Arena). But, they do have better haptic feedback so it’s a trade off I guess. The headset is awesome though. It’s lighter, has better graphics, and better audio.

I love my quest 2 and the fact you can communicate with others on the game system meet new people etc. You can travel everywhere do just about anything without leaving your home. I really enjoy it. The only problem I have is the headset straps hurt my head and gave me an headache so I can to purchase a different head gear from Amazon to make it comfortable also the games can be a bit pricey games range from 9.99 to about 40 dollars. Sometimes the games go on sale or have a bundle packs. You will need to purchase a extra battery to keep the vr charge if you want to play longer. Other than that I love it!

I own the First Oculus Quest 128GB and Bought this Oculus Quest 2 256GB for My Girlfriend. I was Curious to See how much better it was compared to mine. It is a Noticeable Difference. The Visual Quality is Much more Sharper and Clear. The System Seems to Load a bit Faster as well. It is Very Nice! I'm jealous. But, I like My Black Quest Better because I Modded it with the Deluxe Audio Strap from HTC. Plus, the White makes it look like it is for a Girl. 
My Girlfriend Loves it! She Mainly uses it for Exercise. Fit VR is here go to game. She is Happy! Which makes me Happy with My Purchase. Also, 256GB is Actual only 238GB due to OS installed. So imagine how much memory the 64GB Version actually has...? Probably 40GB Something to Consider if you plan on putting a lot of Games on it. Overall, it is Awesome! You will be Happy with it. See you in VR i'll probably be in the Casino playing Texas Hold Em' poker in "Pokerstars VR"

Bought two of these because why not! It’s so fun playing games with my wife, it brings everyone together, I’m a VR lifestyle for life! The battery could use some work but with these extra battery packs on the head straps I purchased separately, it improved it, I have a lot of games downloaded already (32) and I still have so much storage space.

After waiting several years to jump into VR, this seemed like the right time to do it. First I have to say I am glad I got the 256 GB version, just for future proofing capacity. After using this unit for around 200 hours or so already, it is awesome fun. I had several friends get one as well, and we have had a riot playing mini golf, fishing, shooting Zeds.. playing Steam games , you name it... Using the link cable for steam works perfect. FYI I am using a very fast Desktop computer setup to play Steam games. I will say that getting the VR legs took a little bit of time, but doesn't bother me any longer. This thing is great.. if you are on the fence on getting VR, this is a great value, and works very well. I also got the elite head strap, and with the problems that were reported, i can say that mine is still fine. I have added an external 10,000Mah battery pack with a couple velcro straps that brings the battery life to 6-8 hours easily. Get one.

Amazing. 

I owned the original rift and being untethered is just amazing! Now if there were only more games and I had an empty room for roomscale it would be perfect.

Also get yourself a Vive digital audio strap from HTC, frankenquest adapter from Etsy, replacement face from vrcover and halo and grips from vrcover.

As soon as I put that thing on it was a beast. Played onward and all other games flawlessly! I tried out the 90hz worked great! The strap on the headset though it took me like 20 minutes to get a good fit but after that it was great! I would recommend this headset to anyone! The controllers also feel so good to hold.

The Oculus Quest 2 (256) GB storage is highly recommended because if you plan on purchasing lots of games this is the best way to go. The games are not very large to install. But I’m one of those kind of people that like to make sure I don’t run out of storage space.

Overall a good step forward but they cut corners in my opinion compared to version 1. Much prefer the cloth exterior, as well as the wider adjustment option for eye distance. In addition, I think going from 2 panel OLED to single panel LCD was a step backwards, regardless of the increase to resolution. The room headset also sits a little too close to the eyes so everything is very tight. Facebook would have been better off charging a little bit more instead of cutting corners to keep the price down. 

However, with faster refresh, higher resolution, and much more power this is a well worth while upgrade. Just understand the new “don’t have’s”

I've been exploring worlds and experiencing thing most people haven't seen. I actually built a world from the ground up with my hands. I've fought invaders to our kingdom with a bow and arrow. I've battled alongside aliens to defeat those who wished to destroy us. In my free time, I like to hang out above the earth and look down on the beautiful landscape it offers. 

Those who actually know me understand that everything i said just now is out of character for me, but I started playing the oculus quest (again out of character for me) and I honestly have a hard time putting it down.  

I've interacted with people all over the world, even in these difficult times, and met some great people in this virtual world. I don't write product reviews much, but I believe this system is breaking barriers that social media and other gaming systems have not been able to ( Facebook owns oculus and you have to have a Facebook account to play). 

I am so happy I stumbled across this,  especially in the midst of a pandemic. It truly brings me joy every time I use it.

I upgraded to this VR from the Samsung Gear VR since Oculus stopped supporting the Gear VR and so far I am very happy with this purchase. Exploring the VR environment is smooth as well as gameplay. Navigation takes some getting used to but not difficult at all. I really appreciate the ability to set room or spatial boundaries which will help you avoid bumping into things. I recommend getting the Population: One game which introduces new movement and mechanics in gameplay, overall a very fun game. The only small grip I have with the Quest 2 is that the battery only lasts about 2 hours of constant use, but maybe that's not such a terrible thing.

I really like the Quest 2 compared to the Oculus Rift S. It's more comfortable and you can move the lenses left or right. I gave it three stars though because it's not truly wireless like i thought it was going to be. Upon receiving it, I thought I would be able to play all the games I bought on steam or on the Oculus Rift S. This kind of wasn't the case. You can't play your games wirelessly unless you buy the Virtual Desktop, which is $20, and download a few things on your computer to connect the Vr too and then you will be able to play those games. Also, the head straps are super annoying, but other than that, It's really good for the price.

Plenty of apps. 
Operating system is updatable.
Adjustable lens for my big head.
Battery last a long time. Similar battery life of a iPad. 

Charges with USB c so it charges fast.
Had it less than two months and three yellow dots were on the screen that wouldn’t go away. Kept it stored in my room on an open shelf. Never dropped. Very well taken care of.
Great Wireless V.R ever. I had fun playing with it on the holidays and great specs for the money. I would highly recommend it for somebody for getting in V.R.
I never thought I would like VR, but after testing out a friends I knew I had to get one. The games, interactive videos, the future is limitless. A must own

The only experience I had with VR before this was the PSVR I bought for my PS4 a few years ago... so I wasn't expecting much from this.  Wow... I was amazed at the difference.  This is LIGHT YEARS ahead of the PSVR, and has the ability to play QUEST optimized games wirelessly, or play PCVR games as well with Oculus link!  This is a no brainer, especially for the price.  There are issues people have with requiring a facebook login to use one of these, and I understand, by the online privacy boat sailed a long time ago for me so I don't have any issues there myself.
This was my first vr head set and I love it this thing is so freaking cool!!

The graphics are better than my previous VR headset Oculus Rift. I also bought the link cable to be able to play games that are for Oculus Rift. You can purchase an app VR Desktop that lets you play Oculus Rift games without any wires and anywhere in wifi range but batteries last about 4 hours of play time this is just an estimate haven't really timed it. the link cable which is about $75 keeps the battery charged while playing. I have really liked the Oculus Quest 2 no sensors, no wires, play anywhere, better graphics, words look better, games play fine with Link Cable or VR Desktop. Started ALYX-HALF LIFE with Oculus Rift but it died so I purchased the Oculus Quest 2 and cable link and the game looked and played better with the Quest2 and then I purchased the app VR Desktop and it played ALYX-HALF LIFE without any problems or use of link cable. I am glad in a way that my rift died because the Quest2 has been so much better to play and use.I would recommend the Quest2 with the link or the app VR desktop because there are so many more games to play. I have a I7-7700K with 32GB Ram and 2 NVIDIA 1070 Graphics cards and i am enjoying playing Medal Of Honor Above And Beyond with the Oculus Quest 2 and the VR Desktop app

We are enjoying this VR. Myself and my two children. Although I wanted to get the 64 gig one, They did not have it and I was forced to buy the 256 gig one.
I really love the VR gaming it is for sure a new way to game and interact with others that was never possible before at such a low price point.
I think the head set needs a little improvement the strap is a big PIA, I am really looking forward to the next one that comes out.  By then I think the small bugs and glitches will be figured out and the platform will also have a ton of more games. It dose get quite expensive to buy the games and have this fee and that fee for this and that.

We bought this for our son for his birthday. Easy to set-up.  The one thing that I thought that should have been advertised is that it requires a Facebook acct. to play.  with our son only being 15 we haven't allowed him to have one. so we now have it linked to my acct.  but aside from that.  we have a blast playing with it.  it's fun.  depending on the game you are playing depends on the amount of battery life you have.  but with constant play, again depending on the game can last 2-5 hours.  headset is comfortable once adjusted to your head.  I would recommend the bigger GB of the 2 options.  especially if you are wanting purchase a lot of games.

I think everything I could say about this product has already been said countless times over. However, I will anyway. This product is the best entry level VR experience. The controllers feel amazing in the hand and the tracking is superb. Ive used and have a PSVR and when I switched on the quest for the first time, I was amazed by the quality and stereo sound. It was enhanced by knowing that it is an all in one product that is portable and doesn’t need to be connected to a computer or use a wire that you can get tangled in. Having used VR before, I was still amazed and if you have never experienced VR, your mind will explode. Great price and quality.

This is my second Oculus (I also have the Oculus Go) and this one is really amazing. The controls seem awkward at first but once you get used to them, they are easy to work with. I do recommend buying some grips to add to them to better secure them to your hands. I purchased some on Amazon that were $15 that work great. The headset is a bit heavier but stays on well. The overall experience compared to the Go is outstanding. It’s so much better being able to use both hands and you really feel immersed in the games. Saber is awesome, if you’re looking for somewhere to start. Highly recommend this Oculus if you’re looking for a great wireless VR option.

I will say I bought this on impulse and boredom because they didn't have any PS5's but it was a purchase I don't regret.  I think I have had every game system that has come out throughout the years but this VR system takes gaming and entertainment to a whole different level.  

My first game was Real VR Fishing and I was in awe with the realism of this game. I spent 2 hours and 15 minutes playing this game when I downloaded it. 

My only issue is the strap that came with it.  I was getting headaches after about the second day but decided to buy a new headstrap from Amazon and let me tell you...…What a big difference!!! It feels more secure and not so heavy on my face.  

I also bought a new blue silicone cover mask for sanitary reasons.

Very fun; easy my boyfriend and I love it. Only reason I knocked off a star is because battery life. It lasts maybe 2 hours of play time and then it’s dead and needs to go on the charger. I know there’s additional things you can purchase to make the battery last longer. But as far as just this item goes, it’s one of my only complaints. 
Also, I love how I am able to play this with my glasses on. That is definitely a great perk!
We bought multiple games for it right away from the oculus app and have been in love since. Can’t wait to get accessories to help with battery life so we can play it longer than a couple of hours at a time.

Overall- it’s an improvement on the already great Quest product line. The inclusion of a higher resolution display and support for WiFi-6 was reason enough for me to upgrade. Others may take issue with the Facebook requirement, the switch to an LCD screen from OLED, and the 3 choice IPD adjustment (rather than the slider on the original Quest), but the price to quality ratio makes this a no brainer for anyone looking for their first VR headset. It’s a wonderful all in one, stand-alone experience, but couple it with a capable PC and you’re ready to go toe to toe with headsets 3 times the price. If you’ve read this much just BUY IT!

Intense! This all-in-one VR set comes readily equipped with everything you need to play. Picked it up on launch day and the only time I'm forced to put it down is when the charge runs dry because I can't stop playing. No wires, no towers, no ridiculous setup, just a headset and two well-designed controllers. This is one of the most cost-efficient and comfortable VR headsets currently on the market, and the upgrades from the original Quest to the Quest 2 make it my overall favorite at the moment. Highly recommend for anyone looking to enjoy some casual VR gaming sessions or even some heavy use on multiple days throughout the week.

Nothing was wrong with this thing, and it seems to work as designed but we just couldn’t get into playing it.  All games are online and cost 40 or more bucks for decent ones.  All the cheap games look and feel cheap.  Although I did enjoy playing the star-wars games and paintball in hangout.  Just got sick after playing for more than 30 mins.  My wife nor myself suffer from motion sickness and have been on many cruises and boats with no issues.  This thing would make us sick though.  Just weird to play.   We also could never get the oculus perfectly adjusted and it was always a little blurry especially when looking to the far corners while playing a game.

This headset is pretty nice, stock strap isn't the most comfortable but with the Elite Strap its very nice. The speakers are fine but the experience gets even better with headphones for earbuds. Battery life is okay for the average user but if you are a person who plays for hours and hours at a time, i recommend either a battery bank or the Elite Strap with battery. The quality of the screen is also great, its crisp enough for games and movies. The storage that i have bought is the 256 GB but this is not at all necessary, the 64 GB version is enough for up to 10 or more games and some Photos or Videos. All in all its one of the best headsets for its price.

For the price point, this is one of the best bang for buck products you can buy. There are countless free games to spend hours in. The average game price is about 20 USD so getting a decent collection of game won't break the bank! There are a ton of accessories available to customize and make the experience most comfortable to you. My only complaint is the battery life which is about 2 hours and the time to charge is about 2 hours. But, that is expected with something this powerful in a wireless package. Easily fixable with a 25$ battery bank that you can put in your pocket. I play for 4-5 hours at a time with no battery drain.

My first experience with VR was with Samsung. IT'S really amazed at how far VR has come when I got my Oculus. You are brought into another world where things are so close you can touch them. The Oculus is clear and sharp and you can use it with glasses. I first bought the 64gb version but discovered I really needed more space. So I gave it to my sister and bought the 256gb version. I would say if you plan to do any gaming you should go for the larger memory. This headset is well made, sturdy and does all it claims. I was able to purchase this with a lease which didn't cost much because I paid it off on the third payment. You can't get anymore real than this.

I have the oculus go and we upgraded to the oculus quest 2.  It’s definitely more fun and interactive. My only real complaints as it stands are.

1.) I wish there were some sort of detachable face guards.  When we play as a family games like say, Beat Saber, it’s really gross swapping the VR as the foam just soaks up any sweat. I put it on after the next person and it’s just sopping with sweat. Gross. There’s no way to wipe it off. I’m reluctant to purchase any work out games for this reason. 

2.) I wish it was easier to adjust to fit your head. More difficult on heads with long hair as you have to grab and pull to adjust and hair gets pulled along with it.

It's horribly uncomfortable unless you drop another hundred or so dollars on it. You have to be attached to Facebook, so if something happens to login or account your SOL. Playing games on this vs. the PSVR really shows it's pitfalls. It can't keep track of hand movements, so when playing Beat Saber or other games that require lots of hand and arm movement, you'll just lose

Facebook doesn't offer giftcards, so gifting kids the ability to buy things on their own isn't possible. The Oculus is pointless. Just buy a PS then get the PSVR...it's the exact same cost when you factor in all the extra accessories you have to by just to make the Oculus Quest 2 workable

My first VR headset, and I must say it's incredible.  A ton of free immersive content to watch and you can't go wrong with the must have "Beat Saber" game.  At times, I just take a break and get on to sink to the bottom of the ocean and watch some sting rays for a few minutes to clear my mind and then get back to work!
Takes some fiddling with the straps to get the right fit, and the battery has been lasting around 2-2.5 hrs.  I[m looking forward to higher resolution in future models, but the built in speakers are extremely crisp and clear, and i haven't found the need to use any headphones yet.
Wish I had gotten this sooner.

The Quest 2 is necessary equipment as escaping reality has been fantastic for both my mental health and physical fitness. Being wireless and not needing a PC takes away some huge barriers to VR. Add in the facts that you can use a stationary or adjustable guardian and that most games are cheap and it’s no wonder this is the VR set to buy right now. Some downsides are that your face rests on foam that is a sweat sponge and don’t expect great battery life if you just play games that use lots of rumble and tracking, but even without using this for exercise there is a ton to see in VR. I must highly recommend the Quest even though a Facebook account is mandatory.

Best purchase I have ever made! I bought 2 then ended up buying 2 more for my kids. You really do feel like you're in the headset. It's amazing!!! I will buy more later on for sure. I myself need one. I'm always using my kids Oculus 2. The only reason why I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is because the battery drains quick. Last about an hour to 2 hours. Then after 10 minutes of using it my cheek hurts so much. The Oculus is heavy so it weighs down on your cheek area adding pressure to your sinus areas. I also would like for Oculus to create a family account so I won't be buying the game 3× on each headset. Most games are $15-$50.

I am returning the Quest 2. After 17 days of use, I’m officially calling it...Quest 1 is the better headset for graphics handling and overall performance. The Quest 2 has twice the memory capacity yet it lagged while playing Beat Saber. It was even worse when I tried to play SURV1V3 (link cable), I thought it was caused by my PC that’s running a NVIDIA GeForce 2060 graphics card. I tried to problem solve it without success until I switched to my Quest 1. That solved the problem. I played SURV1V3 without any lag. The unit overall is cheaply made, the eye width adjustment went from 10 sizes to only 3. The resolution is slightly better but with the lag it’s moot.

The quality of the physical product seems great, but the app you need to use the product is terrible. Support for the product is even worse. I’ll own this for less than 24 hours. Picked it up at 7pm. I’ll be first in line at Best Buy at the store in the morning to return it. Found all the bad reviews for trying to get logged in while searching for a solution. Tech support did the typical delete and reinstall the app - and then gave up.

It literally spins the wheel of login death for as long as you’ll keep the app open…

Best purchase every! So Many awesome games. Never experienced VR and this is more than what I expected. One thing I do recommend is to purchase the separate head piece. The one it comes with makes the headset heavy on your head. But once we purchased the separate head piece it was way more comfortable. 
There’s many free downloadable games and many great deals. Regular game price run from 30-50$ most are about 30$. 
Definetly recommend can’t wait for friends and family to get on board with VR so we can try multiplayer options and interact virtually! 
This has really kept us entertained during this pandemic and cold weather.

A noticeable improvement in visual sharpness/clarity over previous models. I do miss the inky blacks of OLED screens, but the tradeoff in clarity is worth it, I think. Text is easier to read, which is huge in games like Elite Dangerous, where you're in a cockpit reading various panels.

I've had a bit of trouble with tracking in low-light. I didn't realize that was the problem at first, so be sure to play with enough ambient light that your hands don't "disappear" and go flying all over the room in the middle of your gaming session.

I wish it weren't white, though. White can get dirty easily and the headband isn't something you can toss in the washing machine.

I don't get much time to use the Oculus Quest 2, but occasionally hit up some beat saber. My kiddos have been putting time every day after finishing homework. The performance and power is impressive, no issues with any of the hardware.

Removed one star due to requirement to utilize Facebuukz account. Also, it behooves me as to why there are no gift card options to buy at retail stores for purchases to be made in the Oculus marketplace. 

P.S. I haven't purchased any Meta real estate yet, as I envisage this technology has alot of room to grow and improve over the next 5-10 years. For now, the experiences had in VR are a fun little novelty to kill some time with.

This thing is truly amazing and a total blast. It was a great pick me up for the whole family with everything going on. 

Setup is fairly easy, but you do need a Facebook account. The system creates a virtual barrier in any space to keep you from running into things and you can use this anywhere. No Tv or cables required. 

Games range from $10-30, but there is also a good deal of free content out there too. 

The one thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars is the strap. I highly suggest getting the Pro Strap that Oculus makes, but it really should come standard. 

Overall it’s a lot of fun and a great time for the family.

I highly recommend this to any family who enjoys gaming.  We especially enjoy it as it's convenient to set up and play quickly.  

The available VR video and games are simply something to marvel.  I have to remind myself often that I am standing on solid ground and not to worry about my VR surroundings.   

Set-up was a breeze.  Also, I can put it on and be playing my favorite game within a couple of minutes.  

We also see many exciting possibilities.  Our next will be to utilize it for VR softball hitting by our daughters.  

Whether golf, bowling, table tennis, or arcade games, there seems to be something for everybody.

Pre-order was easy to set up. Pick up from store was really quick and easy. 

The oculus quest 2 itself is amazing. Out of the box it is comfortable compared to the original oculus quest. The controllers are slightly larger, easier to hold, the battery “door” doesn’t slide off while playing intense games and the battery usage is far less in comparison to the quest 1. 

This is the best option if your looking to get into VR as it doesn’t require a PC but you can link it to a pc or even play pc games wirelessly if you have the proper set up and do some research. 

The Quest 2 is really easy to set up and use just make sure your IPD won’t be an issue as the IPD settings are the only thing that has been down graded in my personal opinion in comparison to the original oculus quest.

I bought this as a fun way to spend time with my kids and am amazed at how much I enjoy it. It is not a graphical powerhouse... but that doesn't matter. The freedom of movement without worrying about a wire tether to a PC is a game-changer. It is a fun glimpse into what the future of VR/AR holds as the tech will undoubtedly shrink in size while growing in power and function. I strongly recommend the 256GB version as 64GB just isn't enough space for a meaningful amount of apps. Superhot, Supernatural, I Expect You To Die, and Pistol Whip are all apps I recommend purchasing immediately. If you're on the fence, just buy it.

I have every oculus headset sold and this one is the smallest. I have a 7 5/8 head and the sides push in against my temple/outer eye (I am not overweight) Picture is great, however, form factor for larger heads is in need of some modifications. If there is a remedy for this please let me know. It’s not as comfortable to play when it doesn’t fit your face. See attached picture which shows the quest and quest 2 nose to nose. Easy to see the difference in width.  I’m keeping it in hopes my face shrinks.

I have a PSVR and the graphics is day and night with this headset. Of course the PSVR is older technology but you can see how far the technology has advanced. Easy to set up and compact compared to other VR headsets. The tracking is great and the app is constantly updating with more games and content. The sound quality on the headset is decent. Volume doesn't go quite as high as I would like but you can opt for headphones and it'll do the job. The glasses spacer is a plus. I wear glasses and this makes wearing the headset much more comfortable. Price point is perfect for what this little thing can do. Highly recommend!

I had the oculus go for a few years, then tried the PS4 VR  (universally a disappointment by the way) and ultimately decided to upgrade to the quest 2. Best VR decision I’ve made so far. The battery life is great, it does not heat up like the go, the apps and features are great, the spatial settings are phenomenal, The optics are amazing and the value is great. I opted for the larger hard drive, and 128 gigs was more than enough to store tons of VR and HD content on it. The proprietary media player isn’t that great, but for $19.99 you can upgrade to Skybox; and really enjoy your own media in style. The browser is great, and tons of free apps to keep you entertained.

Wow. Well I had some money saved up for a PS5.  But I got tired of waiting for it to actually be in stock for more than 47 seconds.  So I got an Oculus instead, especially since I still have my PS4.  This is a whole new world.  It is my first experience with VR.  I get motion sickness on some 3D video rides at Disney and Universal.  So far I have had zero with the OQ2.  Granted I don't have any games with a lot of motion.  But the games I do have, Vader Immortal, Beat Saber and Counter Strike are all really fun.  It is especially cool standing in front of a towering 3D Vader.  If you a fed up with waiting for a PS5...get this instead!!  It is a fantastic alternative.

Bought an OC2 with protection 2 month's ago and so far so good. 
It fits comfortably without having to buy another strap.
The sound is nice. 
There are a goos bit of different games. Some are free and some you have to play.  If you don't like the game you can get a refund. So that's a plus.
The only downfall is you can only play like max of 2 hours. The battery doesn't last too long. You can buy a longer charger but its recommended to use the one that came with your oculus.  Guess your not really suppose to game for too long with them. 
But all in all, id recommend to anyone who doesn't get motiom sickness too much. If you do you can always take motion sickeness pill.

I preordered the 256GB unit along with the pro headstrap with battery. This is not my first set of VR goggles I also have the PSVR with ps4 pro system. Dont get me wrong I love the quest 2 its a great piece of technology but its not the huge advancement over the PSVR I was hoping for. The quest controls blow the PSVR controls away. The quest screen also is an improvement over the PSVR. But with the PSVR I can play large games like star wars squadrons where the quest really cannot unless you have a gaming PC to plug the quest into which I dont unfortunately I have a iMac. Its fun though and I can recommend the quest 2

Its pretty good.  better than my old GO, including lighter weight.  I'm very disappointed that they decided not to allow old go games to run.  I still run Defense Grid 2 on my go since its not available on the quest 2.  It will be good to see how it runs once it gets the speed boost next year.  So far i'm very disappointed in the lack of seated games i can run.  Finger tracking works but is a little glitchy but for simple things like watching media, its a lot simpler than grabbing the controllers.  Its just disappointed that the only programs available are the bigger budget games and are all seem to be standing only.

I am what they would say a Tech fanatic. Business & Personal. I love Best Buy because from Purchases, Warranty to Geek Squad they never disappointed me yet in the last 10 years of me living in Florida and purchasing Tv, Washers, Freezers, Computers, Printers, Cell Phones, to my new gaming Oculus and Samsung Galaxy Watch 2. I am really enjoying and learning the service with these two purchases. The price was price comparable with other companies and the staff was awesome with explaining and helping me to start up these products. These employees should be paid a commission for their knowledge, customer service and sales  experience because your team members are awesome.

WOW!!!  My wife and I are 60, haven't had this much fun on TV in years. We went with the $400 unit, Quest 2, 256k instead of the $300, 64k, more room to download.  Easy to hook up, many choice of games. We purchased the Epic Roller Bundle immediately, $20, love it.  So far we're up to $100 in purchases, our choice, they have Free games too.  The vision is Fantastic, feels like you're in the mix.
Imagine the movie, Total Recall.  
Best purchase I've made since buying her wedding ring. lol

I have owned several VR headsets including the DK2, Oculus 1st gen, and the Samsung Odyssey and this is VR realized. The set was easy to set up and get working. 
Build and Design:
I found the set to be comfortable and I have a huge head, 7 5/8 military hat size. The straps are easy to adjust so you can switch between myself and my son.
The battery last only 2 1/2 hours, but I uses it mostly connected to my pc with link.
The screen is clear and immersive with almost no screen door effect. The only issue is a rather small viewing angle. If you are looking at something no directly in front of you than it can be kinda blurry.
Overall this is the standard for VR going forward.

WOW!  This is so much fun!  When my son asked for this for Christmas I didn't know that the whole family would get so much use out of it.  He uses it to play games. I use it for exercise games and to tour places.  I took a walk down Mainstreet in Disney World just the other day and then a ride on Splash Mountain.  It feels like you are there!  We bough a Google Chromecast with it so the whole family can watch what is going on The only faults that I find with it is that you can't try 95% of the games before you buy them. Even a short demo would be so nice and the fact that you have to tie it to a facebook account.

Hmm.. Honestly there is a lot of to be said.
Not very comfortable. Quality of control problematic. 
Software there are many issues. Limited types of use - not enough educational apps. No 3D movies in app. Some issues with uploading, choppy... Expensive apps. Narrow field of view, but there is no alternative for stand alone (no computer needed) 3D headset. Reasonable price. 
Biggest con is poor battery life. 
Yet it is still so new technology, but for those who are willing to compromise for progresse join our community, things are getting better. Definitely view some reviews online before buying
There are better straps, and battery packs can be bought from Oculus directly.

So far, so good. I upgraded from the Rift that I purchased 2 years ago, and I was afraid that this was going to be a cheaper, less substantial version designed to appeal to kids and casual users. However, I have been continually impressed by the quality and redesign. The construction is solid, the display is noticeably improved, and the hand tracking works perfectly without the external sensors. I use the link cable to connect to my PC for larger games, but there is a ton of content that doesn't require it at all. It's WAY more comfortable to use to watch movies and even browse the internet. I'd give it a perfect 5 stars if it weren't for the mandatory Facebook integration.

Bought it for my son. I've only used it a couple of times and was pleasantly surprised that it didn't give me a headache. 3D movies give me a headache and make me nauseated.

My son says the graphics are good and the game play is good, the play is smooth. The headset is comfortable but slightly too big for his adolescent head. He said the sound is good. The controllers are easy to figure out and comfortable to hold. Even the grandparents were able to enjoy a game of Beat Saber. He's satisfied with the battery life. He only has a few games so far but he enjoys them. I appreciate that you can create your barrier.

As someone new to VR, a review is tough.  I really don't have anything to compare to.  There's a huge shell shock as you dive into the 3D world, really got to experience this in MSFS 2020.  So take my review with a grain.  Build quality is great, lightweight. Optics are 4/5.  Which there was better quality lenses. OS is fast.  Setting up was a little tough when trying to connect this thing with PC.  Couple hours of browsing the net and YouTube videos.  But once you get everything honed in, this thing is amazing. Not a fan that you have to have a facebook account to use this product.  Overall experience is good.

My rating for the Oculus quest 2. The only thing this thing has going for it is it's wireless The graphics are not very good at all Even when you hook it up to the PC they are not very good at all. I bought six game for this thing and every one of them look the same The only one that actually looked any good was the Star wars game and I'm just assuming that was because it was made by a company that actually had a lot of money to put into it but the graphics were still not like they should be for our time that were in for gaming at the moment. Now the fact that it's wireless that was awesome I wish the PlayStation would figure it out for their VR system and do it wirelessly.

Excellent if you need a portable VR system. Battery life is pretty decent and this is amazing cord free solution. Can be paired to PC with link cable but I have not tried that. Screen door effect is very good in terms of being less noticeable. Personally I enjoy the HTC Vive more, however if you need a cable free system this would be the best solution. This system is less powerful if you do not link to PC, but that is an option as well so give it a shot. Awesome entry level VR for certain games. VR Chat needs a lot of processing power though and you do not get the full experience with this headset unlinked.

Great for quick, on time delivery. Took off 3 stars because the delivery person put it on my porch and walked away- didn't ring doorbell or knock. The package was left on my porch with the word OCULUS showing so big that you could see it from the street! If we didn't have an Echo Show, I would not have known it was there. That could have been a $400 porch pirate's dream! I indicated online that I was purchasing as a gift! My daughter saw the package on the Echo Show in the kitchen and had to block the screen from my husband. 

Also, since purchased as a Christmas gift I cannot comment on the actual product.

These things are so amazing, well worth the 300 for the 64g and 400 for the 256g.  The battery power isn't great but 2-3 of play is impressive concidering it's an untethered standalone vr kit and the ability to attach to a pc for pcvr games is great! Most games are about $15 and there's tons of free content and ways to get cheap and free games. Logging into FB is a drawback but not worth complaining about since it doesn't make you do anything but use your FB to login. You can choose a username in-game so there's no way anyone can find you if you don't want them to.  Much better than the psvr and untethered to boot can't say enough about how great this is especially for the price

For myself the OQ2 is near perfect. Maybe I am easily amused, but the entire family is fighting over using it. Easy to set up and pretty self explanatory through the tutorials. Not complicated, not heavy, doesn't slip or move around on my head/face... And the sound quality along with the visuals 'WoW' is all I can say. Battery life has been longer than expected. Overall very pleased. Now, more importantly, when does Sims come out for VR? Lol

Me and my roommate split this system because we got bored while quarantined. It’s a lot of fun, although I got bored with it quickly. There wasn’t enough variety on the oculus game store to keep me entertained for hours on end. Games are also a little expensive for what you get (sometimes). Some games are packed with content, others are short and have virtually no reason for you to play it again so do your research before you buy a game. 

There is something for everyone though. Ping pong, shooters, a battle royale game, poker etc. 

I HATE the fact that you must use your Facebook account to even use it.

I have been using this headset a few Months
Pro: the quality is amazing if you have been waiting for VR quality to get better before getting into it this is a product for you.
The controllers feel good in your hands.
It captures your hand movements amazingly with the controllers
You can change to controller free controlling which still works great in tracking your hand and fingers
I promise, try it and you will not regret it.

I use this for both entertainment and business.
With apps like Immersion, we hold meetings and share desktops

Con: it is a bit front heavy. but not so much as to strain your neck

We are having so much fun with this Quest 2 VR!! With the use of a chromecast, we are able to cast what the player sees to the TV so everyone can see. There is a slight delay but it is still a great benefit.  I just wish that you could use a roku, firestick or other device besides just the chromecast.  
Beat Saber is a must buy game. The entire family is having fun and getting an arm workout!  Other virtual "experiences" we have tried so far include a shooting range and roller coasters. The range was absolutely fun! The roller coasters take a bit to get used to. 
Overall this is so much fun. I think my adult brothers all want one now after playing with my son's at Christmas.  Haha.

Honest review! The oculus is pretty awesome! What wasn’t so awesome was the fact that it died within a month of having it. That being said normally I don’t buy the Best Buy warranty on things I buy there but something told me to just get it and I’m soooo glad I did! After my oculus would no longer work correctly we took it to Best Buy with my receipt showing I had the warranty on it and absolutely no questions were asked they replaced it and I could have gotten my money back after that but decided to keep the warranty because who knows, right? So I’m giving five stars because the customer service was amazing and overall when the oculus is working properly, it too is pretty amazing!

Purchased this as a gift and was able to use it firsthand as well. While not impressed with some apps the overall picture quality is OK, depending on the app/source of the file.

The immersiveness is also left up to what app you are using, some do it better than others. As being one of the popular VR headsets out there, the accessories available are endless and some are must have particularly those that offer longer battery life.

The battery life will deplete depending on how intensive the experience is. I would also suggest you wait prior to purchasing this if you do not wish to you use a Facebook account. 

META has stated that they will cease this requirement sometime next year.

Love this thing. I now own the Rift (cv1) the original Quest and Quest 2. I was worried that it might not be worth the cost to upgrade, however between the larger storage size, much better screens, faster processor, it feels much lighter and doesnt stick out as far from your face and the ability to get the Elite strap with battery (just looks better than having a battery pack strapped onto the back of my Quest 1) it was well worth it. I would definitely tell you to buy either the elite strap or the elite strap with battery though, the included strap is actually worse than every 'pro' review I've read. For 50$-130$ (depending on if you get the battery and case) it really is worth it.

Super fun device! My kids love Beat Saber and they get a serious, sweaty workout while playing it. Glad we went with the version with highest RAM to have plenty of future game storage. It's well built and designed. The graphics perform lag free and it's fun to cast to the TV and see what they see.  Only drawback is I'm not a fan of the invasive information capture and data mining for which Facebook admittedly uses this device.  But, like any other "smart" device that listens to everything we do, there are ways to work around that and making sure that it's turned completely off when not actively in use.

This headset is great but the strap provided is virtually worthless. My son says the unit flops all over  his head making it not fun at all. We have ordered the upgraded band, but it's out of stock for another month, so my son's Christmas present is sitting unused. It seems ridiculous that such an expensive product doesn't come with a functional essential part (especially after also spending an extra $80 for a cord to hook up his PC, and another $100 to increase storage because there's no slot for a memory card). By the time we've upgraded everything, we may as well have purchased the much better HTC.

I love my new Quest 2 headset! Nothing beats the wireless gaming capabilities. I've been playing VR for 3 years, and this is by far the best experience. Connecting with the Link cable allows play of PC VR games. Graphics are amazingly clear, and the spatial sound is nice. Adding on a custom built set of earphones completes the experience. Doesn't get any better than Wireless VR play! 10 out of 10 would recommend.

The Quest works incredibly well, especially for the price. I would recommend paying extra for the larger hard drive, though. Oculus continues to release new and exciting games for the Quest 2 and you don't want to have to be constantly checking your hard drive space. Oculus link works decently enough, but I'd honestly recommend skipping it entirely and using the third party program Virtual Desktop. The battery runs down very quickly and that's about the only real issue I have with it. I do think they should have included the Link cable as a standard though instead of charging an arm and a leg for it.

Visual quality as a wireless device is just amazing. Battery lasts as long as I need it to. I do find it gets warm on my face and eventually uncomfortable to wear well before the battery drains. 

There have been so many updates to the software since I bought it that the value just keeps increasing. Now hand tracking?? That wasn't even on my radar as a possibility when I bought it.

My daily computer is a Mac, so it doesn't work with this for the PC based games you can wirelessly link to it of course, so haven't tried that (another new feature), but have been happy with what I can do out of the box.

I bought this for my wife for Christmas and she loves it...the kids love it...I love it...great technology and everyone enjoys playing. our only gripe is I bought her games as well...but I can't give them to her. We can't transfer them to her. I had to create an account to buy the games and she obviously didn't have an account until after Christmas. Only thing we could do is get a refund on my purchase and then purchase under her account, but they won't honor the black Friday deal I used. Only one account per device, I could login but would have to wipe it to do so. They need to get better at this.

Fun gadget, Facebook account is required unfortunately. So you’ll have to have an FB account and need to store a credit card info as well. I’m a bit apprehensive about these but there’s no going around it. This is the only disadvantage. 

Graphics are great, but I have to keep adjusting the head strap so i can have it in an angle with a clear view. Probably need to buy accessories to resolve that. 

Still learning this thing, lots of games available but very expensive. Only a few ones that are in the $10 range, most are at the $30-$40 range. If you’re big on games, these costs will accumulate fast.

I'm new to the world of VR, but what a great introduction. The headset is well made, the resolution is good and the sound is excellent. One must have a facebook account, which I didn't like, but went ahead and created one. During these times of staying home a lot, there are all kinds of things to do and experience. Good exercise games, mini-golf and there is a Venue where I saw the Dalai Lama up close with my daughter "standing" next to me in the theatre. Pretty wild. One kid came up to me in that world and was flirting, but disappeared when I told him I'm old enough to be his grandmother. Hahah!

This thing is loads of fun. Now is a great time to jump into the VR world if it is something that you are interested in. I probably could have gotten by with the cheaper version and would have got that if I had done a little research but its not a big deal. The battery life sucks though and you will need the elite strap kit but knowing both of those things if I had it to do over, I would have gotten the cheaper quest and ordered the elite strap/external battery combo. Instead I bought the 256gb and the elite strap without the battery. I will end up buying the battery strap down the road I'm sure.

I love this oculus. It is easy to set up. It is light weight and it looks nice. Once you see into it, it's so amazing. The picture is great, feels like you are there. I love playing games on it. What I love is that you are not just sitting in a chair/couch when playing. You are moving around, and you just get more into the game. Has a lot of cool free stuff and a lot of awesome games to buy, from zombies to workout games to kids games for the kiddos. I have also "visited" Paris, Barcelona, Africa, and many other places and it feels like I'm there.  I'm so glad I purchased it. Especially since covid, it has been my fix for travel n experiencing something new from the comfort of my own home.

As someone who has had almost every headset and currently still have a Valve Index for "serious VR gaming", the Quest 2 gets far more use around the house. The ease of setting up boundaries, double tap for pass-through without the need for specific USB ports, not having to mess around with the base stations, etc. makes this a great VR headset for daily exercise and travel.  Quite a few great games on there. You can even still play the PC/steam VR games by streaming to your headset using virtual desktop, although usually I will go ahead and set up the Index for something like a simulator or Alyx.

I would give it 6 stars if I could. The headset is comfortable and the controllers are easy to use. I like the fact that all you need is a charger for the headset and batteries for the controllers. No extra wires our game consoles just turn on and play. The walking dead is our favorite game to play and if I had one thing to complain about is that I wish the battery life lasted longer.

I love the oculus ! At first I was a bit hesitant to buy it, but so far I been having a blast. I usually do Super Natural and I can only say that it’s addicting and it really makes me sweat. I still
need to learn a ton about it, so far I have travel around the world, danced and experienced VR movies. I recommend it to anyone that wants to workout at home and experience something new.

I waited a while to review this because I wanted to really have a feel for it...My main reason for buying this was the fact it is a stand alone and I don't have to worry about kids pulling on cords. It has some good games and the graphic are much better than the psvr. The fact you can wear glasses and it doesn't scratch up the lenses is a huge plus too. My biggest issues with Occulus are the weight straining your neck after a while and the battery life on it sucks. After 30 minutes it will be down 30% life. And despite setting it so you have to push the button to turn it on it still seems to activate with motion. So just the slightest motion powers it up and that kills battery life as well.

VR has come along way from the headsets where you pop your phone in them.  I am someone who gets motion sickness on 3d theme park rides, or even real rides, but I don't get sick with this.  You are able to pick experiences/games that are designed to help with motion sickness.  There are some great games and fitness apps, but this is just the beginning of VR for the masses.  Expect more to come.  There are fun free apps and social apps with games.  After owning for a few weeks, I agree with others that a better headset would help, but to start, you're fine, and then decide.  I love working out with this and when my friends get one, we'll meet in Big Screen or VR Fishing and hang out.  LOVE!!

This unit is great. The ability to take it on the go and connect to wifi and your ready to play is amazing. The 256 gig model is great because your not so limited on the collection of games that you can keep, no need to delete some games to make room for the newest title that came out. And at 100$ extra to upgrade from the 64 gig it’s a no brainer. I love that there are no wires to get tangled with. Also the ability to connect to the pc and play some pc games is amazing. The only thing I think could be improved on is the battery life but that’s really the only thing. Overall an amazing product.

I bought this so I could experience VR to view travel videos.  Apparently, because of the limitations with the cameras used to shoot the videos, the video looks slightly blurry.  Hopeully this will change over time as the technology for creating the videos advances.  It feels heavy on my head and if I wear it for too long, it makes my neck sore.  (I am 64)  My 25 year who has another VR really like this one because of the built-in cameras and no wires.  He ran one of his games through it and I have to say, it was a blast.  The graphics on the gaming video were much sharper than the travel ones.

I want sure that this outrigger soups work for a 65 year old grandpa. But I have become convinced that the value of the oculus transcends age. The meditation, yoga and exercise apps are perfect. The opportunity to dungeon crawl with my boys is a great way to stay caught up. And watching streaming shows and regular tv is fantastic.  I'm telling all of my friends to get one.

VR and the Quest 2 is absolutely incredible. I can't say enough good things about it. This is definitely the future of the gaming. I have owned the original Quest 1 and the Quest 2 is just so much better. Its a huge improvement in the looks and performance department and there are already a lot of amazing games with more to come in the future. An absolute must buy!

Fantastic Headset!!  Was very skeptical of buying such a piece of equipment at 67 years of age.  
This was very easy to setup and very entertaining!  Whether you are wanting to play games or watch shows, movies, etc. in a much different and realistic mode, this headset fits the bill!!
My one and only con is the fact that I was not able to connect to my wireless Bluetooth earbuds for better quality sound.  In all fairness the builtin audio is not that bad and other wired earbuds or headsets can be used to cancel outside noise.
I highly recommend this device for the young and the not so young!

The future of gaming, at least for some of the family.  One uses it for her Supernatural fitness daily, another for beatsaber and Kings Spary tagging game (rather it be virtual than real for that theme) and I unfortunately can loose hours in all things immersive, just watching 360 footage of Petra or New York, or Google Earth Virtual, let alone EchoSpace, which feels almost too real!  One family member literally freaked out doing 360 live roller coaster!  We also Tether ours to our computer to take advantage of Steam games and Minecraft and Roblox - which gives those games a whole new life!

This is a good vr headset. It works well stand alone and works well with pc vr gaming. There are several issues with this headset. 
1. You need a fb account to use it.
2. It will always look blurry and there is a strong chromatic aberration in the lenses. You can mess with settings in side quest and the lense positioning but you will never get a crystal clear picture. There are many forums of ppl experiencing the same issue. 
Hopefully this is fixed in a future update if it can be. Otherwise, its better than paying $1k for the index. Also like that its wireless. Best value vr in my opinion.

This thing is incredible!  I believe VR is the future of gaming and social interaction, and this system is a great start.  The Oculus Quest 2 puts you in 3D virtual environments where where the laws of physics may, or may not, apply.  Being part of Facebook, these environments, and games, often incorporate social interactions allowing you to interact with others in your friend list.  I love using it with friends and family.  The systems seamlessly tracks your movements without lag.  The resolution is just ok and lends itself best to avatar style characters.  I'm sure resolution will improve with future hardware versions, but the current resolution is quite usable.  I highly recommend this system,

Great good for kida 14 n up little one can use too depending on what attachments of head set u get great time killer only down side not alot of battery but what u expected from all in one vr headset great connects to pc easily need a facebook account but no problem for those who really dont care games are a bit expensive but worth it u can also return the games u buy its wasy simple to do but it takes two days to get back in your account but have requirements like no more than 2 hr gameplay and withing the first 14 days u can return side note u can buy a portable battery for long gameplay

Absolutely insane… This is like going back 50 years insane to yourself I wonder what the future will look like… When you put these on you are in a different world… A completely different time zone… It is mind-boggling how you are absolutely teleported to another time and space… This is probably the most amazing toy I’ve ever owned… The possibilities are endless with this… And don’t get me started on the roller coaster… I made it to the top and I had to shut it off… My palms were getting sweaty… Most games may not be for kids … But for adults that want to act like kids ...this is a must!!!

Great product . Oculus has done a wonderful job , and I cannot wait to see what the future has in store for this console . Don’t let the Facebook account requirement scare you into not diving into this amazing piece of technology. In my honest opinion this is one of the best game systems out , even tops the series x/ ps5 . Which you also need an account for . The amount your immersed into a game is tripled if not quadrupled . Plus it’s a good way to exercise. One iffy thing is , it’s a lot on the senses , but if you ease yourself into it there shouldn’t be a problem . 10/5 stars by far .

Please do not purchase this.   I feel it is my duty to warn others, so that you will not waste your money.   There is some type of "guardian floor level bug" that makes this inoperable.    Google it- there are threads with customers complaining about this problem and nothing will fix it.   There are so many users that can't use their Quest 2.   These things aren't cheap.  I purchased one for my junior higher for Christmas and he can't even play it.  He got about 2 months of play out of it before it glitched.  So much money lost between the device, the the upgraded strap,  case and games.

The experiences when it works are pretty amazing. It seems to lack processing power or has glitchy software as I have to reboot it occasionally to clear out issues.  Also wished the vinyl cover fit over the foam properly.  I’m glad I bought it and look forward to mastering more songs on expert on beat saber.  Expert plus is insane.

The OQ2 is great fun but unlike any other gaming devise on the market, it lacks the ability to create multiple users to share purchased games.  My kids have to play my games under my account profile so if one progresses further than me I either have to delete their progress or start where they left off. The only way to allow multiple players is if each person creates a Facebook account and buys the games again under their account so we would need to buy one $39 game 3 times.  Who does this? Xbox, PS4 and Switch all have this.  You’d think this would be a given with the OQ2 but it isn’t.

This is my first VR headset. I didn't think much about these kind of set-ups, being a hardcore PC guy. Originally, I thought they were gimicky and a waste of money. Now that I have one, I am truly impressed!

I can't say anything about other VR headsets, but this one rocks! It is very intuitive and easy to manipulate. And I was impressed with the smoothness of the scenes while you float/run/walk/fly through you application.  There are even VR YouTube and AmazonPrime apps!

They only issue I've had so far is getting the headset to fit comfortably. I've been told that most of the "elite" after market headbands should alleviate this....we'll see.  As for now, I'm still very pleased with this purchase.

I owned the oculus rift and had a lot of fun with it BUT it had a lot of wires and those dang motion sensors had to be connected to pc which took a lot of USB ports. So naturally I wanted to replace it with something that didn’t have so many wires and accessories to take up ports. I was hesitant about getting the quest 2 because in my head I thought it was just a beefed up “place your cell phone in here” type of headset but boy was I wrong. It plays all my crap stuff on my pc with a usb-c cable I purchased separately for it. Amazing head tracking with no sensors! Yay! Love this quest 2!

Great system, easy for me to set up and understand but bought it for a gift for a 13 year old and was kind of frustrating with the setup and settings.  Requires extreme patience and how to for someone thats new to it.  Did have a lot of hoops to jump through but overall value for what you get is great!  Very fun and worth it!

The Quest 2 is amazing. I bought me and my wife the 256GB version and we have been buying a bunch of games and used hardly any space. My wife didn't really play games with me, was hard to get her to play anything. With the Quest 2, she played way more than I have. I love using the Quest 2, it's so fun and there are many games where you can actually get a good cardio workout. This is hands down, one of the best investments for this cheap. I was waiting to buy the LG's new style 60" OLED TVs, but there's no point as I cannot get the new video cards.. and besides, they increased the price point on their TVs. I feel the VR gaming experience without being tethered to a PC was the better choice right now.

I've owned every vr set that oculus has put out starting with the Rift. This far exceeds the Rift s and original quest. Great screen resolution with no screen door effect is what we have been waiting for in the vr world. The ability to hook it up to you computer and play Rift games is a nice feature too. Warning! If you have had a Rift or a Rift s you will have to re buy some games you have already bought for the quest 2 such as Beat Saber, onward, Arizona sunshine etc. The 256 gb is a little overkill as my biggest game, the walking dead: saints and sinners is only 7gb or so. If your mainly playing somewhere where there is wifi and and u install and install games quickly, the 64 gb should be plenty.

I have no complaints on the quality of the product or the experience, but this head set is PAINFUL to wear if you need to wear glasses. Oculus supplies an extender for the faceplate that is supposed help with this, but it is such a small extension that it doesn’t help relieve the pressure at all in my case. The tightness that you need on the head straps in order to keep the optics aligned and stable will absolutely smash your glasses into your face with much discomfort. I regret that I have to return this headset, but I simply can’t enjoy the car experience because this comfort issue.

Disappointed as I was really looking forward to this.  It is rated top of VR but there is issues with clarity that could not be resolved.  Putting on the glasses adapter you had to pull the straps to an extremely uncomfortable level to get close to having clarity but the plastic glass adapter is hard plastic and digs into you forehead.  Without the glasses adapter you had to pull the straps extremely tight and snug , again to a very uncomfortable level to gain clarity.  For the price, it was definitely not worth the aggravations.  Suggest you review consumer reports and the issues everyone is having with this...the common denominator is clarity by far.  Many many disappointing reviews on this product.

Love it.  Bought one, and realized we enjoy it enough bought a second so both my husband and I can play at the same time.  

This is my first VR experience, and I was surprised at the realism and what it can do.  I also figured out that roller coasters feel real - so I'm skipping them = had to close my eyes!  LOL.

There are some things I wish they actually put in a manual, like:
1) Hold the power button down to turn it off
2) There is a volume button on the bottom of the headset (took us a couple months to discover that)
3) HOLD the Oculus button to recenter the screen (the sideways O)
4) Tap the Oculus button to get to the Oculus menu so you can quit whatever you were in...

Have fun if you get one!

Truly a remarkable product.  We had the Gear VR set prior which came with and utilized Samsung mobile devices, but this is so much better.  The controllers are intuitive and the headgear is pretty comfortable.  Thinking about getting the additional battery head strap as we run down the battery pretty consistently because EVERY member of our household loves the device.  We have used it every day since we have gotten it.  The trick is to get to it once it recharges before someone else in the family does!  We love it and are blown away by the content available.  Would buy it again 100%.

Having had the the Oculus Quest i wanted to upgrade to a better model.  WOW SO GLAD I DID!   Game play in VR is even better. Smoother movements and better graphics. They're adding updates allowing for more options, even  gifting game apps within the oculus store. 
The head piece itself is very light and feels secure on the head.  The hand joysticks are better and feel weighty in the hands.  Very happy to have this version. I like both but the quest 2 is obviously better.  A great improvement and addition to my experience within the VR world 
Great system.
Would definitely recommend.

So happy I invested in this. I purchased for my son and the joke is on me I’m loving it too! So much variety and family fun if you decide to get more than one! I’m so tempted so we can work out together on here! Everyone can use a little virtual reality in their life lol!

Ordered one for the family for Christmas.  Half are gamers, half are not.  Everyone loves playing.  Controllers are accurate and easy for beginners to use.  Takes a little adjusting on face to get clear visuals, but pretty good quality.  Went the Frankenquest route, and highly recommend if you plan on putting lots of hours into this device.  Very easy to set up guardian area to define play space and avoid damaging things or yourself.  Wide selection of games/experiences.  Some will definitely get you sweating, so I recommend a silicone face insert.  For group/party play also highly recommend casting to tv (e.g. chromecast), so others can see/hear what you're doing instead of just watching you flail around.

Got this for my daughter for Christmas and the whole family has enjoyed.  The gameplay is smooth and amazing video quality.  I was also impressed by the audio and how the speakers are positioned with in the headset so that the player can hear but it's not loud enough to bother others.  I also like that you can stream this to the oculus app to watch the game play.  The fit and comfort of the headset is also great.  I have a feeling that we will be purchasing another one for us to use.  The only downside is the mandatory facebook account which we had to create one since our daughter did not have one nor is she old enough to have one.  Overall it is a solid product that I would definitely recommend to others.

The only game system we would ever consider buying.  We're not big gamers so take that last statement for what it's worth.  We basically bought this unit to play Beat Saber, but the other few games we've purchased are really cool as well.  This VR is an immersive experience unlike anything else.  This will literally transport you into other worlds.  The online content for virtual tours of places is also really cool.   I like that this is a self contained unit so it travels well.  Also the ability to play games with/against family and friends who live out of state is really cool.

wow VR is amazing. great headset but could get blurry on sides the vision could be better. but it works gotta adjust it until you could get a good vision the fronts and letters are blurry most times lots of people complain about it. i just guess thats how it is

I am so so soooo happy with this buy!!! Incredible tech. Super portable and clean, with easy setup. Wide selection of games and love how you can buy a cable to be able to run games from the rift on it.

Have no cons whatsoever. So fun, cool and innovative.

The Oculus Quest 2 is very cool technology. It is not as cool as the technology in Sword Art Online but you will not be fighting for your life while being stuck in the game. 

The headset is a bit on the heavy side but comfortable. The straps be easily be adjusted front-to-back and side-to-side for the best fit. You can also use a spacer to make extra room for glasses. Most size glasses should fit fine in the gear but oversized frames will not.
