The hand controls are easy to learn and easy to use. The feedback is great and I have not had trouble with lag. The system as a whole is very responsive. The speakers and microphone are very clear. 

The OS is very user friendly and the system walks you though many tasks when first being set up. The audio controls even understands my Pittsburgh English. The tracking technology is amazing, a very scary type of amazing. 

I have many concerns about how this technology could be used for evil but that is for a different time and place. For the less paranoid among us, this is very cool technology.

This is an astounding standalone VR experience for the money. Absolutely flawless performance on everything I've thrown at it, impressive controller tracking considering the lack of external tracking cameras, and the ability to have a completely wireless tangle-free experience anywhere you choose make this thing the absolute best mobile or lightweight home VR option. 

Adding in the ability to tether to your desktop for PC VR capabilities make this thing even able to give some of the experience of the higher end VR performance at a fraction of the cost of one of those systems.

Bought this as a Christmas gift for the husband who has everything. Set up was super easy, he watched YouTube and BAM, it was connected! Games, a ton to choose from, ranging in price- nothing too outrageous.  Adult kids had a blast with it too. Cons- I’d say battery life, it isn’t long enough.  We will be investing in the battery pack. Also, black cushion face insert, gets gross when you sweat. Not a huge deal, we ordered colored ones from Amazon and they fit well.  Good for additional family members who want to play.  Overall fun entertaining gift, has something for everyone.

My husband and son got these amazing Oculus Quest 2's and they love them!   My husband wanted one ever since Oculus first came out years ago.  

Comes with everything one needs to setup and use, however, a better head harness is preferred.

Not a toy. This is a home wrecking tool! You will smack things because you are untethered.  It's great! Problems being a lack of brightness control, the IPD adjustment isnt for most people's sweet spot. And the color is not conducive with the look of cleanliness for very long. Games for the unit are still not the experiences most gamers are looking for.  Motion sickness is a barrier. It requires facebook for full functionality.  It will likely become Facebook's I-device (being churned out and discarded annually. But it is still a fun system which can be fun, good for communicating and ok for productivity.  But if this one is like it's older sibling, it will become a 5 star system due to improvements in a year.

Love it!!!!! With the new Xbox and PlayStation Shortages this would be the next great option!!!  Easy setup, easy play, and no extra hardware needed! Straight out the box, download the ap to your phone, find the fame you want.

Upgraded in every way, the increased memory double the original Quest and the 50% more pixels, and I would be amiss not to mention the box (?) / case it is perfectly molded to store controllers and VR headset plus the charger.

Love the games, the ones we sign up for.. we learn a lot from this headset but are also leary of the data capturing and any other type of repercussions we aren’t aware of.. which seems to be usual business. Popping up later.

The Oculus Quest 2 brings affordable quality VR to the masses, but it's still lacking in many areas that may make you want to delay your purchase.  Using an Oculus requires a Facebook account and the mobile app.  If you have more than one person in your household, you'll have to share an account as switching accounts requires a factory reset.

Unlike almost every modern gaming platform, you can't setup "Family Sharing" for games/apps.  If you have multiple devices and want to play a game you purchased on another device, you have to purchase it multiple times or use a single account on all devices.  This limitation doesn't exist on Xbox, PlayStation, Nintendo Switch, or Steam... It's a deal breaker for families.

Great headset. The best VR experience I have had so far. No lag so your hand motion is in perfect time with the video of the game. Great build quality. Very Comfortable. The games are fun. Excellent experience so far.

This is a great tool, especially if your physician won't allow you to mingle in public, because your immune system isn't robust enough.

Having been a consummate "Couch Potato" for the last decade, I've become addicted to the exercise apps.  Specifically the "Supernatural" exercise app.  It combines meditation, warmup, cooldown, boxing, and flow with lots of great music.  Dropped two pant sizes!

Social apps allow the user to mingle with others; participate in multi-player gaming events; travel; attend concerts, lectures, movies, and comedy sketches; and explore your creative side.  There are also apps to assist with working from home.

All you need for the Quest 2 model is a mobile phone and a Facebook account.

I picked this up as a gift and it turned out to be a great party item. Everyone that sees it has to try it out, adults and kids alike. We found out that it is so immersive that motion sensitive friends can't use it. After about 30min of updates and setup we had a good time. Make sure to clear an area around the player for safety for everyone and everything in reach. Even with the mandatory Facebook account to setup, we found settings to deactivate so it wasn't broadcasting our use. 
The good: Virtual sensory immersion is awesome. Price point for hardware. Easy to use.
The bad: You have to set up a Facebook/Meta account... Game prices. If you get motion sickness, this is not for you!

Fun physically and mentally.

This is the best game system ever.   I am so impressed 
By the graphics.  We purchased a Epic Roller coaster program, and it is so real.    Love everything about this unit.   
Best gift for my hubby ever.

This is the future, waaay better than any console experience.  I've pre ordered the ps5 and series X last month but I haven't even thought about them since I got my oculus quest 2 in the mail. I love Big Screen and watching movies on it with random people across the country. Also the games I haven't been scared by a game since I was 8 and when I played the walking dead saints and sinners on the quest 2! Omg I jumped back so hard when the zombies started reaching out for me in that warehouse. This is my first VR so I was blown away. Its pretty easy to setup and mark your play area. My only quirk is the default strap can get uncomfortable after like 30 minutes also the battery will drain fast so be ready to charge.

I love, Love, LOVE my new Oculus Quest 2!

It’s comfortable, and the graphics look amazing!  I’ve already purchased a few VR games from the Oculus store, and I’m enjoying the social apps, as well.

My 4th, and by far the best, VR headset. I've been an early adopter of VR, and have been through several units, including having the wireless adapter for the Vive/Vive Pro.  I don't like the forced Facebook login, honestly, so you need to decide if that's a deal-breaker for you personally.  Otherwise, this unit is AMAZING.  The quality is brilliant, the ease of use is off-the-charts.  And it even works wonderfully for the many PC-VR (through Steam) games that I play.  The setup for wireless PC-VR is more of an advanced user/experimental feature for now - so if you want to keep it very simple plan on PC-VR requiring a link cable.  My opinion is you should stop reading reviews and just buy the Quest 2.  Recommended.
Awesome system! Great fun for the whole family!!! Got the system on release date and have been playing on this almost every day love the games and can't wait to see whats to come.

Prior to the oculus 2 I had the oculus 1 and unfortunately the lower price point and other benefits of the 2nd gen is not enough to warrant an upgrade. 

Biggest disappointment I have with the 2nd gen is the forced Facebook integration. You absolutely cannot use the device without a FB account (unless it’s jailbroken). There’s also a lot of people, including myself, who don’t like the new focus mechanism and the narrower field of view. Overall the device definitely feels cheaper than gen 1 but you are getting an improved processor and more memory at a lower price point.
Never had VR before and I absolutely love this. It’s changed my gaming experience forever. I never thought it could be this cool. Looking forward to more games being available.
Very nice equipment an easily usable each time, but wish there came games available of choice to pre installation. Other than that it's a good investment made for the family.
My son is very happy very good graphics he enjoys the games a little more movement than just a game the wireless feature make it a lot more fun and convenient good product
My son is absolutely obsessed with his oculus quest 2 best Christmas gift ever! Absolutely really feels like you’re in the game won hundred percent would like to recommend
Love these VR headsets. The only reason I didn’t give it five stars is because a Facebook account is required to use. You can also personalize it with different skins.

It's great overall, I just didn't like the fact that you had to sign in to your Facebook to use it. The location of the eyepiece may hinder your viewing and there are only three settings to move the eye viewing optics. Other than that, it's fun to use and I love watching the 360 videos and regular movies. They send you to a movie theater and it looks legit. You actually feel that you are in a movie theater. I the audio is okay, but they should have opted for headphones that stuck to your ear, instead of little slits, where you cannot experience the full capacity of VR.

So incredibly surprised at how much we like this set. There is definitely something to be said about the wireless nature of it because plugging in all the wires and everything for the PSVR made it more effort than it was worth and now the PSVR headset is effectively just collecting dust. To be able to just pick up the oculus and workout in the garage really makes all the difference in how much we’ll be using it. Plus with the holidays coming up, it’s so much easier to transport back home than a full console for my kid cousins to enjoy. The interface is incredible and there is a surprising amount of content. It’s just dangerous that you can make purchases both on the phone companion app AND inside the headset itself.

Wow what an experience! Once you map your room for obstacles and get a feel for how the controls work it is amazing. The tutorials are fun and really help you understand how to use it. Once mapped you have freedom to move about and you get visual warnings if you are nearing an obstacle so you don’t hit anything in your house. Doing a light saber battle with a hand controller is fun and all, but standing up and actually swinging and blocking takes the experience to a whole new and exciting level. It’s the closest you can get to being a light saber wielding Jedi! Love it
It’s great. Just not what I thought it was. The marketplace is still too small. Lots of fun tho. Supposedly meant for +13 years old. My 8 year old loved it as well.
Our Son loves this device.  He olays games and watches movies.  Warning...like other gaming devices, the $$$ add up quickly for purchases of new games.
Bought this gem for my husband and the whole family plays it. We all have our favorite games and love to watch each other play on the big screen :)
My 11 year old son has not put this thing down in almost a month…..it’s perfect and safely keeps him entertained when I need to get some work done.
Awesome, cannot get better than this!!! To be able to exercise and really enjoy it is wonderful.  Great for all ages!!!! Get ready to blast off

After owning an Oculus Quest for the past year and absolutely loving it the Quest 2 was a must have for me. Now I have two quests so that my family can play multiplayer with me and it's amazing! This headset as a standalone unit is great in itself but the real kicker is it can even substitute as a PC headset if desired through the use of Oculus Link or Virtual Desktop. If coupled with Virtual Desktop you now have PC quality VR without tethers or cumbersome sensor bars. If you've ever wanted to try VR but didn't know where to begin look no further because this is it!

Easy to use/setup
Quest store is convenient and easy to navigate. I love being able to purchase games directly on the headset and be able to take it with me and play. Setting up the headset with your PC (I play through Steam VR) can be a process on initial set-up. After that it’s pretty smooth sailing. What I didn’t know about the headset is that the graphics vary between steam vr and the quest store. In my opinion, steam vr  graphics  are way better than buying directly through the quest store. The catch though, is you have to plug your headset into the PC while playing games through steam vr. 
Overall, highly recommend this headset. Haven’t had any issues playing any games (yet) both through quest store and steam vr.
How can I explain it other than awesome the grass it’s my kids love this thing and so do I is interactive they up moving around
This is the best gift for my 10 year old son he is so happy with this VR he loves it. Is very entertaining and easy to use.
Got this for my son for Christmas- and the entire family argues over who gets to use it next (to my son’s indignation!).
This is the best Xmas gift to myself! New to VR, and I am super impressed with this unit. Super easy to navigate/set up.
Completely and utterly blown away by this unit on all levels, I actually went out the following day and bought a second!

My first experience with VR other than one of the cheap headsets you put your phone in. 

My mind was blown within seconds of trying this out! So impressive how far VR has come. The resolution and the experience in general is great. The games have all been fun, although some are a little on the expensive side. 

Oculus link is a great option to use the headset with your PC but the cable is pretty expensive also. 

Altogether I think Oculus Quest 2 is a great deal for what you're able to do with it.  Now if I can just get past the motion sickness I will use it more!
My son is enjoying his device, he said that the device makes him do some exercise while he is playing it’s games.
Son uses for streaming and it is go. Takes 3hr for full charging and last 2hr until you have to charge it again.
Bought for grandson i trued them out new years eve ... unbelievable so much fun like your in a different world
It is really cool and all, but there aren’t many interesting games available. I’d say wait a few years for VR
Greatest vr ever I got this for my son and had to be playing the excitement the drill the motion…………………….
At long last! setup was a frustration but thanks God we got it. My kids are really involved with it.

This has been a lot of fun but it takes some getting used to. My first experience using this device.  I wish it came with more games though. I can't seem to get past the first wall in Climb.  Still trying to figure it out since there aren't any real instructions with the games.  I've purchased a few already in the two months I've had it.  The meditation subscription Tripp is wonderful. The visual imagery is amazing to me.  The head strap that comes with it is very uncomfortable with hard plastic pieces.  It's worth the  money to get the more comfortable head set.
This is one of the best platform/consoles that ive ever got everything is pretty much perfect
Wow best vr experience without the need for a computer. Great apps and even better interface
This VR headset is AMAZING! My son loves it! No need for a computer or other console.
My son loves his new Oculus virtual reality game. Curbside pick up was fast and easy!
Very excellent my children loves it and they haven't put it down. Very good product
Got this for my brother as a birthday gift and we both love it. The games are fun!

This is a lot of fun to play.  It's amazing how far VR has come over the past few years.  I would give it 5 stars, but the right side eye has a much smaller field of view than the left.  If the headset is not positioned perfectly, the right eye seems blurry, or double visioned.  If you're interested in one of these, I wouldn't let that deter you though.  Unless you want to pay the premium for an HTC headset, this is a great deal.  Also, you're supposed to be able to connect this to a computer for better performance, so maybe that would make it more appealing compared to the more expensive options.  I would highly recommend this for the excercise options like Beat Saber, however the explore games like Star Wars are fun too.

It has only been a short time and 5 hours use by various members of my family but so far this device has blown everyone away with how it works.  Except for some slight motion sickness being experienced on some of the thrill rides, everyone loves it from ages 15 to 67. But you will definitely need 2 if you are playing multiplayer games in your own house.  The strap that came with sucks really.  I purchased the elite strap which is amazing and so much more comfortable.  It should be just included.  20 to 30 minutes goes by in an instant.  Remember to take a break.
Highly recommend this for your VR experience. Cordless is always the way to go.
Great product. My children loves everything about it. It’s worth the price.
Lots of fun activities. You can exercise, do meditation or games and so on.

This Quest 2 has made a lot of improvements from the Q1, and I now own both. My Q1 was awesome, and I had enjoyed my first experience into VR with it. Now this Q2 is ten times better with the higher resolution to almost 4K the details are much clearer that it made replaying my games, like Arizona Sunshine much better. The headset is much lighter, so there is lesser weight at the front. No need for counter weight. The headset runs faster and smoother, and it being an all-in-one, like the Q1, it is ready to play right out of the box. The best VR for everyone to experience that do not have a gaming pc!! But if you have a gaming pc, like myself, the link cable is a plus bc you can play more titles with the Oculus Rift library and SteamVR. Yes, you have to have a Facebook account, and you have to sign in with the headset. But I have Facebook for a decade now, so I don’t have an issue with fb showing me more options of what I was searching. Even though my Reverb G2 is my preferred pcvr headset... the Q2 is the one I put on when I want to quickly play some vr without booting up my pc. Like all my headsets, I’ll equipped it with a lot of accessories and protection. GET THIS Q2... and you won’t regret it!!! Enjoy!!!
Horrible product it’s all blurry. Battery runs quick. Demos aren’t free
Great, but not enough free games . Most the games you have to purchase
Me and the kids picked this up last month and it in a word is Awesome!
Best experience ever, entertaining and keeps you fit at the same time
Amazing graphics, high quality. My son loved this birthday gift.
Super awesome just wish battery lasted longer than a couple hrs.
I had the Quest but I must say the quest 2 has better graphics.
Very good better than I expected. I love the overall design
A excellent gift for all ages. Hours of laughter and fun
I'm lovin 'it, fantastic, Goodbye to sedentary lifestyle

My only complaint is that within the first month of using the Oculus the charging cable and charging cube both went bad. Not a major issue considering the oculus will charge using any C type USB cable so that was a quick and easy fix. Other than that I've had no other issues with it so far (going on 3 months of use) the games are fun to play. It being wireless just adds to the experience unlike using the PS4 VR headset. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking to give VR a try and even to those that haven't had a chance to experience a wireless VR headset.

It’s pretty cool. The graphics are very good.My only complaint is my child had an allergic reaction from wearing it less than an hour. The company has a specific page for allergic reactions which I find very odd. My kids played the PlayStation VR and never had an issue. The company sent me a third party replacement made of a soft material. My son hasn’t had a reaction to that face replacement. It would have been helpful if it was originally made of high quality materials for the money we spend on it. The issue was resolved after answering MANY questions about the use of our system. The only reason why we bought this was because it’s wireless. If it wasn’t for the wireless we would have just continued with our PlayStation VR.
My family has had so much fun with the oculus already
Fun and immersive, recommend horror games.........

Seriously, I thought VR would be a gimmick. I had no real die-hard interest in it until we tried the Quest 1. It is addicting, and mild cardio with certain games. Games like Start Wars Vader Immortal, Beat Saber, and Pistol Whip can keep you going for hours. There's stuff from golf, to boxing, or horror games and zombie shooters. What sets the Oculus Quest and Quest 2 apart from the competition is the ability to work standalone OR with a gaming PC. So if you want to take this on vacation, or your parents/grandparents its just as mobile as the Nintendo Switch.

After having the product for more then two months, it works perfectly. Playing video games, watching live games, as well browsing the web in it is great. But just a heads up if you feel of discomfort with the headband you can try changing it with a better strap on the Oculus website. I do recommend getting this product with 256GB storage as later on with software update or game update will eat up your space. Better safe then sorry. Overall great games, feels awesome with no hardware problems, just the headband of little discomfort of long use of the Oculus 2.

I enjoy it very much i keep hearing about a new one coming out next year so maybe wait but it will be compatible i think. Just make sure you research all that before you buy. Me i wanted one now and had the money so hopefully i get my money worth. One thing i learned is i had to change the setting on it to not match the  North American united States hz 60 hz to 50 hz for some reason an update they did set it back to 60 hz. If you youtube this issue it will explain why and how to do it. I thought i was going to have to return it because it wouldnt see my remotes but once i changed it they worked perfectly also you HAVE to have a real facebook account bot a fake one because if they find out its fake your oculus will be worthless

I gifted this to my daughter for her birthday last week, along with the PS5 and the xBox Series X ... however they are still in their boxes. She is obsessed with this Oculus! Especially since the recent BTS dance download became released. Given the rarity in seeing my daughter surprised and extra excited for anything, I also love this thing. Every day she grabs this guy with the same excitingly joy as it’s been given as a gift over and over again. Furthermore, it’s unbelievable to see her wipe it down and put it back within the box after each use ... I’ve never seen her take care to anything she’s owned before as she does to this. Aaaaaand to think she disregarded the idea of wanting it when I brainstormed gifts for her birthday!

Which over from using a Rift S. Being able to use VR without a wire is very liberating. It's almost worth for that alone. Having adjustable IPD also makes this much better than the Rift S though I wish it was a slider. I'm sure that most VR devs will be putting most of their games and apps on the Quest as it's headset most VR users have.

Taking away star because the default headstrap is terrible. It doesn't support the weight of headset well and it's not comfortable to wear. Definitely invest in a 3rd party head strap if you are interested in the Quest

This is my first VR and it was so easy to set up! Very intuitive and mind blowing! If you have waited “the right” VR device, this is absolutely the one to purchase. There are some free games to help you learn how to interact in the environment. And there is nothing like Darth Vader unexpectedly walking up to you! Nothing can prepare you for having him in your face as you look up at him. if you are prone to motion sickness, the games are labeled based on comfort. And many of the games will allow you to adjust how much motion you want to have in the game.

Not at all what I was expecting.  Being touted as the latest and greatest I was looking for something new.  I have had the Rift for the past year and the Oculus 2 was a great disappointment.  I realize the cord conecting the Rift is a drawback but not having the cord with very limited content is not compariable.  It's a neat little gadget but I will invest in the connecting link so I can get back to more satisfying content.  Even the home senerio is very lacking when compared to Rift, you can't move around or even eliminate the menu, how basic is that!

So, I was trying to get a Ps5 like the rest of the world but couldn’t and unlike a smart individual I should’ve just saved the money but nooooooo I decided to buy the oculus quest 2 256 Gig and I must say this is the best thing I’ve ever purchased gaming wise it totally immerses the gamer in the game Vader immortal is a must for a first buy just go to light saber dojo it’s hours of fun just make sure your kids are sleep you may just light saber one just saying!!!! Happy gaming!!!! Only thing is we need more games!!! Netflix sling YouTube all in VR!!!!

Great VR. Owned the Q1 which had some controller/camera issues. Q2 seems much more reliable. I don’t notice much difference in image quality but the controller tracking definitely better(in my opinion).  If you have a PC capable of VR this works great as a “Rift” when plugged in. I barely get any time to play this now as my son has taken over the device to “virtually chill” with all his Quest buddies around the world.  VR is a life saver during the COVID-ERA.  If you’re on the fence, don’t be...just pick one up and disconnect from reality for a bit!!

Really neat system.  My husband and I both use it.  I only have problems getting it tight enough on my head so my vision isn’t blurred.  I have contacts so it just takes a bit of adjusting.  My husband has played every night since we got it.  He texted me and said “I got to swing a light saber, thank you so much”.  It seems to have a wide variety of games.  I find it very easy to use.  I do play some video games, but I feel it would be easy for someone who doesn’t game at all to set up and play.  I like the wrist straps and they are super adjustable.

I purchased this item after having gone to the Dali Museum 3 years ago and using their virtual reality station. This has been a very exciting new toy for me. I'm still working on adjustments for the nose but I'm enjoying it a lot. My only disappointment is that I thought the Oculus came with full games such as Jurassic World or Star Wars. They need to be installed separately for cost. I do like however how it shows the user how to maneuver the joysticks and how it has you measure a safe area to move around. I love this and I'm no spring chick either.

I would like to give this 5 stars, but you have to have facebook to use this....if you don't have an account, this isn't for you.
I have never used VR before, but if you want to immerse yourself into the virtual world, this is definitely one headset you'd want to purchase.  The graphics are incredible and you feel like you are in the places that you are taken.
I wish the gaming available was more broad spectrum, but that isn't a fault of the product.   I also wish you could sideload stuff easier.  Oculus claims that is a feature coming in the future.

I don’t mean to brag but I have the ps5 and the new Xbox. I honestly chose the oculus over both. I loved it so much that I had to buy my fiancé and son one. My mom came over and tried it and fell in love. She’s getting one too. I feel like the oculus quest 2 is the way VR should of been introduced to the world (not that insert your cellphone here) type of equipment lol hands down the best thing to escape reality. I ended up getting the 256 gigs which isn’t necessary as of yet because there’s not much games that take up more than 10gigs of data yet.

With the new chip this can do everything the rift s can do. With a couple of software to download you can play your whole oculus pc game or steam library without any wires.  Not going to lie. It does look a little better on the rift because of decompression but hopefully they figure out how to get the best of the quest 2 in future patches. I would get this over the rift because I can play anywhere in the house and not just next to my pc. I can sit outside and do things on my pc desktop which is 50 feet on the other side of the house with the quest.

VR has finally arrived, and hopefully it's here to stay.  This set has so much going for it.  Wire-free VR -and- the ability to connect it to a VR-ready PC to use in AAA games.  The 90fps upgrade looks great and we're very happy with this set.  No more screen door effect, where you can see pixels.  The only knock on this is the IPD spacing isn't fluid like the last version.  You have 3 settings that will hopefully match the distance between your eyes.  Other than that, this is a buy.  If you are remotely interested in VR, then this is a no-brainer.

Super VR headset. Great display with high quality graphics. Sound is not so great. Stock speakers have low volume and not a great quality of sound. Be prepared to use headphone. Battery life for headset for me is close but not quite what manufacturer states. Batteries for controllers on the other hand are great. Lasts for a super long time before needing changed. Ability to use link cable or now stream games from computer with Virtual Desktop is also a huge plus. Also it’s no longer necessary to side load non Oculus games to the quest any longer.

Crazy system, the way it fits with the base bands it's too comfortable.. and if different people are playing, resizing gets tedious. I plan on getting some of the other accessories. Also does not come with the PC link cable.. which they sell for 70$. Games are all a bit on the pricey side for what they are (IMO)30$+ per game. Some games are glitchy with an almost stuttering effect and setting up the guardian (boundaries) can be a pain. But all said and done it is amazing. Just don't break the house pplaying. I also wish it wasn't connected to FB.

Best purchase I've made. I was wanting to buy the PS5 but it's sold out all the time and I Bought this. No regrets and I'm glad that I did. Huge drive storage. I bought a few games and I still haven't used half. Easy to record gameplay during VR and also Cast what you are seeing on your TV or laptop. A great selection of games and new releases are constant in the store. The resolution is Amazing compared to Oculus Go and the Battery life has improved drastically for the Oculus models. Plenty of battery to play Beat saber for hours. I also want to point out that they are updating the Oculus Quest 2 to support VR Games on your PC without wires. It's really refreshing to escape for a while and feel like new when going back to work or school.

Love these! I bought these for my husband (hoping I'd get my own from him, but for now I use his, lol) and I truly enjoy the experience! I found that I love the workout aspect with these, and subscribed to the "game" Supernatural. It's fun and challenging, like Beat Saber with more of a workout involved! My husband bought Resident Evil 4 for himself! The only downside, which is to be expected and that you can minimize somewhat with added gear like bands, is that you can work up a really good sweat with the physical games... Still so worth it! ;)

My teenage son worked hard to earn money to buy an Oculus. He absolutely loves it and plays frequently. There are lots of games for purchase and some for free. I think the most fun is had when he is playing Monkey Tag with people all over the world. I can watch the game on a computer as he plays. The graphics are great, controllers are comfortable in the hands. I highly recommend getting a better headband so the system stays on your head better and a storage/carrying case. It is also worth the extra cash to get the extra memory space. Great fun!

This is the first time experiencing VR and I have to say I am super impressed by how well it works.  I got the 256GB version because I wasn't sure future wise how big content will be.  I have used this on its own as a VR headset as well as I plugged it into my PC using Oculus Link to play FS2020 in VR.  Both experiences worked without any issues and made me realize that VR is the next big thing that will change our lives.  If anyone is on the fence about VR I would suggest getting the Quest 2.  I know a lot of people complain about having to use your facebook account as the login but it doesn't bother me at all.  I just change the privacy settings so only I can see my activity.  It was very easy to setup and start using right out of the box.

This was a present for my son for Christmas, but it's become more of a house present because everyone loves it! There are tons of games to play, really amazing travel videos to check out - Honestly by the end of Christmas Day we wished we had two of them because everyone was playing. There are many reviews that said that the Oculus needed to be charged a lot, but honestly we've found no problem with that whatsoever. It charges quickly and seems to hold its charge for quite a while. I would definitely recommend this for anyone considering a VR.

Life altering gaming, the updates that have been done on this device are amazing.  You can now play rift games wirelessly.  This thing rocks.  Oculus used to be buggy due to it starting as a really niche product.  It has truly matured into a very stable and incredibly entertaining device.  The V. R. community experience has been warm and inviting.  Get the elite strap, the after market visor cushion and the battery back up.  The last update pushes the wirelessness of the device and once you get into it, this will let you spend more time in VR.

True VR for the masses.  The Oculus Quest 2 is the best and most affordable way to experience true virtual reality with six degrees of freedom.  It has one of the best displays of any current headset and the visuals are sharp.  There is already a huge library of AAA titles available and more are coming.

The only down side is that the head strap is not the most comfortable. However, it is good enough to get through a 1-2 hour gaming session. The optional Elite Strap is strongly recommended Also, the lenses tend to fog up, especially if it's cold.  Lastly, the facial interface is not very comfortable.  It's a bit rough against the face.  The best replacement is the VR Cover facial interface.  It is available for purchase on the Oculus website.

Funny enough, I was a little skeptical about my journey into VR and wasn't sure I'd even like it. I really bought this as the least expensive way to get a VR experience with the newest Microsoft Flight Simulator. Before connecting that, I had a wild time just going through the introductory experience software! I'm really glad I purchased the optional, improved headstrap, and picked up some aftermarket silicon covers for the stock foam pad. Increased the comfort level tremendously. I also picked up an aftermarket stand to organize everything.

I was worried that I wasn’t going to like this, as I heard that it can be very disorienting for some people. I was able to try out VR before I went out and bought one, and holy crap… I am so excited that I liked it. One thing I can say is that some of the games can be disorienting at first. It’s more so with games that you can move around in game, while your body isn’t moving IRL. I can’t recommend trying if not just getting a VR headset before you buy!

TLDR: I tried out VR before I bought it, and I loved it. Some games can make you dizzy.

SO far my son enjoys playing on line with his friends.  My husband said some of the games made his vertigo kick in and the roller coaster ride was too much.  Another dad said the roller coaster ride made him threw up.  I'd say for kids its great but as adults get older the unbalance in our ears might make some games unbearable.  Setting up took a bit- my husband did it and was cursing under his breath.  I'd say set at lease an hour to do it and if gifting I would recommend doing it before hand so when it's open it can be played immediately.

Seriously how to even begin. 
Its cheaper than a next gen console and its the next, next gen of console. 
The screen resolution and refresh rates are great. Little to no eye fatigue. Works fine with prescription glasses too. Get the headstrap for prolonged gaming, but not necessary for showing it off or hour or less sessions.

Every single person ive ever put into a vr headset cant wipe the smile off their faces.

This headset comes with enough libraries through occulus and steam and google that youll have a great variety of games to play

Excellent product! This is my first VR system the games look incredible and I lose track of the real world while I play. It being so new the games are limited but the ones I've played ( Beat saber, Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy's Edge, The Walking Dead: Saints and Sinners, SUPERHOT VR and Vader Immortal: episode 1 are so much fun! I also enjoy the Netflix app, it's set in a luxury cabin on a snowy mountain. I wish they had a Disney+ app and a hulu app but maybe in the future. This product has been so much fun I've shared it with friends and family and within a week my parents and a friend bought one. It's comfortable to wear for hours and while you're playing you don't notice the weight. This is by day one of my favorite purchases of the year.

This is easily the best entry point into VR. The screen door effect is almost non-existent on this headset, Playing untethered in games like Pistol Whip and Beatsaber feels like the best way to play these games. On top of that you can always buy a link cable and use your PC to use it like a dedicated PC VR setup. Oculus outdid themselves with this one. My only complaint is that there isn't enough cushioning in the nose cutout to make sure your eyes are isolated from outside light and they make you buy a different pad to solve this issue.

I bought the Oculus Quest 2 to help stimulate me at home during the plandemic. I was surprised on how easy it was to set up and get started. Fully charged I went to check it out and an hour and a half later I was impressed.

Still need to work on getting the visual settings correct and the face fit completely dark, but it is getting close. I have found being a little older "67" it is best to sit in a deck chair when on the roller coaster or flying through the air. Just saying. You really feel you are there and balance is very important.

I rate this as one-star because it's a Facebook product.  My facebook account was taken over by an unknown person and Facebook has been COMPLETELY unresponsive in my pleads to help protect my identity and that of my children, family and friends.  The Oculus team was no help in getting the situation resolved.  Multiple requests for tech support to gain control of my Facebook account were left unanswered and without resolution.  DON'T SUPPORT FACEBOOK BY BUYING THIS PRODUCT.  The only way to make a stand is by making it with your wallet!

VR has always interested me but I’ve always had certain expectations it must meet. Affordability, Quality, and Game Variety have been my requirements and I can say that the Oculus Quest 2 comes the closest of any VR headset to date. The Quest 2 is definitely affordable with a starting good price at $299.
It meets quality standards in how it’s put together. Finally the Quest 2 game library provides a good variety of games with more promising ones on the way soon. While not perfect the Oculus Quest 2 is an great VR for first time users!

great VR! definitely worth the money
everyone who has used it has enjoyed it, and everyone has their own feel for it. I like to play games like beat saber or shooting, my friend loved the Star Wars chapters, and my dad loved sailing a boat in Alaska with the Nation Geographic game. Amazing! and yes, you do have to log in to your Facebook, unfortunately. Although it does let you live stream your screen, which is great, it so happened that the game I like the most and play the most, Beatsaber, you're unable to live stream to Facebook...

Aside from missing out on some desktop titles, (which you can use Link w/virtual desktop & steam if you have a PC) this headset is mindboggling. 

The size, the games, the 2k per eye resolution- it's the best on the market. 

Little annoyed by the Facebook integration but that's to be expected if we're being honest. 

So if you don't mind the Zuck having access to all your favorite VR titles and your personal info (if he doesn't already) than this is a no brainer. 

GET this headset. 

If you're on the fence, this review is your sign.

These fit better than the oculus 1  when it comes to blocking out light. I feel the strap is a little on the cheep side but it does work, but for children i would highly recommend the elite strap because of the bowl it has for the back of the head.

All in all this is great unit and their are improvements, most notable is the graphics and storage. Over all definitely a upgrade from the Oculus 1, but FOV is about the same (for those who are wondering)

Overall my children and I really like it and would recommend this product for sure!

I was skeptical about VR after seeing PlayStation’s and never had the chance to try Oculus out until Santa brought me one this year. It was definitely an awesome gift! The immersive experience makes VR-360 videos very entertaining. The games are cool too, but can see that it can get expensive pretty quickly. Think of this as a self-contained gaming console. The memory, the screen, the controllers are all part of this setup. I’d recommend using a headphone adapter and using some good/noise-cancelling headphones to make the most of it.

This headset has been everything I could ask for in a VR headset.
I've been using the HTC Vive since it was released, but it was always inconvenient to set up and every time we move it takes months before I get around to setting up the base stations. With the Quest 2, you can be playing within minutes of unboxing it. Sure, the tracking isn't quite as good, but it's not game breaking, and the ability to wirelessly stream from a PC to keep using games I already own is great.

One of the biggest problems with VR has been the lack of wide spread adoption. The need for expensive PC hardware on top of the headset and complicated setup, or settling for low res phone quality games made it unappealing for many. Now we get high quality graphics and ease of use.

First off, let me just say... my kids are spoiled. They have almost everything. EVERYTHING! Xbox, switch, gaming computer, name it, we probably have it. So when my son asked our elf, Silly Billy for an Oculus Quest 2, I was like “crap”. Holy heck. This thing is incredible. The only downside is now my children are free to run amuck because my husband and I are so wrapped up in playing on the darn Oculus. Get it! Do it! It’s freaking amazing. My whole family is burning energy and having a blast doing it. It’s totally worth every penny.

I was skeptical at first. Wasn’t sure what to think. Didn’t really know if I wanted one or not. I went back and forth for a very long time. Then I just decided to go for it and get one.
Best decision ever.
The Oculus Quest 2 is beyond impressive in many ways. It’s affordable. It doesn’t require any other devices, such as a computer or extra sensors.
It’s truly an all-in-one, stand-alone VR.
Set up was fast and easy. There was an initial update that took about 10-15mins.
Other than that, my experience has been nothing short of great!

First foray into VR, wasn’t sure what to expect.  Based my purchase on user reviews and equipment reviews from various sources. Read reviews on the Valve Index and was considering that unit even at an additional 600 dollars over the Quest 2. My biggest concern with the Quest 2 will it interface with my rig to play Steam VR games. After numerous attempts finally found the correct information and it works great, just make sure your rig meets the specs. I would recommend this unit for purchase to any pc gamer looking to experience VR.

Purchased for Wife's birthday. After she got it set up, she had me and a friend go through the learning program and both of us fell in love with it. Bought two more the next day. Now, we have THREE of these in the house (each has our own) complete with docking stations to charge batteries! Since our original purchase, we have had no fewer than 3 other people go and make the purchase as well. They are AMAZING! 
A few items to note: 
1) If you wear glasses, there are companies online that can make lens inserts for you. They take a couple weeks to get. I use a prescription that includes "prism" lenses and they are phenomenal. The company we ordered from is actually in Thailand and they did a perfect job with them. They are actually clearer and protect your Oculus from accidental damage from your regular glasses.
2) You can decorate the fronts with "skins." We made our own with the vinyl cutting machine. Be sure not to cover the cameras.
3) Invest in silicone protectors for the "halo" portion of your controllers. You WILL hit stuff with them. Buy them reasonably from that famous online retailer for cheap. If you get the full covers, you can't charge them on the Official charger sold by Best Buy.
4) Have a good spot to store and protect your device; as well as a GOOD microfiber cleaning kit.
5) Turn on the calorie counter with the "move" app if you are interested in using this to get some exercise.
6) Spend the time to get it adjusted to your eye position and your head size/ shape.
7) Spend the time to get to know your device - play with all the settings, watch online videos, become acquainted - don't rush into playing games before you are ready.
8) have lots of light around you (for the cameras) and for the love of all that's holy - remember to take drink breaks!
9)) Had we known how awesome these were, we have gotten them sooner!
Check out my shelf! designed and built by me (house is designed in steampunk/ industrial). ordered nicer cables to match the shelf design.

I bought an Oculus Quest 2 for my wife from Best Buy and had it shipped to the house.  When it arrived we got it out and after I set it up my wife played for a few minutes and then said you need to get one too.  I went out the same day and bought another one with the elite strap.  The first game we tried was Beat Saber demo and we were hooked.  We play most every night and actually enjoy the exercise so much that it’s hard to stop.  This is an amazing device with so many options and possibilities.  I highly, highly recommend this.

I purchased this as a Christmas gift for and immediate family member. I gave it to him on Christmas Eve day, and he cannot stop playing VR, he loves it! I do wish that it would have more free games that are more action oriented, but I did purhcase two games for him and he can't get enough of the Oculus Quest 2. The device is very comfortable to wear, and the hand controllers are great. The sound is good and the visuals are amazing with no latency. I highly recommend the Oculus Quest 2, 256GB! You won't be sorry you purchased it!!!

My 11 year old son bought this with the money he saved up for a year. It's great because we don't have to have a gaming computer to connect to. The trade off is that you have to use a Facebook account. No way around it that we have found. We homeschool so it has had multiple applications for PE, Science, Geography, History, even life skills. 

The negative is the amount of space needed to play and not hit things. We live small, 400 square feet, so he is inevitably hitting something or someone. Definitely need to have decent room.

This is my first step into VR, I also own a Switch. To me the Quest is not a replacement for platform gaming but offers its own unique and complementary experience. Games on Oculus are physically interactive and more immersive. I like puzzle games most and it is amazing to be totally absorbed in the game environment. That being said, set your expectations that this is the beginning of the VR age. Games are still rolling out, developers are figuring out how to make games without causing VR sickness, and graphics have a ways to go.

I have the original Oculus Quest and this one improves upon it in small way. The controllers are a bit more comfortable in your hand and have a better space to put your thumb. The graphics are slightly better. Might be more than slightly, but I haven't yet downloaded something where that would have been noticeable to me. The battery is better, but they definitely could have improved more in this area (though I feel that with most technology). For $100 bucks cheaper than the original, this is definitely a great bang for your buck.

Omg Vr is the future! It's so great. At first I thought it was a gimmicky thing but after using it for a few months, I was happy to dive into the world of virtual reality. I mainly use it to play beat saber (great game btw, totally fun). Plus you can buy 3rd party accessories for it like an extra battery so it runs longer or better hand grips! And there's a "record" function on there where you can record your plays and then save it on your computer. The only downside is you need a Facebook account if you already didn't have one.

I am 72 & my husband is 68 ~ it's been a very long time since we've experienced anything so mind opening and wonderful as this Oculus Quest 2!! It's absolutely Amazing... My favorite is the Ocean Rift, and "playing" with all of the sea creatures. I also love all of the different experiences in the rain forests and travels all over the world. My husband is a Star Wars fan & he adores all of those apps. We Both really enjoy the Racket Fury app & play the ping-pong every day! Our friends are just as mind-blown by all of it as well.

I've been waiting to get a VR headset for awhile because the standalone systems you don't need a pc with VR capabilities just didn't seem to me to be far enough developed to be worth trying. I was pretty skeptical purchasing the Quest 2 and didn't expect much but I couldn't be more excited about it. It's so easy to use even my parents who have no idea how to use something like a Xbox controller got the hang of it in a few minutes and were having a blast playing the VR bowling game the other night when we hosted family Christmas.

We originally purchased the Rift S, and it's awesome, but the downside is that you are tethered to your computer. One of the problems my son experienced was that he actually pulled the wire out mid game a few times if he moved too much. We ended up building an "arena" out of pool noodles. I wanted him to be able to play Steam VR games. We've found (via Youtube video) we can do this with the Quest 2 to a degree. This is great fun - you download the game to the headset so it may be worth the 100 bucks to get more space, unless you don't mind loading and deleting.  Overall, of the two systems, the Quest 2 gets more play time. The main drawback is that it's a facebook product. You need a FB account to play, meaning my son now has a FB account for this purpose.

The Oculus Quest 2 is amazing. It's been my comfort through the stresses of everyday life during these troubled. I put on the headset and can go anywhere and see fascinating things both real and fantasy.

Have you ever visited Greenland? I have through the nagic of Virtual  Reality. Face to face with Darth Vader? It was truly an intimidating experience.

Virtual Reality is going to be big soon with so many other applications other than games or fun experiences.

I'm glad to be part of the pioneers of VR. Oculus Quest 2 is great.

Great device, quite a workout with some of the games. I only wish that the device is not assigned to 1 account and is more flexible... or be able to create separate profiles for kids to use. if i buy another device i should be able to have a family account to share the games with the kids to play together instead of purchasing the same games on a separate account. I'll need to look more into that. 

There are some glitches that i will still need to work out... my guardian randomly resets and drops me out of games... strange...

Also, the option to play on pc should be easier, but I'm glad i cam play wirelessly and don't need to buy the cord! Overall, this is an awesome device to get the heart pumping and get some physical activities in while playing games!

We definitely enjoyed playing with this and the technology is incredible. However, after only 1 hour of use, my daughter developed a horrible contact rash that required us to take her into a doctor and get a prescription for steroid ointment to treat it. She has been miserable for two days. We contacted oculus and this is a known complication that has happened to others and they didn’t have a disclaimer about it which is so disappointing. Needless to say we returned it. No matter how good the tech is, it isn’t worth her misery.

The only other experience I have with virtual reality is with the psvr. So I may not be the most accurate source of quality in vr headsets, but I’m truly blown away with the capability of this stand alone vr. It is very convenient to not have to be connected to a cord and all of the games/videos I’ve experienced with the quest 2 are amazing. I may not know a lot about other vr headsets that are available, but I’m very happy with my purchase and have no regrets. I definitely recommend giving this one a shot for newbies or pros.

The Oculus is fun. There are a few games that seem so realistic it's crazy. I played a free game that was so intense. "Mission: ISS" I'm pretty sure that's the name. I thought I was going to fall over at one point from the lack of gravity in the game. It just felt odd. Anyways, I'm still slowly growing my list of games in my library. So I feel like I still haven't experienced all of what Oculus has to offer. There are a few problems I have encountered: Finding space to play games is one. I have two huge dogs and two small children. I don't need to punch any of them in the face. No I don't live in a mansion or have a gym at my disposal. The other issue is the battery life for the headset could be a bit better. Other than that, I like it. I would buy it again.

This headset is awesome. Easily the best experience for the price. The controllers feel next level and the hand tracking is precise and accurate. Ive noticed first hand that the controllers are suprisingly durable. I've accidentally hit a couple walls pretty hard and the controllers don't even have a scratch. I have no problem lending this headset to my younger cousins. The only cons that I notice are the short battery life of the headset and its head straps. I'm currently looking to echange the straps for something sturdier.

You need a Facebook account to use the Oculus Quest 2 VR system. 
Without a Facebook account you won’t be able to use anything, not internet browsing, not the Netflix app, nothing, zip, zero. You MUST have or register a Facebook account which to me is a no-no because I am not renting this system. I’m buying it so I shouldn’t be forced to register or signup to anything except the games I buy or an App Store.

The games and features are mainly computer made. Not realistic cinematic or experience outside the computer made world.

Amazing experience. Truly feels you are in the environment, game, locale.. wherever it is you are exploring. The only downside, which i was not aware of, is nearly every single game or app costs money and not like $5 or $10... but $20-$30 and not shareable between headsets. We bought 2 headsets thinking we could play together or buy a few games on each that were shareable but instead you would need to buy 2 of the same game to have on both headsets or take turns exchanging headsets with one another rather than play together.

Purchased for a Xmas gift and ended up using it for myself. The graphics and games are extremely realistic looking and makes you feel as if you’re really a part of the scenario and scene. Price is not bad for this item for the 256mb. The only downside to this purchase is that Oculus does not currently allow multiplayer, multi avatars, or a family option. If someone wants to play the same game on your system that you’ve paid for and downloaded and have an established avatar, the game will require deletion of the existing avatar to add. New player. All of your saved game data is lost. Oculus needs to update and provide multiplayer use or it’s not worth the purchase for a family with a couple of kids since they are not able to have their own avatars or share games.

The headset tracks movements extremely well and I don’t notice any lag between controls and what you see.. the graphics are very good but the sound level is too low to be very useful for true gaming so headset a must as well as the elite strap.. The biggest con is this thing is heavy and for long term use it could make you feel like your forehead weighs 5 lbs more and if you can deal with the heft of this thing then you will love it. There may be some more comfortable cushion inserts to help.. I would definitely recommend this VR
Headset and it is easy to setup with a PC if you want via a link cable and no you don’t have to get the Oculus brand there are plenty third party options that will work just fine just make sure you get plenty of length on the link cable

The oculus quest 2 is a great way to experience virtual reality. That being said, I was disappointed by the quality of the games produced for this unit, which is no fault of the manufacturer and why it gets 5 stars. I guess I really thought the quality of games would be much more realistic. If you’ve ever seen the 1992 movie The Lawnmower Man, then you might know what I mean by lack of quality. Those were high end graphics then. Why, in 2021, are the graphics so corny? I have found that YouTube 360 videos can be quite fun.

I do not play the system it was a gift for my nephew. He seems to like it. I got him the PlayStation one last year. I do know he likes the Oculus better. I noticed One thing for paying 420 20 some odd dollars. You would think that they could put a ratchet twist on the headband to adjust it! Come on now!!! Other than that he seems to love it.t I like that  you don't have wires that get all wrapped up i around u. I do think it's easier to set up than the PlayStation VR. I don't know maybe because I set up the VR last year.

The quality of the hardware is very good. It fits and is comfortable for hours of play (with the optional headstrap).  By the time it starts to get uncomfortable, the battery is getting low, so it works out. The downside is the games catalog. There just isn't a ton of content out there yet, and anything with high production value is really short. For example, the star wars games can be knocked out in an afternoon. 

That said, I have still had a lot of fun.

Verdict: Well worth the money, but still room for improvement.

I bought the Oculus-Quest 2 Advanced for my 13-year old as a Christmas gift, and he says "...it's the best gift ever".  I think that's sums up everything, but according to my kid it's life-like play, all-enveloping environment and infotainment is spectacular, vivid and fun.  The headset is capable, easy to use and lasts up to 5.5 hours on a charge.  The only drawback was that the initial setup wasn't intuitive, but there are plenty of tutorials on how to complete setup, and correct any mistakes especially with the PIN.

This device has changed my life. After getting carpal tunnel from gaming on PCs for years, I've stayed away from gaming for a long time. But now with the Quest 2, not only can I game without injuring my hands, but my whole body is up and at it doubling as an activity device to ensure I get some extra daily exercise.

Absolutely love it. Oh did I mention, its plug and play/ Instant gratification? Unlike My HP Reverb G2, I dont have to spend half my gaming time troubleshooting and rebooting a PC just to get a game going.

very good device, it is may not be the best but fairly awesome PC VR capable headset, and as well the best you can get as stand alone VR headset. as the price and the capability, it is very much worth it.
the only concern for many may just be the fact you will have to link up your Facebook account to the device, but if it does not bother you, this piece of hardware is very promising.
this is by far my subjectively favorite VR headset since the DK1 days and after owning over 5 headsets (not counting in my DK1 and DK2).

Deserving a 5-stars, but with the requirement of a Facebook account I can't. Which is a shame, because this is an awesome piece of tech. Oculus has made VR affordable and more appealing to the mainstream. Games play incrediblely well, and with the addition of Oculus Link, there is a huge growing library of titles to play. Beatsaber, Half-Life Alyx, Walking Dead: Saints and Sinners and many great titles are all reasons to invest in VR. If you don't mind Facebook integration, then this device is an easy recommendation.

What a great time I'm having with this. I was curious about the technology and thought I would give it a try. I am VERY happy I did. I have been playing video games since Pong and thought this would be a fun addition to my collection. I am very pleased with the system. Some may complain about a short battery/ charge on the headset, but it actually is long enough to enjoy playing and not risk missing an appointment. I hope game developers get on board and support this system. I most definitely recommend this product.

This is a lot of fun to play-just make sure you're not close to any breakables :)

The biggest drawback (for me, at least) is that the only way to purchase games is through the Oculus itself and it takes a "reloadable" type of Visa/Mastercard to make the purchase with. I'm not quite sure how I'll gift my grandson any future games.

The other two drawbacks (again for me) is that it is painfully expensive and is locked to a Facebook account

I'm hoping my grandson has as much fun playing with it as I did testing it :D

We were happy to find the VR at Best Buy where we have shopped for gaming devices in the past. Good service and there is always someone willing to assist with questions.   My son loves the Oculus and to be honest I like it as well.  It has something for everyone in terms of content and the library keeps growing.  The only reason I rated it a 4 is due to the fact you cannot use it without it being connected to a facebook account, and the fact that they are sold individually so you have to purchase multiple devices if you have more than one user in the house and they want to interact together in the VR realm. It was also somewhat challenging to find quality accessories or replacement pieces for it in stock anywhere.  Some of the "off brand" items aren't quite up to snuff.

It’s a really nice unit for a standalone, the price doesn’t kill you either.  It’s comfortable, and it recognizes your movements pretty well for a stand alone unit. It has several great games and the graphics are on par with most vr set ups. My only complaint ( not even really a complaint) is that there aren’t enough titles, and the diversity of games could be a little better. That being said I realize it is on the newer side of the vr spectrum,  and I’m sure the number and style of games will continue to increase.

Unless you plan on side-loading and downloading a ton of games from the Oculus store, the 64gb versions may suit you just fine.  

Though perhaps games will get larger in the coming couple of years, maybe that 256gb will be handy.  Mark Zuckerberg said they're already working on the 3rd version of this though so you'll probably upgrade to the new ones anyway.  

Well worth the price, this is an awesome system.  Got VirtualDesktop to play more robust VR games as well, and it works really well once you've set it up.

I can't recommend the Quest enough! This device will change your life! Seriously.

Before reading this review, understand that I am not comparing it to other headsets on the market. This review is evaluating the Quest for what it is meant to be... The Quest is a casual VR headset. It is not intended to be compared to $700+ VR headsets or powerful gaming computers.
I think of the Quest as the Nintendo Switch of VR headsets. It's perfect for doing what it has been designed to do.
I play every night. I'm 45 and I have lost over 20 pounds since I purchased my first Quest three months ago. When the Quest 2 came out, I bought it on release day.
I purchased the 256GB model because I am interested creating 3D video and storing media on it permanently. However, if I was just using it for games, I would have only purchased the 64GB version. The largest game is 5GB (The new Star Wars game) but most are well under 2GB. Like a smartphone app, once you purchase a game or app, you own it and can uninstall and re-install it as often as you'd like.
The setup is easy. VR games are something that you have to experience to appreciate and the Occulus Quest is the perfect device for introducing yourself or anyone else to the possibilities of VR.
I believe that the Quest's strengths are in social VR experiences, fitness, and casual gaming.
If you are looking to play flight simulators, AAA games, or graphic-intensive gaming, the Quest is the wrong device and you will need to invest at least $700 in the headset, not to mention a $1500+ gaming computer to connect it to.
The Quest is an all-in-one device, although you can also connect it to a PC and use it to play the fancy stuff too.
There are only a few negatives:
1. The construction is not excellent. VR headsets are not intended for anyone under 13, so this Quest expects the user to take care of the device. It's sturdy enough to withstand anything the average adult might use it for, but I wouldn't trust it to hold up to a birthday party of 10-year-olds.
2. The screen contrast isn't as nice as most cell phones. The blacks are more of a dark gray. However, the resolution is Amazing and it will only get better as Oculus unlocks some of the more advanced features that are currently disabled to make the headset compatible with the previous generation.
3. The game/app library is somewhat limited. However, it is continuously expanding and there are also ways to sideload games that aren't in the official Oculus library. This is a nerd thing, but it's not difficult for anyone who is even slightly comfortable tweaking with the settings of their gadgets.
The best of the Oculus Quest:
1. This headset is worth every penny! If you've never played games in VR, it will change your life. If you are a heavy VR user, you will love the ability to play without being tethered to your computer by a cable.
2. Welcome to the community. There are Oculus users all over the world and you will quickly discover that they are eager to help others learn the tips and tricks of the "culture."
3. You will get in better shape. Unless you already get your heart rate over 120 at least once a day and stretch regularly, you will see changes in your physical fitness. Finding games that don't require above average physical activity is difficult. I actually bought extra foam mask inserts from Oculus because I don't like swapping sweat with the people I show it to.
If you buy any extras for the Oculus 2, I recommend buying third-party accessories. The extra strap, Link cable, and case made by Oculus are vastly inferior to the similar priced (or in many cases lower-priced) third-party alternatives.

If you have not had the chance to experience VR then the time has never been better. With this headset you can experience most of what VR has to offer. From the freedom to play great VR titles in almost any room to connecting to a VR ready PC and playing steam titles through the Oculus Link (Sold Separately). 

Pros:
No cables (Even to connect to PC through Virtual Desktop Paid)
Very comfortable and intuitive controllers.
Setup is fast and no external sensors to worry about
Great visual and minimal screen door effect.

Cons:
2 Hour battery is great to prevent long sessions but wish it could be longer.
Can be front heavy and adds a little more pressure than PCVR headsets.
White headstrap gets dirty easily.

Overall it has been a great upgrade from the original oculus rift.

I am really enjoying almost every aspect of the Quest 2. Keep in mind that this is the first VR headset I have owned (played plenty before, just didn’t own). It is so simple and intuitive. The only real downside is the facebook aspect that I didn’t realize when I bought. Had to recover my account and ensure I updated all of my privacy settings since I don’t really use facebook and would prefer people don’t suck me back into facebook. Only other minor downside is there are a few games I always wanted to play that are unavailable because they are exclusive to other brands. I’ll just play them elsewhere since having this device be completely stand alone and wireless (if desired) is way too amazing. If Calve ever puts out a wireless Index, I’ll be down…until then Quest it is!

As an Oculus Rift owner, a PSVR owner, an Oculus Quest owner and now an Oculus 2 owner.   

Oops, I'm a VR addict!  This device is stunning, it's a marked improvement from the Quest 1 and if you have never stepped foot into VR before.. brace yourself, the future is NOW.

I hate the Facebook requirement and I hate the build quality of the "elite head straps" ..  but that's not a discussion point for this review for me.   The Oculus Quest is phenomenal and feels like it is something that everyone has to experience.

It was a great thing to buy for my little girl birthday and she has not stop playing with it and overall I think this is a great item to buy for your kids since you can do so much things with it. Also me and my kid love to do mentation on it and also my kid loves job simulator because she likes to do all the jobs there and she likes to draw as well so whenever she draws she like to draw the different characters of job simulator and it just has her think of new ideas to do so I think this was a great thing to buy.

Best keeps getting better. I’ve owned the Oculus Go, Quest, and now Quest 2. This is how to experience consumer VR. This is for the crowd who says “I’d like to try VR but don’t want a whole technical setup or maintenance process. Why can’t it be like a game console?”
The Go and Quest gave us an untethered, fully wireless experience, and the Quest 2 improves the screen and processor to really bring it home. The technology will continue to improve. But there’s no reason to wait anymore. You won’t be disappointed.

I would not recommend this product. I owned the Oculus VR headset you use your phone with and I enjoyed that. Bought a new phone and it was not compatible.  I figured this was the latest things so I went with it.
First, hard to use with glasses, so without it is somewhat blurry.
second, too many things need to be paid for to use. Hardly any free stuff. Could not get it to cast to my Chrome TV or my Phone.
No real instructions. The little that did work was decent.Thank God for YouTube. OVerall was not impressed.

Absolutely magic - between watching movies, baseball, playing games, and chatting with friends our Quest 2 gets a ton of use! The headset fits comfortably and the controllers are pretty responsive. The only issue we've had is the headset seems to lose tracking easier than the Quest 1 did.  The controllers don't chew through batteries as quickly as the previous Quest. 

Overall, if you're looking to purchase one, spring for the 256GB option. Space can fill up pretty quickly in this machine with games and apps.

Bought this thinking that it couldn’t keep up with my HTC Vive Cosmos, and boy was I wrong. This blew it away. Simple setup, less wires and can play all my previous games from my Steam library without the need to repurchase them. Would highly recommend this product to anyone looking to get into VR, but would suggest buying the 256 as the amount of game space is limited by the smaller version and can’t be expanded further. 
Plays so well I sold my Vive Cosmos and couldn’t have been happier with that decision.

Amazing device. The gaming and even just exploring the 360 degree web videos are next level. Brings you right into the future when you throw this bad boy on. BUT my right controller one day decided to stop working and not connect. I then looked up the issue and it seems to be a problem with many other devices as well. So that is a pain in the butt. Would love to give this a 5 star but for that I can’t go thst high on it. Again amazing but just has issues that should be addressed before putting them on shelf

It works very well and can last for hours, and compared to the last oculus it doesn't really overheat. And the new menu layouts are really nice. However the way you adjust the lenses on this set compared to the last one is a bit annoying. Since for this one you grab the lanse in the headset and move them, which means taking it off and putting it on, where as the last one had a slider on the outside you could use while still wearing it. However, the lenses has been my only big concern. It has done very well.

Do not buy an Oculus! They are a lot of fun but their customer service is useless. My Facebook was hacked which locked me out of the Oculus. I’ve been trying for a month to get someone at Oculus to help. Multiple emails and no one has helped at all. I can’t find a phone number to contact Oculus or Facebook. My options are to sell them or start a new account and lose all the money that I’ve invested in games. I would rather buy from a company that will back up their problems and help when a problem happens.

There are no words to describe how cool it is.  The whole family fights over it, even though me and my husband have never played video games before.  Things that could be improved upon: 

--Having profiles so you switch users and save your progress on an individual level
--Not having to include facebook in your experience (you absolutely must have a facebook account). 
--A longer battery life. 

Besides those things, it is awesome. There aren't very many free games, so plan on spending some money on those.

2nd gen VR absolutely stunning.  Video quality superb.  360° videos are amazing feels like you are really there.  Make sure you have Facebook account and the oculus app downloaded.  You can queue some free or paid games and other stuff from the app and it will download when you turn on the device. You can also select purchase with the device.
The games are simply amazing.  There is a web browser oculus has, if there is a video with VR content you can play it.  I am so happy with Quest 2, highly recommend.

VR has come a long way. This is by far the cheapest and most impressive headset I've used to date. I've tested the original Oculus dev kits and it's truly a marvel how far they've come.

For the cost it's too good to be true. So I'm skeptical about the longevity of this unit. Currently the best games are on steam or just flat out expensive. I installed ALVR on my PC but if you want to pay for a less troublesome experience, try Virtual Desktop then use Steam VR after.

This issue also lead me to consider downgrading to the 64gb, but during this time quest 2 volume was stretched thin.

There are plenty of free games to get your feet wet on the oculus store. There are really impressive games on the oculus store, but they are still far and few between as the VR landscape evolves again.

I didnt purchese this my card was stolen by my cousin while i was incarserated. I would love to know why indentifcation or at the very least a copy of the card that was used for the paymenf? 425$ is a lof of money to spend at best buy considering me my husband and 4 children are homless due to us being laid off for covid 19 i would love a full refund. I already filed a report with the proper authorites however my account information has been changed because of this situation please contact me 3305411938

The Oculus Quest 2 stands alone as the best VR headset money can buy. It continues to get loads of new features as well such as hand tracking, 90hz (better frame rate), and more graphical enhances to the Oculus link mode (lets you connect a gaming pc to it). I will be selling my PC Rift S most likely because this is the best of all worlds. I can't recommend this VR headset enough. I recommend the 256gig version since the headset cannot be upgraded with additional space later and some games may lose save files if you uninstall them. But if you are a casual gamer 64 gigs should be more than enough. I recommend this headset to absolutely everyone. Try not to compare it to the PSVR as it is a very different product. Wireless VR with this much resolution at this frame rate is remarkable.

the headset seems to be to heavy and not seem to be properly secured by that simple strap.  Vision can also be hard to adjust resulting in lack of detail clarity.  Games selection is very small and almost always requires purchase plus further dlc to get the most out of it.  However, it is a fun console and realistic in simulating virtual reality and tracking movements, easy to use and attractive yet simple UI, and it does include other free features besides games that are fun to explore like VR videos.

Hours of fun!  Looking into getting another since my kids sometimes fight over who plays (as I wonder when it's my turn).  It really does feel like you are there.  You do have to buy some of the games, but it was worth it to buy Fruit Ninja and Angry Birds.  I would highly recommend the 2 year protection plan since this is a spendy item and does cover accidents.  On a side note, if you have hardwood floors and kids, you may want to have them play on an area carpet (just in case they drop the handheld).

This is the VR headset you've been waiting for. No cords mean you are free to move around the play area unhindered. The increased resolution of the display is jaw dropping and the social interaction apps like big screen are polished and engaging. One of my favorite features is being able to double tap the side of the headset and immediately be able to see your surroundings. Great if someone needs your attention as you can interact with the real world without removing the headset. Game changing feature!

After about a month of use, I'm having a really good time with this VR headset. Graphics and framerate are okay and can be changed through third party software. There are now better games available to play like RE4 VR and the Walking Dead S&S. My biggest complaint about this headset is the battery life; IT SUCKS. Getting a compatible power bank is a must if you want to play more than 3 hours.

Point is, if you're someone who wants a mid-tier quality experience in VR, then this is the headset for you.
