For the most part this product was exactly as described. Lots of fun.  The headgear is a little bit front heavy. I would suggest buying an extra battery pack with Velcro straps and strap it on the back of the head gear straps.  The apparatus will be more balanced. I would suggest buying the rollercoaster game. It seems like you are actually being jerked around in side the cart.  It would be nice if the consumer could replace the battery. You also have to have a Facebook account in order to use this.

I’ve read a lot of reviews before purchasing this VR headset and I have to say, it is well worth the price. The fact that it is completely wireless allows you move around freely and not get tangled up in cords, while playing some very immersive games. Also, don’t worry about the battery life, you’ll be too physically exhausted to want to play that long, 2 hours.
I am giving this 4 stars because of three negatives, personal opinions.
- the strap isn’t the greatest and requires a lot of adjustments if you share it...get the elite strap. It is well worth it.
- the sound system isn’t the best, you can easily hear background noise which can be annoying at times.
-you can use this in complete darkness...the device requires lighting for tracking.
Overall, this is a great VR headset for the price.

I like it, but having to pay for everything as far as games not as consumer friendly as I've spent over $300 for the device there could be more free games. The device is awesome itself great everything. I just wish I wasn't paying $30 for games etc. Meta horizons is cool, but weird hearing other ppl talk to you...I'll get used to it as this will be a norm in later years. Plus many ppl have said that some games get boring or repetitive so i hate to spend 30 abd the wow factor is gone in 3 days.

Best purchase I have EVER made! Im a 54 yr old female so dont let age or gender dissuade your decision to buy or not. Oculus is soooo much fun. From silly games, to meditation, touring countries you may never see and my favorite, Supernatural! I really wish they would have named this app something sifferant be auae at first i thought is was occult. 100% NO WAY is this the case. Its an excercise app led by awesome coaches in beautiful locations with your personal choice of difficulty and music!

Quest 2 is my first step in to the world of Virtual Reality and it is absolutely stunning. The possibilities and experiences are endless from watching a movie, stunning videos to playing games. This looks very promising for the future of the gaming. It's easy to setup, though it forces you to have a facebook login, for obvious reasons. To protect others around you and your household items, the virtual boundary is a nicely implemented safety feature. There are some cool games, my favorite so far has been the pingpong - where you can practice and play with AI at different levels..simply amazing. It has been a couple months since I bought it and am already loving it..its truly amazing experience at affordable price. If you want to splurge there is no dearth of games and accessories to upgrade..

I was a little skeptical about the Quest as I found Oculus's previous product clunky and annoying to set up.  The Quest is VERY different.  No computer needed, and set up is quite easy. The technology has improved immensely as well, with much less motion sickness.  The games are frighteningly realistic (and Beat Saber is especially fun for the Star Wars fans out there).  Your friends can watch along with the phone app, which makes it a much more group-friendly activity.  I highly recommend it!

So far the best VR headset I’ve used. I’ve had a rift cv1 and a rift s and this beats it solely because it’s wireless. You can even wirelessly play PCVR games with a compatible router (it’s an unofficial feature but it works amazingly with no more latency than with a link cable). The only gripe is the included strap is awful, as well as there isn’t much IPD adjustment. I haven’t found a perfect setting of the 3 it gives you so everything is still slightly blurry. This varies person to person.

The cuddle service was OUTSTANDING! I was kindly greeted at the door told them what i needed and i was pointed directly in the direction i needed to be.. The man asked what I needed i told him Oculus Quest 2 he asked the 64 or 128gb i told him 128gb and by the time i looked down into my purse to get the payment he was running me up. I was in and out in less than 5 minutes! Very welcoming and a place I'd go to again! 1st time in the store and it was 5 stars without a doubt. Thank U Best Buy

It was great for just over a month.  One week after warranty ended, the right controller (rift) disconnected.  We changed the batteries, un-paired, re-paired and finally it connected.  It worked again for a few hours and disconnected again.  This time we could not get it paired.  Took it to BestBuy for help and they pointed out it was 9 days past warranty and they could not help.  Cool toy but an expensive disappointment for my 11 year old.  Not if, when it breaks, you are on your own....

Very fun device, and worth every penny! My only gripe is that it doesn't come with a dock/ carrying case or anything like that. All it literally comes with is the charger, the silicon shield thing, and the controllers. I will also admit that the battery life is a bit below expected, and it only lasts 3 hours max. Also, the games are quite expensive when theyre not in bundles which also was a bit annoying since it came with literally no games. That's where the last star went in my opinion.

Wow, is all I can say. My whole family loves it. The headset itself is a little heavy and does give you a headache after a while, but it’s incredible! Even the “cartoony” games without the realistic graphics just suck you in.  The social/online multiplayer games are a little lame though (for adults) as they’re filled with little kids trying to act cool and curse, so it gets old fast.  We ended up with two (shipping issue right before Christmas- FedEx lost it!) so we ordered another for pickup for Christmas Eve, same day the missing one showed up, a week late! We are ended up keeping both and thank goodness we did, with 4 of us dying to play constantly 2 was definitely required!

The one game that uses hand tracking is incredible- no controllers required. I can’t wait until they release more games!

I love this! I bought the extra battery and the elite strap and it's SO worth it. Upgraded from original Rift and I have to say, being untethered is worth every penny. I don't know if the resolution is any better than the Rift or Rift S, but I can't notice it. I'd recommend getting some controller grips and a different strap if you plan on playing for more than 30 minutes at a time. I don't like that you have to connect to a facebook account, but I just made up a fake one and used that.

This is a great VR HMD! The quest 2 is easy to use, has a high resolution, and plenty of features that make it worth the money. The ability to play without a PC is great, but I primarily use the Quest 2 to stream PC VR directly to the quest. I purchased Virtual Desktop to wirelessly stream to the Quest. Now, Oculus has their own version of wireless streaming that works pretty well too. Playing VR without wires is what this headset is all about! The only downside to owning this system is that you have to have a facebook account connected to use it. I am not sure what data Facebook sells its partners about me, but apparently it is worth about $400 dollars (the difference between the commercial Quest 2 which doesn't require a FB account, and the consumer Quest 2). Still, a great VR Head Mounted Display.

If you have and want a facebook account then its a 10 outa 5. But if you dont like me and just wanted to do the vr and not be forced into having a facebook account then i dont recommend. They can ban you for having a fake account as well and you will loose all the money you spent on games and brick your headset. Everything is awesome other than the facebook forcing you to have a account. The games that i have bought are great and so much fun fruit ninja and beat saber and hrs of fun.

The Quest is incredibly fun way to get off you’d butt and get active! With Beat Saber, Tilt Brush? Vader Immortal  and 360 you can be engaged for an good 1-2 hours or more. Painting and drawing is super fun. Visiting places like the rock palace in Jordan is super fun in the 360 youtube theater... great experience that keeps you moving!! And for more advanced fun hook it up to your Pc and play Star Wars Squadron. Amazing kick butt graphics that leader some people with motion sickness.

warning: Causes nausea. 
Was fun when I sat down and threw the ball or hit the ping pong ball but other stuff was really dumb especially the recreation room that had signs like everybody be nice to each other. F that liberal woke b*******. They're are the least accepting of all.
Very uncomfortable on your head.
Very vague introduction and instructions
They're just stealing your eye movement for their robot inventions which are destroying the world. Help destroy America, vote Democrat

I actually returned the 64G version because not enough space.  I installed 4 games, and it's already almost half full.  So I got this one instead.  I got the first one thinking i will only play steam games, but they have enough content in the Oculus store to justify getting more memory.  And it's nice not to have to fire up your PC every time you want to VR.  This is an excellent excellent VR headset.  The tracking is lightyears ahead of my Microsoft one.  The wireless is also great.

It’s really good! Totally worth the money. I just got two new games for it, I have been playing Five Nights at Freddys for 5 years and to see it in VR for the first time was amazing. It feels like I’m actually there and the controls are amazing. I haven’t had it for that long but I can’t think of any problems with it other than trying to run a computer with it or the wires that work with it, but I’m not tech savvy so it’s a bit hard for me. Other than that it’s worth the money! 100%

Awesome product, great overall experience, 90 refresh rate helps to not get motion sickness is fast frame rate scenes or movement within games. 

1 con: Requires Facebook to use. I personally don’t use Facebook anymore so I made a fake account. Facebook is now banning fake accounts which bricks your Occulus essentially making it a paper weight. Also any store purchases are lost. You have to agree to let Facebook store all of your personal data, private messages, record any and all phone calls and messages related to Facebook. Read the fine print of what they track on your Facebook. Also any store purchases you had on a fake account will be lost.

This this did not require facebook I’d give it a 4/5 overall. The Steam VR Valve Index has 120 refresh rate and uses steam games without the need fir Facebook.

As an owner of the original Oculus Quest, I can say this feels more like a crossgrade than an upgrade.  What you gain in resolution, you lose in contrast ratio.  My screen is constantly light gray.  There is no such thing as black anymore.  This really hurts your ability to feel immersed, as you're constantly aware of the edges of your vision.

I'd recommend the original Oculus Quest over this one for this reason.  It also features what most people evaluate as a superior headband.

Really really love playing on this.  Its really immersive.  You almost get lost in the VR world and forget about what's happening in the real one!! Great for the current state of things in the world.  There are some very fun free games to download like Echo VR!! Lots of cool games and experiences to have on this headset!   Beat Saber a must own game!! Have not gotten into the "chat" areas yet, but did customize an avatar for it.  Overall very pleased with my VR experience do far!

This was the perfect birthday gift for my boyfriend. He loves boxing on it. Yes you need Facebook but a dummy account works (though you’ll have to add your credit card for purchases). They refund you if you buy a game you don’t like and request it right away. Better if you have some space but we use it in a medium size room and it works. It’s a great workout. Definitely not a good idea if you’re prone to migraines or had a lot to drink, but otherwise totally worth the money IMO.

I am absolutely thrilled with the EDGE II.  I have wanted a virtual reality headset for a really long time. And it really is like being in real life situations.  The only unfortunate part for me is when you purchase an app there’s never any instructions on how to use the app. So I end up getting a return or a refund and just getting out of it because I’m just totally frustrated. But the headset the oculus II is awesome. I just wish I knew how to play the games better or at all.

Totally exceeded my expectations.  I purchased this for my husband for the golf game.  We have found it to be so much more than a game.  We my husband and I are currently retired and isolated from most family and friends due to Covid 19.  The Oculus has not just been fun but also an educational tool.  It has allowed us to travel and learn about places through the advanced technology.   The visual through this device is something we have only seen at Disney or Universal studios.

This is a great device. I wear glasses to read things close up and thought this wouldn’t work. It works great without my glasses. 
I had to return the first one via ups and the serial number on the box doesn’t match the one on the headset. They sent the broken one back to me. I checked with Oculus and there are 4 different serial numbers. One for each different handset, one for the headset, and one for the whole system. If you return it, save time and take it back to the store.

I absolutely love this head set!!!  At 55 I thought my video game days were over. A family member gave me my first occupied 4'years ago and I was hooked!! I got the obvious go a year later and though it was awesome but the quest 2 takes the cake!! The experience takes me away from my stressful job . puts me in contact with friends from all over the country and the fitness games are so much fun and challenging . I good  way to keep in shape, fight off Zombies and see the world.

This has been a lot of fun for the whole family.  It is difficult to use on small members of our family but still a lot of fun.  Game library is extensive as is other apps such as videos and or first person POV videos/movies.  Controls are intuitive (our 6 year old figured it out) as well.  Careful if you get motion sickness easy.  You'll want to ease into the amount of time you spend in VR.  Battery life could be improved as well but is definitely good for a few hours of fun.

The Oculus Quest 2 is a great piece of hardware, and has the potential to truly transform gaming -The headset fits well and the basic strap is comfortable and versatile, but the whole thing feels just a touch too heavy at times -The system requires a Facebook account, meaning it's not for kids under 13 as their own system; it also means that there's a slim chance you'll get multiple user accounts on the same device -The are many games for the Quest 2, but very few rise to the level of AAA titles on other systems -I am not able to cast Quest 2 video to my brand new VIZIO TV, but I hope that gets solved soon with a firmware update for either the Quest or the TV -Despite its missing software and potential compatibility issues, the Quest 2 is totally a buy for people who love to game and want a unique experience

This is my first and only VR experience. Got mine delivered really fast. I was able to set up everything with no problem and with ease. Truly a awesome  experience to be in a virtual world. You actually forget that what you see isn't actually real. I found myself oftentimes carefully not bumping into the i.e. furniture in the virtual world when it was just space and nothingness outside of it. One of the coolest features I am stumped about is that if you leave a certain area that you have previously marked, the headset has a grayscale camera that reveals what's in front of you. This is extremely useful for safety measures as it alerts you if you stray too far from your marked territory. Absolutely love it! Also, the headset lasts for about two hours before you need to recharge if you're playing games nonstop.

Excellent. I got this for Christmas. I was very surprised at how easy it was to use. The interface is very intuitive. I was also surprised to find that there is something for everyone. Wife and kids have played it extensively. Graphics are better than expected. Not as good as linking to my gaming laptop but much better than I thought it would be. The POV videos are very cool. Haven’t watched a movie in it yet but the combat games can get quite intense!  Highly recommend this.

So awesome and so fun.  Played a friend's unit and promptly bought this.  Pretty intuitive to use.  The head strap system is not the best so I immediately got an aftermarket adjustable setup which is really great.  The games are seemingly affordable (most at around $30, which is way better than $59 for Switch games), and there is a small selection of good free games too.  Overall the tech seems to have come a long way and is great now but I'm sure will continue to get better.

I own the original Oculus CV1 when it was in beta 5 years ago. Let me start off by saying this is the future of VR. The Quest 2 is superior in every aspect. I played Super Hot VR and I actually fell down thinking I was going to be sitting on a sofa when the gun was. That is how immersed I felt. I own the PSVR as well, this blows it out of the water. You will be very happy you got this. I want to get more for my family members, but I am not rich so they will just have to wait.

Bought this over the holiday season. What I really wanted was an Xbox Series X but no luck ever finding one that wasn’t a resell for a ridiculous amount of cash over retail, but I guess that’s where we are now. Anyways, decided to buy the Quest 2 instead. Heard great reviews about it being all in one and a great intro in to VR. And after using it for a while I can honestly say that this is the case. It’s very fun to use and easy learning how to. I’m happy with this purchase.

Love it! You become so immersed in every world it’s insane! However there is some catches to an amazing device. 1. The lens fog and flares. Thought maybe mine was faulty but it turns out this is most of them. 2. Battery life, you get a good 2 hours but then it’s dead. 3. Limitation of games without computer. Overall the Oculus is fantastic but these limitation limit me from giving it a 5/5 stars. Still better than most VR devices out there though. The technology is just new.

Better than the previous Oculus but I wish the IPD would go higher. Only 3 settings for IPD (eye width) and if you have wide eyes like me, it might be a bit out of focus. The original Oculus had better IPD settings. However, with the speed bum and improved screen quality for $100 less than the original, this is about the best value for good VR you'll get. The headset sensors and hand/controller  tracking are great. So nice not to have to worry about setting up towers in your room. You can use these anywhere in the house (warning: don't use in direct sunlight it will damage the sensors). The setup is so easy. I really like the original Oculus and this was a great upgrade, although some features on the original I still prefer (better strap, OLED screen, controller size, IPD). Still highly recommend this product.

This is pretty amazing! Bought this for my son‘s 16th birthday. No he didn’t want to car he wanted a virtual reality headset. I thought Ha! Spent $400 or 5000. He loves it, if my wife put it on has found her self playing games and watching a movie on it. Very well-made. Will recommend the elite has strep which me feel a lot more comfortable. Also I picked up the USB connector cable to plug into his laptop. With us and play his virtual reality games on steam. Extra bonus. :-)

This is incredible. I feel like I'm experiencing technology out of a sci-fi movie. From playing games, which I'm not that good of to sitting back, just watching a video, it is an experience I can't just describe, you have to experience it yourself.  My favorite so far is the meditation app TRIPP. It takes you to a whole new world. I also like experiencing the 360 travel videos you can find on YouTube. Makes me want to go out and get my own 360 camera and make my own videos.

Oculus has out done themselves with the Quest 2! Whether you want to lose weight with many available apps that are so fun, you’ll forget you’re exercising, or if you just want to sit around and watch a movie, look no further! For those who have not experienced VR (Virtual Reality) you’re in for a treat, and that’s a gross understatement! It has something for everyone! With thousands of things to do and many more added daily, be prepared to be addicted to some serious fun!

This is a nice upgrade from the Oculus Go. The newer games really make this a great experience. Resolution is slightly better, Frame rate is higher (a huge plus for sickness control), and process easing power is much better. 
Limited games and content makes enjoy time somewhat limiting. I would love to see much more content. I see people playing VR games online only to find out it’s not available on Oculus... disappointing. 

Overall, it’s pretty cool for short term play.

Best Christmas present for my wife. You want to make the wife happy, buy her the Oculus Quest 2. My wife has already subscribed to Supernatural fitness website and bought saber beats game. She has been using oculus quest 2 since Christmas Eve and plays it until the battery runs out.   I have tried it once  and love the VR experience. The Saber Beat game is fantastic.  Since I may never get to use her Quest 2 ever again, I will buy one for me when it comes available again.

Oh my gosh, I am not a gamer, but I brought this for my husband for Christmas to give him something to do during COVID.  Well, I tried it first and I have to say, is the best piece of electronics that I have ever played.  You feel like you are actually playing games, such as tennis or working out.   After playing a few games I find my self sweating like I ran a mile.  I have been playing Oculus every day since Christmas and I have already lost two pounds.   Best invention

I’ve been a gamer for 30 years and have never had an experience that compares to my time with the Oculus Quest 2. First off, it’s great for all ages. There are games and apps for everyone — and I’ve been able to share my love for gaming with my wife. I strongly suggest purchasing a chrome cast (if you don’t already own one) so you can mirror on the TV what the player is seeing. 

If you are all curious about VR — quit waiting, do yourself a favor, and purchase a Quest 2!

It is a little disconcerting at first because you can't believe what you are seeing but it is a wonderful experience! Everything looks so realistic. The ability to create the boundary and then see the boundary as you get too close to it is awesome! The ability to see real world objects outside of your preset boundary is a nice feature. I like that we can cast what is inside the headset to a phone or tv screen so everyone can see it. While it is awesome, it is expensive.

With all the downsides of Facebook this is still a great VR headset and will definitely make a good first impression. I recommend, but remember to budget about 100 extra for a couple of games, most are under 5gb downloads so if needed save the 100 bucks on the storage depending on your needs. With everything being said I will need the 256gb model. Also with the link cable (not included) you can also plug it into your pc and play VR games from there as well, great value!

I’ve spent several hours jacked in pretty much every day since I got the Quest 2.  To be honest, the games are pretty short and the battery life on the headset leaves something to be desired, but I love it nonetheless.

It’s awesome that it’s all-in-one and wireless, but it does seem to lose tracking sometimes (enough to affect Beat Saber game play for example), but in general it’s very satisfying to play...for the first time I can actually call gaming an “experience.”

I love it. Its my first ever VR headset and I am so happy with this purchase. The battery life is around 2 hours, so if i plan on using it more than that I make sure its connected and charging. The software could use some updating but its nothing majoy of an issue, I keep hearing news for improvments yet to come and I cant wait whats in store for the future. I settled for the 256GB version and im not even half way! But i do not regret, i wanted to future proof myself.

I need your help I bought an oculus two at best buys and I went to return to get a new one because the controllers are not working and I have emailed oculus to fix and I have not had luck fixing and now best buy are telling me the serial number is not the same one that came in the box. I need your help please  I wasted a lot of money on this and I know I'm not the only one this happened too.... make sure you open at the store and have them check for you. now I'm stuck

Battery life lasts between 45-60 minutes depending on usages. Charging the unit takes about 1.5 - 2 hours to fully charge. There are very limited free games & all games are normally pricy, some offer rebates. As per viewing/streaming movies, it is okay. The display or viewing was suppose to be at 4K but I still see pixels in process to develope. Overall product cost was about 600 with the Insurance protection, I should have rather invested this cost in something else.

The Oculus Quest 2 has been the most fun my family has had with a video game. It gets you up, and active. You don't just sit around and push buttons. The equipment is built well and easy to understand.  Some of the games definitely take some training to get used to how to operate the controls, but most are fairly easy to understand. The system does not come loaded with a bunch of games you don't want, just enough to get you up and going, and that is nice. 
Negatives about the system. For the money that you do pay for it, it would have been nice to get some credit for some game purchases. Also the system is not set up to support multiple player usage. So basically the entire shares one account. 
So all in all, I definitely would recommend you at least try this system out. If you do, I'm sure you will end up owning one.

Although the unit works, one of the key features of the quest 2, is the ability to share apps between accounts.  If you have 2 devices, the secondary account on the one with app sharing and the other one is using the admin account then all is good.  If you have a third one you have to buy the apps on that one because app sharing across up to four accounts only works on one device.  If you want to play most games in multi player mode as your own user then you will have to purchase the apps on the third device.  Only a few games will allow two devices to log in with the admin account with the third as a different user on the app shared device.  This needs to be changed from a device sharing to a user app sharing.  Define your shared accounts within the oculus and good to go, but for now, not worth buying a third device.

So far so good with my Quest 2. I had the original, and this version is far superior. My only gripe is the strap that comes with the headset. As many have complained it does cut into my ears. This paired with the elite strap with the battery is a good fit. Much more comfortable the the original with the deluxe audio strap mod (Frankenquest). If your thinking about getting into VR this is the headset to go with as long as you don't mind the manditory Facebook account.

A step up from the Quest 1 in regards software such as speed, graphics quality, higher refresh rate,  but a step down in regards to hardware such as ipd adjustment or the strap, which makes it feel cheap but also makes it light which is usually preferred. So there's not a design where you can have it all, that's pretty much have engineering is I guess, every advantage has it's disadvantages.
I'm planning to get the elite strap and see how better it feels on my head.

Best buy employees should let the customer know this device does not work without a facebook account. Also you should have one displayed, not hidden at front desk. It took me half hour to get a hold of one of you and search in the store for it, only. to find out stupefied that I need to go to the cashier and ask for one. How do you expect your customers to dream that the oculus quest devices are at the cashier desk? ALL electronic items should be displayed in store.

A mixed bag for me.

Hate the Facebook integration. I cannot for the life of me understand why that is mandatory. But thankfully for me, I haven't faced any issues with getting locked out etc. 
Hate the fact that the perfect viewing angle is very elusive. I always feel that something isn't in focus. 
Don't like the graphics and text being jagged. Very irritating. 

Like the fact that it is simple to set up. Starts working without too much hassle. 
Love it when my older folks get to view immersive videos and enjoy them. 
Sidequest is really good. Set it up - you've to jump a few hoops but worth it. 
Sideloading Doom, Rtcw was awesome. Waiting to get half life 1.
Great potential but surely, there will be much better iterations in the future. 
The EU is pushing for FB to not be integrated - hope that happens in the US too.

Quest 2 VR is great.  There are some problems getting it to connect to the computer via the USB C connector on USB 3.  Sometimes it does and sometimes not.  Very frustrating.  Stand alone works perfect and the apps that load on it are also perfect.  However if you need to play an app from the computer you might be lucky if it connects otherwise you have to settle for USB 2, using an USB A to C connection,  at 480mb.  You therefore may get some glitches/stuttering.

I absolutely love this thing.  I am in VR  daily using all the active games and fitness apps.  It is an awesome supplement to my fitness routines/gym sesh.     The new smaller form factor makes this more comfortable and the graphics are wonderful. I also love how i can travel to space or to other countries via youtube vr or other vr apps. Even better, how i can hang out with my peeps without being in the same state.  lol  I highly recommend this headset.  So fun!

Ive had a few of these over the years and even had the dev 1 kit years ago. This fills the promise from that first idea. For the price its a fantastic product. For double the price its still fantastic. My kids enjoy it and i love it. Fit is comfortable and being able to adjust the pd is awesome! I have a wide pd so some units are not as clear. The facebook thing doesnt bother me. Not sure why people are so mad about it. Facebook will be chillin with myspace soon!

I like this better than my original rift as no pc tethering requirement. Although you can tether to a PC to play the more demanding games. Priced decently but no killer game/use case yet. I wish they come up with a lifelike tennis racket/baseball controller and come up with a game that immerses you in a reality where you are playing  federer. 
Also games cost more than they should given the gameplay duration. Oculus VR is still a good gimmick and not a must buy

This was a gift for my teenage grandson he really loves it.  The unlimited platforms are incredible the quality graphics really make you feel like you are in the game.  The only thing that would make it better is a built battery pack, play time is limited and attaching an charging cable during game play does take away from the experience a bit.  A great accessory to add is the harder head gear versus head strap with the built in battery pack.  Great investment.

This is the cheapest fully realized VR experience. The trade-off is you HAVE to be in the Facebook ecosystem.

The controllers are really nice and the graphics are good and the convenience of no cords and truly plug-and-play having used some other VR things is amazing and just works.

That said, obviously, the value is in Facebook getting all your sweet sweet data and who knows whatever else secret data points.

It is a trade off and for me, worth it. 

YMMV.

Good product to escape our reality with and get submerged into a world of your choosing! For that it's 5 star material, However There is still a bit of room for improvement, nothing major just a better head strap is needed if you have a large head like I do. Also it's not 100% user friendly as my friend who wears glasses cant be fitted. And the need for a few more free games. Overall it's a really good VR headset that becomes 5 star once you link it to a pc.

The oculus quest 2 is a really good headset in my opinion. The fact we don't need trackers for controllers today is pretty amazing to me. I rated this 4 stars only because for some reason beyond me you have to have a facebook account which is kinda dumb. I eventually just logged into a friends facebook because I couldn't get it to work without it. Besides that though I love using it to play steam games and just watch netflix and crunchyroll with it as well.

By far my son's favorite gift this season. But I'm extremely bummed out that it is a Facebook exclusive item and apparently Facebook is so greedy that if you buy multiple headsets, you can not share your games that you have purchased. You have to purchase each game for every headset you own. 
So family members can't play games with each other unless they are willing to invest some serious cash on the games. But they can play online with any unknown stranger around the globe who happens to be online. 
Shame shame shame on Facebook yet again. So glad I've never used any of their services in the past, only created a "fake" account to be able to use this headset.
Focus on your ethics Facebook, tie your greedy little fists behind your back, and I will buy one of these for every member of my family. But until then, "No soup for you!"

Fantastic upgrade to the original Rift, with no more screen door effect, providing the best of both worlds (wireless and wired to play more power hungry games), and NO MORE SENSOR STANDS!  Extremely easy setup.   

Improvements:
Be prepared to spend extra for a more comfortable, weight distributed, head strap. It will definitely be a requirement for longer play.

FYI:  You must have a Facebook account. I’m not a fan, but locking down privacy settings helps.

I buy a lot of gadgets and tech toys. This is one of my favorite tech purchases of the year, for 2020 and 2021 so far. The VR headset works great. I ended up buying a different headstrap, but that was just personal preference. There are many games and applications available for this headset. I definitely recommend this! Being forced to have a Favebook acount to use this is not preferred by me, but I can ultimately live with that. This is a family favorite.

Bought this for our kids(ages 11 & 15). Certainly was the highlight of Christmas. 
Graphics are amazing and the reality of it is incredible. We opted for the larger memory(256g) just in case because it seems the games do vary in memory size. Look at the games to see which one would best for you. 
I know most people’s biggest complaint is that you need a Facebook book account, but it’s really not that big of an issue. It’s just to interact with the Oculus.

Lots of fun!! Really durable. It has an adjustable head strap and 3 different eye positions so anyone can use it. Any games you purchase for your oculus headset are only good on that device. For example, if you own two oculus headsets and you want to play a game together, you’ll have to purchased the game twice, one for each headset. It’s not a big deal though because you would have to do that with any other gaming console. My favorite game is Beat Saber.

This is an amazing headset!  I sprung for the 256 GB version and I'm very glad I did.  The sound is crisp, realistic and extremely immersive, The resolution is amazing with no "screen door" effect, and the tracking is really good.  This headset is extremely easy to set up and start playing very soon right out of the box.  The only 2 things I wish were better were the battery life and the strap gets pretty uncomfortable after about 30 minutes of play time.

This is my third vr  headset and they are really fun. The resolution is way better than the original quest. Very easy to use and has a lot of really cool games to play. The only reason I did 4 stars was because of the strap. It is difficult to adjust and not very comfortable for long periods. There are aftermarket straps out there, but for the price it could have come with a better one. I highly recommend for cool gaming and excellent source of exercise.

This is our second Oculus, we bought the Oculus 1 last year. There is a difference in weight on the Oculus Quest 2 headset compared to the Quest 1. The controllers are also designed differently. They feel lighter. 

We were able to transfer all of our purchases from the Quest 1 to the Quest 2 without any issues. There are also specific Oculus games that can only be played on the Quest 2. 

Our son is super happy and has been playing the Quest 2 non-stop!

Really impressed with the options and graphics on the Oculus quest 2. My only minor complaint would be the battery life. If you're not a big gamer, like me, a couple of hours of playtime is just fine. For my son, who spends more time on it, it could be better. I wish there were more demos to test out games but I do appreciate the option for refunds within 2 weeks of little play. I would recommend this for adults and older kids. My son is 10 and loves it.

This thing is for kids and adults.  I love the VR and being able to interact with people all over the world.  There are lots of apps.  I’ve gone to the club to dance and party, went to a Snoop Concert, doing yoga, it helps me to meditate, exercise, boxing with friends, watch movies on Netflix with family and friends sitting in a theater.   But my favorite app is Poker Stars.  I’ve met so many wonderful people and some coo coos too.  This VR is awesome!!

Little tricky for the first try with the buttons but has interesting, fun and imaginative and gasp--educational content to view. The only complaint I have is there is no parental setting option for the web browsers to block adult content. Facebook, who owns Oculus, has a no adult content policy on their platform and should extend the same to this product as this is an all ages device. If it's not fit for your kids to view, you shouldn't watching either.

I am not sure how I feel about this device yet and I am debating returning it. I would like to compare my device with another device to see if perhaps there is an issue with mine effecting the quality. Mine seems a bit glitchy. The hand controllers will not synch with my device occasionally, which is BEYOND frustrating. I would say TRY IT because so far the experience has been really good *when my left controller works which is about half of the time* .

It is so realistic -- I would highly recommend it.  You can swim with dolphins or sharks, play various games or try your hand a fishing for the big one!  I just wish that some of the games in the RIFT tab were available in the Quest tab too.  Some games are alittle pricey, especially when you just dropped a couple hundred on the unit itself.  So make sure you pre-read the description and make sure you are going to play and like the game you purchased.

Great to use but the game options needs to increase.
Then again, I dont think you want to bury you face into any VR headset for long periods of time.
Why the -1 star:
I hate creators that build something, such as this VR, knowing that the stock battery and strap are terrible and then make and additional strap harness and extended battery (much needed accessories) for a second costly investment...
It reminds me of the phrase  "EACH SOLD SEPERATELY" lol

Bought this for my kids for Xmas and they love it. It’s really cool, just a warning though that if you are sensitive to pressure on your head (like me) this will definitely give you a headache if you use it for more than 15 mins at a time. Unfortunately you can’t make the straps too loose or else the headset won’t stay in place.   FYI I says ages 13 and up but my 6 year old loves it. I would have preferred to buy the 64GB version but it was sold out.

We had the old phone driven version and this is so much better.  I would suggest a upgraded headband,  My wife and I share and I wish their we better multi player profile options.  We are not gamers but we really enjoy this unit.  The virtual barrier feature combined with many of the apps encourage movement which is great during the pandemic.  The strap, the tie to Facebook and the lack of multi profile options are the reasons it didn't get 5 stars.

I waited for a while to purchase a VR headset and this was what I was waiting for.  I love that it is self-contained.  No extra sensors or need for a desktop computer.  But I also like the ability to link it to a computer with the accessory cable if needed.  The 256GB was worth it.  I haven't downloaded a ton of content, but I am glad that I got the larger version so that I don't have to unload a bunch of stuff to get the current stuff that I want.

My family is really enjoying this system. I was worried that it would make me dizzy but I've only had problems with one game so far. It's a lot of fun, and it makes exercise fun. I'm a pretty sedentary person, and this system helps get me moving. I recommend it for people of all ages. There are options to sit in some games, so if standing for a long time is difficult, you can still enjoy the system. It's so much prettier than I thought it would be.

Absolutely the best non-tethered VR system on the market. Can also used tethered to gaming PC which makes it very flexible. Many new VR titles on the Oculus store, as more developers are making new games and apps. This is the future of gaming and Oculus is on the right track. The only complaint that I have is that you are required have a Facebook account. Also, I advise not to get the Elite Strap as it is easily broken and overpriced in my opinion.

This was a Christmas gift for my daughter. She loves it. Does not get dizzy and has a great time playing. The head strap that came with it is ok but was a little to big for her head. At the time the Oculus one was sold out so I got a 3rd party one that works great. I put it on with the regular head stap and I was fine with it but the upgrade is a upgrade. Games are priced pretty good and the time does fly by when playing. Very happy with this buy.

I’ve immersed myself in tech over the years and now VR is my newest obsession! So far, I’m loving it! This Oculus Quest 2 is amazing! I purchased one with the most memory space in case I want to bring it with me during long road trips. That way, I can pre-load content and won’t need WiFi to use it. I also love that I can either wear my glasses or have prescription lenses made which will fit right into the headset. 
Very happy with my purchase!!!

One month in and we’re noticing some drift on the controllers. We use ours about once a day with pretty average games (beatsaber, ping pong). Our original Oculus still works perfectly and it was a bummer to have some of the calibration issues so early with this one. I think we’ll reach out to support soon and see if there’s a fix or something, but so far, aside from the calibration/drift problem, it’s a good improvement from the first gen Go.

If you're wearing glasses and your glasses size is more than 142mm long, this headset is gonna give you a big headache. The facepad is quite narrow and that is the problem. If you try really hard, your glasses are gonna be constantly pushed into your nose bridge and eyes. Furthermore, it can cause scratches to both your glasses and the VR lens in the long run. It also doesn't have lens adjustment knobs like the Quest 1 and Gear VR (I used both). 
You can fix this issue by buying prescription lens but that will add more into your total costs. I tried to purchase one pair from WidmoVR and it almost costs me $145 with coupon code. 

Make sure you try putting the headset on before you purchase (if the store has a demo unit or borrow one from friend). 

On the other note, this headset is excellent.

Only recommend it if you're not wearing glasses.

Overall it’s a good product. Got the 256GB one but honestly feel like the 128 is enough unless you figure that you might download lots of games and/or movies. The controllers are comfortable, and the VR is not too heavy  but the head strap it comes with is not that comfortable. Will probably switch to another one from Oculus or from Amazon. Video quality is pretty good and you have fun with the games and many other things you can do with it.

Amazing VR experience. Not having to remain tethered to a high end PC is a godsend! Haven’t tried Oculus Link yet, but the portability and general performance is great. One thing to note: Don’t buy the 256gb model! (unless you don’t care about wasting a hundred bucks) I’m one of those people who likes to go for the higher storage option when it comes to tech so I went with the 256gbs but the top thirty to forty games combined couldn’t fill the 64gb model. I have like 15 of the best games at the moment and all together they consume less than 15gbs of storage! The Oculus library is not very large at the moment and based on my math, one couldn’t fill the 256gb model if they tried. I guess for future proofing it could be useful, but even then there’s only a couple of dozen games you’d even buy for this thing/worth buying. 64gb is more than enough!

Vary fun to play and easy-to-use. The controllers were surprisingly comfortable, I thought they would be weird to use but I like the fit and the buttons are nicely placed. The head set is a little heavy but not too bad. The games are super cool and fun to play for being surprisingly cheap. I do suggest getting the head gear with the extra battery, it makes it easier to take the oculus on and off and you get extra play time between charging.

I absolutely love it! I passed up a PS5 for this and have no regrets. The VR platform isn't for everyone, but the graphics are awesome. If you're prone to motion sickness, you may have issues with some games but repetitive playing helps diminish it. Many of the games are a physical workout, but you can play them sitting down ( then maybe just get a PS5 lol). Occasional bugs, but updates usually correct and customer service is very helpful.

Great graphics, fully immersed experience, ability to cast VR world onto TV, laptop, phone to watch player experience, great tutorials on each VR world, can play with friends meeting in VR world.  Original headset is comfortable, haven't needed to invest in additional comfort strap.  If multiple persons using same headset, may want to wear a sweat headband as to not get headset padding sweaty.  User can work up a sweat on some of the apps.

When the oculus works, it is a lot of fun! The kids love it! However, this is our second headset because it keeps dying. It never comes back despite following everything in the support section. Despite you tube advice and advice on google. Support is non existent. Emails do not get answered. My child is extremely upset! 
Two stars for the concept and when it works it is fun. Headset one worked for 10 min. Headset two worked for one month.

Most amazing system out right now. Games are actually exercise and console quality graphics and awesome games to choose from. One you try it you will definitely want to buy it and wont get bored of it because there is so much you can do with this besides play games and there always cxoming out with new games and apps. If you plug it int a VR ready gaming PC, it doubles as a Rift. This is actually 2 in one. You just need a long USB C cord.

Incredible price to performance. Long enough battery life to enjoy gaming while not being too restricted by charge (though if you plan on playing for over 2 hours, I would invest in a 10-16 ft usb-c charging cable). 72hz looks good enough, but the 90hz mode is going to look absolutely stunning. I also recommend getting virtual desktop and running your games off of that, especially if you plan to play anything without an oculus link cable.

Before this one, I had the First Oculus and loved the games but the graphics and the quality weren't all that great. So I got the 2nd Oculus Quest and I will say it is more better quality wise but the games really haven't changed much since the 1st Oculus and I'm not spending money on a VR with games that I've already played so they need to come out with new games.. Also don't like that you half to adjust the eye vision piece from inside.

Pretty good price for getting into VR. Very fun to play. You’ll get an even better experience if you hook it up to a VR ready pc (Windows is officially supported). You can play Steam VR games wirelessly or with a link cable. I’m very disappointed that they don’t provide linux drivers. You can find some open source software for linux that may or may not work, but I got a second ssd so I could dual boot into windows and avoid the problems.

I purchased this because I like the VR experience. I had one that my phone fit it but it was not comfortable and kept getting interrupted by text and calls. I wanted a stand alone that didn't limit me to being by my computer to play either. This is amazing. It has the games I like and I can play anywhere in the house. I got the 256 memory. I love it and you will to. I know being associated with Facebook i know the games will keep coming.

The headset starts getting uncomfortable after 30 mins of use but that’s ok because the battery doesn’t last very long maybe 2 hours before you have to charge it again. After using it for about 30 and i took it off and was on my phone and I felt like I was still in the game; it was an odd feeling, like my hands weren’t keeping up with my brain and I also started getting dizzy after a few uses. I did end up returning it so it’s all good.

Both of my children have one. The software inside is great. I chose the higher gig because the headset is a standalone. We also have the Xbox VR but the clarity in this is better. Downside is you have to have a Facebook account and the games can not be shared with another user. Waiting for them to offer Roblox without a computer connection. Still haven’t figured out how to do it with a computer but there are many YouTube videos to help.

Over all this headset is really fun but there could be more games for it and its a little heavy to wear. I've ordered the elite head strap to try to mitigate the weight of this headset. You can connect it to your PC to play even more games but your PC needs to meet the specs required by Oculus in order for it to work. So far I've been playing zombie shooter games and that has been pretty fun. I do wish there were more racing games too.

I have never been a video game person of any sorts. A friend of mine mentioned that she tried this and all the things that could be done, I was so intrigued. She was correct. I’m being tricked into “working out” because of the body movement. There are so many Apps to choose from to suit all interests. Headset setup was okay. I did use YouTube when I didn’t understand something. But, this reflects more on my inexperience in my opinion.

Yo…is this mic on? HELLO…HELLO…sorry lemme turn this down. 

Okay, Oculus fans and fans of VR: behold the future of gaming. Portable, reliable, versatile and endlessly fun. If you were a child of the ‘80’s waiting around for flying cars, teleportation, and virtual reality…one outta three ain’t too bad. It here. You can step into an environment apart from your own and experience tactile interaction in innovative and mind blowing ways.

This is a great VR headset. My kids love it and play it quite often.

PROS:
* stand-alone headset, which means it doesn’t require a high-end gaming PC or laptop to use
* wireless so you can take it on road trips or to another room with ease
* headset has a built-in headphone jack, allows the user to plug in a different headphone if they don’t want to use the built-in speakers
* headset is pretty lightweight
* can play Steam games by purchasing the extended USB-C cable (sold separately) and hooking it up to your PC or purchase the virtual desktop app through the Oculus store

CONS:
* battery life is about 2.5hrs on a full charge (this can be extended to another 2.5hrs, total of 5hrs, if you purchase the Elite Head Strap with Battery)
* the head strap that comes with the headset is okay, but the Elite Head Strap makes a huge difference and almost a must

I thought this would be more of a fun thing to do once and awhile since I have about 5k in a gaming PC... now I play this thing every day and I'm burning more calories from it. Sure I'm sore a lot from being out of shape, but give me a year and I think I found a way to get more active having fun. You kind of just lose track of yourself in it though, so great for fitness, but not so great if you forget to drink water or look at time.

I love this thing the extra storage space is awesome for having lots of games the controllers are cool and very easy to use and play with. I think my only complaint would be about the head strap I would like it to longer on the top it just feels weird but that's just me being spoiled. The battery life is long about 5 hours I think and unless I want to do a long session I don't have to charge it at all during the day so it's perfect.

Best virtual reality gaming out there. Originally my son wanted the Oculus Rift, which is great too. However, make sure you have a computer with the correct specs in order to be able to use it. Since he did not have a computer with the correct specs, we exchanged it for the Oculus Quest. For the Oculus Quest you don’t need your computer in order to use it, other than to set it up. He could not be happier with it. Highly recommended.

I owned the original Oculus Quest and loved it a lot.  I got this for my birthday and I am happy with this product. 

It is a bit heavier because I have 256GB model and my old one was 64.  I did not care about the head strap. I liked the old model better.  I got the elite strap and this is much better than the soft one.

I gave my old one to my son, so we will meet up in the virtual world when he create his account.  It will be fun.

Very fun product. Take it easy at first because you will get motion sick. If you don’t have it sitting just right on your face it’s blurry and you can’t have it too tight around your face or you will get a headache or a face imprint. The included face guard and head strip could be better. Because the unit itself it quit heavy. You have to adjust it just right. But the speakers on this thing is amazing! Very loud! Great fun to have!

I think its a wonderful product, I had the grate luck of getting this for my birthday & so far I haven't had a problem. Its a grate way to get into vr, but if I'm being honest, please do your research as this may not be the type of headset you are looking for. Not only that but I haven't had a problem because I was prepared, you should do a lot more research than you may think you have to but it'll be worth it in the end trust me.

First time purchase of a vr device and let me tell you one thing STAR TREK holo deck baby coming to life right before my eyes minus the actual touch and smell of course but still way over what I have ever experienced before. I would love to see some kind of deal with Nintendo that would be amazing playing Zelda in vr, they do however offer a decent amount of stuff to play plus there is a lot of free 3rd party stuff on the internet that’s very interesting. 
Must purchase the rigid headset and either the adjustable inserts for glasses wearers or buying corrected lenses for the oculus ... The strap it comes with offers no support so it still hangs on my......My glasses hurt no matter what I tried so I am waiting for the corrected lenses for it that cost $80 3rd party Oculus didn’t offer. I just hope Facebook survives this latest lawsuit from the government.

Why cant I give this a 10 ?

Despite being a longtime tech industry engineer, I had many doubts about VR because the technology was in it's infancy. Well, that was yesterday.... The experience of just powering-on the Quest 2 is overwhelming. The word 'immersive' doesn't even come close to what you will experience.

Most of the gaming content I've seen so far is obviously imaginary, but that doesn't detract from the overall effect.

Quic kand easy setup, i replaced my Oculus CV1 system and losing the wires feels great. You can buy the virtual desktop app from the quest store and use it to stream Rift games to your Quest headset too.

Full Rift and quest games....no wires!!! IF you are going to invest in this i would aslo recommend the p[ro strap with built in battery, that will double your wireless play time. I will be oring mine when they come back in stock.

The Oculus is easily the best console release this year. PS5 and Xbox series X have basically been streaming boxes for me as I have used this headset nightly. Tracking is fantastic except in wide sweeping motions if you put your hand to your side and looking the opposite direction. Beat saber has helped me lose 30 lbs. Super hot is great. The Star Wars games are worth the headset alone just to swing a lightsaber around.

Why it's 4 and not 5. Price. They trick you in thinking that the Quest 2 is a greater value compared to Quest 1. The $100 is eaten up quickly by buying the pro strap (if you play VR a lot, the fabric basic standard strap sucks). And the charging cable (which was missing with mine, but they replaced it) is super short, the Quest 1 charging cable was like 8 feet. So you could charge and play OR use it as the Link once the updates occurred.

Quest 2 is one of the best and affordable headsets money can buy.  The ease of setup is a BIG plus.  The fit is decent but not great, but adding the elite strap helps with comfort.  Visual quality is excellent, but will not match the higher end headsets (i.e. Valve Index, Reverb G2, HTC Vive Pro 2 etc.).  But those sets are 3-4 times the cost of the Q2.

Overall, if interested getting into VR, this is hands down worth every penny.

I am blown away by the quality of the Oculus Quest 2. My previous VR headset is 2 years old and it is evident that there have been massive leaps in VR tech in that time. 
The field of view is incredible and the clarity exceeds my expectations for a self contained device. 
The added capability of streaming content from a PC over wireless or Oculus Link makes it easy for me to recommend this device to anyone who's interested in VR.

The Oculus Quest 2 is an excellent tool to improve movement and flexibility.  You twist and duck using your whole body. The more rigorous applications give you the cardio stimulus and leave you breathing heavily.  The views are excellent, though lacking in some detail because the wireless cannot download as rapidly as a wired system.
You can take it with you and the system remembers the WiFi connections at your previous locations

After playing my dad's Quest 1 I was hooked. Looked into it just to find out that the Quest 2 was about to come out. Preordered it immediately and have been enjoying it ever since. I really enjoy playing the many assortment of games and watching other 3D documentaries. My kids love that you can look around while watching animals move about. I also get to play multiplayer games with my dad's Quest 1. Very happy with this purchase.

This oculus is my first time experiencing VR (256g) not gonna lie I got a little dizzy at first but once my brain started to function and got used to what I was seeing and adjusted the sight within I can't put it down I play it until the batteries die! Already have spent $150 on games alone bought aftermarket headset which I highly recommend because the one that comes with it is not the best. And a nice hard shell carrying case.

Pros: Has standalone VR, meaning you only need the headset, controllers and a facebook account to play VR games. 

Can buy a "link cable" to connect to a gaming PC, so you can play SteamVR games, which usually have better graphics than the standalone oculus store games.

Feels like you're at a imax movie theater with it on. Would be bery good for watching movies and tv shows.

FPS games have free range of movements (can hold a gun, throw a grenade however you want)


Cons: Original headset battery life lasts 2 - 3 hours. (Buying a Elite battery strap will fix this or a long usb-c charging cord)

Facebook account required. Personally don't like this company. Forced us to make an account to use this headset also. And of course they're gathering your data while you play games. The oculus store probably has less games than steamVR because of a Facebook monopoly.

Very good graphics and fun game play. Got it for our son and he has played it non stop. My brother tried it out and mentioned he was going to get one as well. A good alternative from the normal game play such as Xbox and PlayStation. Only negative thing to mention is the battery charge life is very poor and must be recharged several times if you are playing it a lot through the day.  Beware if you are prone to motion sickness.

Was impressed with friends experience. Got lucky and found one. Very impressed with the visuals. Like the ability to set your “boundaries “ while using to keep from hitting furniture. Definitely recommend a good size space to use. Tutorials are easy. Plenty of free content to keep entertained. Headrest is somewhat uncomfortable to me. No biggie just feels awkward.  May have to invest in the additional head gear to improve fit.

All I have to say is amazing. Excellent graphics and gameplay. I only have two things that annoy me. First is the size of their wing aperature. Why is the opening so small, I mean it almost feels like it will bend my glasses. Very unaccomodating for people with glasses. Second is the audio is meh.  Even at the highest setting it would barely qualify as loud. Plus the acoustic quality is barely above a cheap set of headphones.

Very, very easy to set up and use but you MUST have a FaceBook account to get it up and running; the VR experience with this headset is amazing, you’ll suspend your disbelief and find yourself immersed in the experience and then want friends and family to try it as well….if you get someone to try that has never experienced VR then they’ll be blown away; it does take a couple of hours to fully charge so plan ahead accordingly
This thing requires a Facebook account to even turn it on.  If Facebook decides for any reason your $500 unit becomes a brick.

I am new to VR but seems like a good system.  The ability to use with a pc or by itself is good.  The clarity is nice too.  I wish the battery life was longer.  Also, having to tie it to your Facebook account to use it is a bummer.  FB is in too much as it is. $400 to have your information sold to the highest bidder is a bit much of an ask.  All in all, I would have given it 5 stars were it not for the Facebook requirement.

Improved graphics and loading time over the Quest 1, which was pretty great if you are ok with “ok” computing power but exceptional wireless gameplay. 

Note: Facebook forces you to be a Facebook member to use this device. If you make a fake account they will lock your system. There are rational theories that this device is used to spy on users and collect robust data about their homes. This is a theory but worth pondering.

Now that the Oculus Quest 2 is available, it is now clear that the virtual reality market and Facebook have produced a virtual reality headset that clearly demonstrate that this product appropriately fits it’s cost. The Oculus Quest 2 @ $299.99 with 64 gb is an excellent beginner’s VR set. The Quest 2 @ $399.99 with 256 gb is fantastic for those who are accustomed towards virtual reality and are ready for future adventures.

Super cool graphics while in stand alone mode. I looked goofy playing it the fist time, do doubt! Got the 256 GB and haven’t ran out of space so s fee at. Very impressed with the virtual reality experience vs a traditional console ( like a PS4). Less to deal with, more fun to be had. Great for teens as well.

 If you have a gaming rig, wire it to your computer for a fully immersive experience on a virtual IMAX sized screen.

Everything I expected and so much more.  Got tired of wire entanglement with current (PSVR)... that and the SDE.  I dumped the PS4 pro and PSVR because Sony is dragging their feet on a new VR headset and I ain’t getting any younger!  The Oculus is amazingly easy to use, the clarity is jaw dropping and coupled with a decent laptop the VR content on Steam is incredible!  I now stream content wirelessly to my headset...Hooray!

If you asked me a year ago, I was one of those people who pretty much ignored the VR space, and though of it as a fad just like there was with 3D TV's about a decade ago. After watching a few YouTube videos, I decided to buy the Oculus Quest 2, but I was still fairly skeptical. After trying it out for a few hours on the first night I owned it, I was already very impressed with it, and did not regret my purchase. There are options to allow you to play Steam VR games, but the Oculus store itself has quite a good variety. I am also finding myself using the virtual chat features of this VR headset. I really like the Horizon's venues. I am not a facebook user, so I just created a blank facebook account (that I don't plan on using), because it is mandatory to have a facebook account for this VR headset. That is really the only slightly annoying part of the experience.

Oculus 2 is a fun and exciting! Had a little bit of difficulty with the controllers getting stuck in one place but found that to be the Christmas lights interfering with the headset. The games are ~$10-35 each - downloaded from WiFi. Able to connect to a TV through screen sharing so people watching you move around aimlessly could see what you are seeing. TV needs to be compatible to do this though. I would recommend this!

Excellent product I would recommend to everyone and is very fun. My friend can't wait for the oculas 3 to come out which hopes will fix something called the screen door effect that is supposed to make it better to a great product as is. Could use a longer batter life and better default strap as to make more comfortable most people I have read buy customized straps and backup batteries if the use for long periods at a time

I originally bought his as a Christmas gift for the family but, my son is having so much fun playing and exercising with it that I have only been able to use a few times. We all love it. I am glad I chose to get the the 264 GB so that we have  more storage for the games. You can really break out a sweat working out. I found silicon face covers that you can remove to wash after using. This is definitely a great investment.

Love my quest 2 and it is worth upgrading. 

BUT I do wish the lens were still adjustable with the slider, really don't care for only having 3 positions to choose from. And keep having intermittent issues with turning quest on and wifi being disconnected and the only way to reconnect it is to reboot quest (it is 100% NOT an issue with my wifi as I NEVER had this issue with original quest or any other device in my house).

So glad I got this! This VR system is really fun to use, and it looks AMAZING once you put it on! If you've never used a VR system before, trust me it will blow you away. It takes a little while to get used to and to get adjusted to it, but its all worth the practice.
I would suggest getting the improved head strap and the carrying case, as it's kind of heavy when it sits over your eyes, and it's quite awkward to store.

Very easy to set up and use. Must be a Facebook customer though. Multiple games to download and fairly easy to navigate. The big benefit is that you don’t have to connect it to a PC although you have that option. I found that hooking it up to a PC has a little bit better graphics and clarity but not by much. The battery life seems okay but not if you play more than 2 hours straight. Great gift and I highly recommend it.

The whole family loves this!!! In case anyone doesn’t already know you need a Facebook account to set this up, and you purchase games through the oculus app. The games range from free to 30 dollars. This is easily adjustable  so you can quickly change from a child playing to an adult. It has been dropped already a few times and has held up well against my 3 sons! If you’re on the fence about this don’t be it’s worth it!

First time VR set and I couldn’t ask for more. It’s like being someone else somewhere else. Over all good quality. Some bash it because you have to be signed in under your Facebook account. Who cares, get over it. People these days I swear nothing better to do than complain about every little thing. Most of the time just jumping on the bandwagon thinking it’s cool. Great head set Oculus. Bought 2 more for my daughters.

Cons- No full bundle with backup battery headset, long power cord,etc. Separately it is very expensive, which is what it cost me. Very few free games, Store is not very user friendly, very hard to find things and when you do and go back the screen cycles all the way to the beginning. Very short battery life. Need sports games- MLB, NFL, Nascar, college sports, NBA, Billiards, and more. 

pros- Love the experience in VR

Using the oculus by itself: awesome and really great VR experience. Great selection of games including beat saber.
Using oculus with computer: takes forever to get properly installed cause of errors with the startup but looking forward to finally playing games off of steam
Conclusion: if you know what your doing with the laptop, it’s definitely worth it. If you can’t figure out the laptop, still respectable without it

Great headset! I can use it as a stand-alone unit and the visuals are great, or I can hook it up to my computer and really have some fun. The guardian system works wonderfully and the hand tracking is spot on. The battery level in the controllers has barely budged, even though I've been using it a lot. If you're looking to get into vr at an affordable price and don't want to be tied down by cords, this is hard to beat

very cool device and for the money its an amazing jump to new technology.  I am typically not a gamer but with the VR interface games are much more realistic.  I also like using the device for watching movies which gives you an IMAX type view of movies being released and events.  My next project is to join a live sports event like and NBA game where they stream from a court side seat.   How cool is that.  Fun stuff!!

I purchased this for my eight year old grandson. He and dad have had a ball. Grandson is getting a good workout in these times where going out to play is difficult. Dad said the games are a lot of fun and is looking forward to getting more. The only drawback that I can think of is that there is no 'Oculus gift card'. I would like to see this system figure out a way to be able to gift games to the owner of the system.

After playing with my brother's Rift VRH, my husband and I immediately started researching VR headsets. Considering we don't currently have a gaming PC, this was the best option out there for us, and it allows us to play with/against my brother and his family on various games. We've been enjoying it so much, I'm considering getting my own. The only downside right now is that not all of the apps are currently App-Sharing, so with games like Beat Saber, I'm going to have to purchase my own copy of the game plus all the add-on songs we already bought under my husband's account, so I can have my own scores. It does have a short battery life (about 2 hours) but we attached a mobile power bank to the oculus and stuck it in a back pocket for extra play time, and that worked. I also recommend the lightweight Quest 2 carrying case for basic storage/protection when not using it.

Awesome experience some point scary and fun at same time if you follow safety guidelines of reading system has lot of tools how to use etc but could can built not user friendly I feel lot of thing missing to show step by step direction also help manu and voice command not helping find right game when search options enter Happy with bestbuy as suppliers easy checkout process and protection and other options are cool.

You must open your life up to this thing. Have to connect to your fb account and allow it access, must Bluetooth your phone to it and allow, it accesses/monitors home network activities. 

I REPEAT, NO ACCESS; NO USAGE!!

If you rather not allow full access to your life; then you have to spend an extra 500 bux and subject yourself to an additional $180/yr access fee

Find another alternative to scratch you vr itch.

I just recently upgraded from the original Quest to this one and it is a lot better than I expected! Both weight and comfort were improved so much that I am able to get along just fine with the provided strap. Still not as comfortable as the halo design, but way better than my original with the Vive deluxe audio strap. Another thing that was surprising was the stock audio is also much improved over the original, so much that I don’t even feel the need to use headphones. For anyone buying this Ana are new to VR, I highly recommend app lab, it’s the only way to get Windlands on the headset, and it’s one of the best VR experiences ever. Also you need to try, “Tea For God”. It’s free although you need a fairly sized area for the best experience, it’s so worth it if you can find space enough for it! This is a great entrance to VR, the best price and quality for first time VR.

This is a great device for really enjoying and getting a high quality wireless VR experience. There are plenty of games and a whole lot of videos and other experiences to have. This would be akin to getting a Nintendo Switch. The graphics are good, but there are better more powerful VR setups out there (involving external computers), but like the switch, the beauty of the Quest 2 is that it is all self contained.

I bought it for my son for Christmas and I swear he tries not to put it down lol. I have to literally set time limits with him or he’ll play it until it’s dead and then play it again as soon as it’s charged up. He definitely gets a work out from it which I love because it’s keeping him somewhat active. Just be careful with them being around others because he’s accidentally hit us all a few times from playing lol.

Went to the store today to purchase the hardware and charging dock. After setting up and understanding how to use the vr set the screen froze. I figured it needed to charge so, after a hour the hardware didn’t charge nor did the controllers. Unplugged and plugged back in and only on controller charged after another hour pass. I haven’t been able to use it and plan on returning it back to the store for a new one.

Cheap price, a real bang for your buck, decent battery life, easy to use. It's not 5 stars because one of the lenses got scratched from the headband touching it (not actually noticable when using the headset) and one of the arms seems to have already come loose in my first couple weeks, still completely usable though. Only people I would not recommend this to are people who don't trust Meta/Facebook (obviously).

Great headset, comfortable headbands, its pretty much the same as my original Quest except thumb control pad is bigger- the 50%pixels are not distinguished by our family. (We have a quest 1 & two quest 2 here)  For the small slightly advanced features, it doesnt warrant an upgrade if you have the original, however if youre looking for a great VR experience- Quest 2 at about $100 less than Quest 1 is a great buy.

I got the Quest 2 in March and it worked well, but even after maintaining it and handling it with care it began having issues with it's guardian detection. It starts up without a guardian and aftee i turn it back on in settings and set up my playspace it shuts the guardian down and crashes whatever game I play. It's made cheaply and didn't even last three months with good care. I wouldn't recommend this product.

Amazing gaming system so much to do and its a whole new world controls are great definitely recommend upgradung the head strap and getting the rubber gripa for the controllers and hand straps it gets pretty intense sometimes... take care of the whole thing but be extra careful with the controllers the inside may get loose causing it to shut off midgame other than that amazing product will buy again when in stock

The system is amazing and the games are great.  The issue is the hardware.  The right controller right perfectly for the first month but now it loses tracking constantly.  We have tried all the fixed recommended by oculus but they don't help.  Send a ticket to oculus via the headset but zero response yet.  They are a lot of others with the same issue.  research right controller tracking issue before purchasing.

This is hands down the best VR headset you can get right now! The ability to play wherever you are without the need for a PC is amazing. If you do have a GOOD PC you can play even more games and enjoy and the benefits of VR this was a hard one for me to pick up as it does cost a lot but after using it i can say it is 100% worth the money. I would only go with the 256GB model as the space can fill up kinda fast.

Solid entry level headset.  The wireless capability is great for the price.  The battery doesn't last all that long but is acceptable.  The option for glasses is perfect.  Only complaint is its ability to play steam games is more of a process than it needs to be.  The required cable to play from pc should be included.  Overall definitely recommend for entry level or if you don't plan on getting to much into vr.

I've been really enjoying using this vr headset for gaming, watching movies, and workouts.  It's very immersive and you use your whole body to interact with the environment instead of just moving your fingers.   I like the safety feature where it allows you set boundary (virtual wall) so that it can track your position and warn you when you cross that boundary line.  I don't exercise much but this vr has been making me want to work out.  There are a few features that I didn't really like about this vr.  First, the head strap isn't really comfortable.  Second, spongy face cover didn't really work out for me well especially when I sweat.  Third, if you wear eye glasses it might not fit you well.  But, there are accessories that you can purchase to resolve all these issues.  Of course, you need to spend more money...  Overall, I'm very very glad that I decided to purchase this.

Fun and much more manageable than the previous generations. Playing games on it is fun and even funnier watching the player doing goofy movements. Its a simple setup, no excessive wires or huge battery packs and can be used with Steam so thats a plus. The only downside is the option for expandable memory and there should be an option for that or a way to offload data or games to a storage device for rotating.
