AirLink was released right after I purchased this headset, so instead of being a "+1" to my Vive, it's pretty much turned into my go-to headset. With the right combination of software this can run anything from the Steam store, Oculus, side loaded content, you name it.

It's pretty much THE best value in VR right now. If you want to dip your toes, consider the Quest 2, in whatever the storage size you prefer

It’s shy one star for the very fact that you are trapped with three different eye settings. The original Quest made adjustment easier and more precise. Other than that one mistake I’d say the Quest 2 is far superior to the original in every way. The image is a higher definition and there is way less screen door effect. Hand gestures are clunky but I’m a fan of the controllers more. Now...bring on the games!

I have to say I am impressed on the technology from past experiences. Visited a friend who had a pair of these and once I put them on I was hooked. Awesome game options and a good fit. You will get about 2 hrs ish of play time and trust me that’s enough before you need a break. I recommend getting the adjustable head ban. Money well spent! My only complaint is you must sign it up with your Facebook account.

This thing is awesome! I do wish you didn’t need a Facebook account to set it up and also wish you could have more than one administrator. Maybe you can but I haven’t been able to figure that out. I like that it has installed apps like YouTube VR for watching VR videos.  I wish the games were cheaper.  Be ready to spend extra money on accessories and games with this device. Overall, happy with the purchase.

Beyond impressed with this headset. The graphics are lacking compared to the pc headsets, but throw in that you don't even need a pc to use this and that makes up for it right there. Speaking of pc, plugging in a link cable will really boost the value of the quest 2. Don't have a computer with the muscle to power vr, this is your best bet. Finally get a computer that can, makes a good pc vr system as well!

The Oculus Quest 2 is definitely worth the price.  We have the 256GB because we have a family of 4 using it.  It's so well done that it's easy to "get lost" in the game you're playing and feel like it's real.  There are a significant amount of games available for all ages and lots of learning as well.  

The only Con I could come up with is that it does run out of battery and you have to put it away for a while.  

I believe it also needs to be tied to a Facebook account to purchase games.  The charges come through as Facebook charges.  So if you're against Facebook, this might not be the VR for you.  Other than that...it is great.  Even works with Youtube and Netflix!  It's also a great workout when you use games like Beat Saber.

One very good Pro is that you build a virtual wall and floor so it will alert you with gridlines as you play so you don't fall or trip over anything.

This thing is amazing! It’s still new tech, but feels like the first time I used an iPhone. It’s a new crazy awesome platform.  Can’t wait to see where this goes.  Definitely the best VR experience I’ve had.  Comparable to theVoid VR that I did at the Venetian in Vegas but no backpack to lug around. Son uses it for baseball training. You can swing against guys throwing over ninety. It’s a brave new world.

bought these to use with Microsoft Flight Sim 2020 and all I can say is they're ABSOLUTELY OUTSTANDING!!!
Great for VR, my kids love them.  I bought to fly flight sim and pre-fly into areas and airports prior to making the actual flights in my 172.  It's the only way to do Flight Sim 2020.  Absolutely amazing.  I'm also using a Geforce RTX 3080 graphics card with cinema setings in Flight sim.  Phonemonal!

VR has come a long way, and this headset got me back in to it. I love the lack of wires and that it's a fully functional headset without needing anything extra (but, importantly, has the ability to connect to a PC as well when desired). 

I don't think the 256GB is necessary, and I've still not filled up half of it, but it's nice to have the extra space if you've got the extra $100 in your pocket to burn.

THIS IS THE BEST ALL-IN-ONE VIRTUAL REALITY HEADSET EVER! I bought this for my son at Christmas, and let me tell you, I had no idea this device would cause such a ruckus in my home! Everybody wanted one including me! I could not believe it. It's fun, it's wild, it's entertaining, and most of all it's so real. Okay, so, I tried Richie's Plank --- man, never again. I'm a grown man 47 years old and when I tell you I screamed like a 5-year-old little girl at a horror show, believe me. No lie. It was so fun. Shhhh, best of all, when my son goes to "night-night" I sneak and get it and watch NATGEO and play space games. Just the other day, I downloaded "Angry Birds." It's more addicting than on the phone. If there's any doubt in your mind, hear me when I say, this is the best device ever. I'm here today buying another one because everybody wants one. Get it today, you'll thank me later.

Its visual clarity is top notch accept for what seems like glare from the oculus lcd to the oculus lense. And while its a little more comfortable than the quest 1 its still not comfortable. Spending another $50 on the alternate headband helps a lot.
But the real deal breaker is that it absolutely requires a Facebook account and there is no way around it. Its going back mainly because of that requirement.

I love the oculus quest 2. I’m 52 and have never been a gamer, but had strokes 4 years ago and heart issues which led to a heart transplant almost 3 years ago. Looking for something to do that I can sit down to do. This is so fun, I play puzzle games like the room. It gets me thinking which is great.  I highly recommend this for anyone including us older people that have to sit while playing. 
Bob Percy

This thing is garbage. Got it for my son for Xmas played it about 30 min and then it became Insanely glitchy and defective, half the games won’t even work just says that the “stoped working”  it also shuts off randomly without warning. Just everything goes black and then the system shuts off and then it won’t turn back on. Absolutely returning this first chance I get. What a waste and pain in the butt

Best VR headset out there. Super immersive experience with top of the line video and sound quality. I went from the oculus go to the quest 2 and the difference in features and quality are unbelievable. My xbox series x has collected quite a bit of dust ever since purchasing this! It's worth getting the higher memory storage in my opinion too, since Oculus is constantly releasing new apps and features.

Quit working before I ever even got to use it!  After I bought the Oculus, I tried it out and then put it up to decide what games I wanted to purchase.  It ended up being 2 months before I ever got a chance to get back to it.  Well guess what?  Now it doesn't work and it's too late to take it back!  I had it put up in a safe place.  Nothing happened to it.  It's just a piece of crap!  That's my luck.

I’m not thrilled with this purchase for two reasons:
1. Facebook strong arming consumers to use a Facebook account at a time when people want to disconnect from social media is disappointing. 

2. The image quality has been very poor for me even  with my glasses on. I have followed every recommendations I could find. I will play with it some more since most reviewers are happy with the image quality.

Quality is good.  Give it 4 stars.
But you HAVE to sign in via a FaceBook account and if you do anything FB doesn't like, they can turn your $400 purchase into a very expensive paper weight.
Because of that, I downgraded it to 3 stars and stopped buying anymore VR games through the Oculus store.
Now looking at non-oculus games through steam to circumvent losing all my games if FB gets annoyed at me.

In stock, works as intended...  It's a start, but if the VR gaming hits you like it did me, then your 1st purchase may lead you to many others, like a VR gaming computer, VR accessories, VR case, VR gaming apps, and a Facebook account..  Plus pass the headset gets old after some time and you may find VR gaming apps don't offer PTH, so another headset fills the gap...  Is it worth it?  It was to me..

The product itself is very good but… it’s Facebook and Facebook mentality.

Careful if you download an apps… you can uninstall the apps but you can’t get rid of the tile, you can only use a filter to not see it.  Results, very clustered pages with apps tiles you don’t even use…

Problem known and denied to correct since 2019… That’s the facebook part of Oculus!

Other than that!  Very cool product!

Fantastic VR  for the price, it is the best when you have the elite headband with battery getting like 5 and a half hours of use. Facebook is trying to create a VR community not mine your data. There are no ads or other nonsense. The picture quality is very good and having fun with Star Wars Squadrons in VR. If you always wanted a VR system but could not afford it this is the system to get into VR.

I have a PSVR which I really enjoy. After trying the Oculus, I haven’t gone back. There is freedom to this system as you can take it anywhere you wish. The video and game options are excellent. The one major plus is the work out you get from certain games. The downside is the battery life but there are battery options out there available. All in all, excellent, excellent device. Highly recommended.

Really like the VR and we hook it up to the steam VR and play those games. However every time I play I tend to get a headache so you may want to look into a counterweight. And also I kept having problems with seeing clearly don't forget that you can move the lenses there's three different settings just move them side to side and they click. Not as easy to use as I like but me and whole family love.

Such a fun experience. I knew going in that it wasn't something the family would play all the time. It's easier to just grab a controller and play nintendo or Xbox but when we play with it we have so much fun.  We have fun watching each other play with it. I worked an extra job to purchase it.  It may be pricy for the amount it is used but in the pandemic it was like a little vacation substitute.

I had heard that the VR experience from the Oculus Quest 2 was good, but I was really impressed by it when I actually used it.  The immersion in experiences like Star Wars: Vader Immortal was impressive.  The feel of actually slicing cubes and avoiding obstacles in Beat Saber was great.  The headset was comfortable, even when wearing it for an hour.  The hand units were comfortable and intuitive.

Amazing experience!  VT has come a long way over the last couple decades.  The Oculus Quest 2 is one of the best experiences I have had.  It is expensive up front, but its worth it.  The immersion is truly unreal at times.  You'll forget you're playing a game or in another world.  I do wish some of the games were cheaper, since they are quite short usually, but overall they are priced accurately.

Absolutely amazing! It has a great variety in games, experiences, and other features for anyone to enjoy. My family, originally skeptic of the VR experience, quickly grew to enjoy using the Oculus. It also has several accessories that can be bought to better your already good features. I also like that it's not incredibly expensive, even the games are only like $5-40. Definitely a great purchase!

I bought this the release day and it still works great. Make sure you slowly get used to it and don't try to push through motion sickness. There are not to many games for it being completely wireless however more games will come out as technology advances. It is a great product without buying a PC and having wires going to a VR headset. If you have a PC you can fortunately use the Quest 2 on it!

Well this is a Christmas gift for our son.  But my wife has played the Creed game on it.  She said that was the best virtual reality game she has ever played.  We had the Samsung Vr and she said that’s trash compared to this device.  I guess I will find out on Christmas.  If you can get the larger gig one it was recommended to get that.  It was made aware to me that the game use a lot of memory.

The VR experience is a vast step forward for gaming.  But what is also great is the ability to use it to visit far off places in a virtual, 360 degree view.  My only issue is the battery life is only about 2.5 hours.  It also did not work when I took it to someone else's house, although it was connected to their wifi.  

Overall,  it is a true advancement in technology, and it is fun, no doubt.

My family enjoy it. It could be tiring playing very active games. We did not need any of the extra cords or anything they sale separately for this. It only come with free demos mostly, I just assume the games were free. There is a lot of games you have to pay for. You may get motion sickness on some games. I'm still not sure how to hook up the Xbox to it, to play some of those games virtually.

I wanted to get the Oculus-Quest 2 for video that would blow me away and that it does...incredibly well!
If you want to literally feel like your flying through the air, looking down off a cliff, floating in space and looking out at all of those beautiful stars then this is the device for you.  It's easy to use and set up is a breeze.  I would recommend this device for anyone from young to old.

We love the Oculus Quest, it was great for getting a workout during the winter.  It is so immersive, it made some friends nauseous.  I enjoyed the fact that you can cast what the person playing is seeing onto the television so that be more than one person interacting at the same time.

If you are going to share among different people, I suggest getting a headset cover, because it gets sweaty!

My advice: if you’re buying for kids, just make sure you have them research the system, and get them to list some games that they’ve either got to try or watched properly what the gameplay is like. If they can name enough games and explain the gameplay - get it. It’s worth the extra if you or your kids frequently play multiple games, and it’s worth it to get the oculus quest opposed to other options because it’s wire free. VR is truly getting sufficiently advanced to justify spending a little more to get the most uninhibited experience. Like I said though, make sure if it’s for kids they really understand the gameplay of the games they’re excited for, reminds me a bit of NES or SNES days - the fun artwork and hype around a game might not be what you’re expecting. Worth it if you know what you’re getting and enjoy that, just make sure your kid understands they aren’t yet entering the Oasis. :)

The Quest 2 is fun and has potential but the store interface does not help you identify games you may be interested in.  Other gaming platforms manage this much better.  For example, I am still looking for a way to watch NBA games court-side.  I am assuming that it is not available but cannot be sure.  

The unit is comfortable and battery life is good and I think it will get better with age.

The visual and audio simulation is astonishing.  I have seen what spacecraft saw during its journey through space.  Firefox vr browser is great. Much more than games. Movies, educational apps and some adult apps. 
Only negative is the very short battery charge and it's inability to designate right or left handed in some apps. Facebook account required. Recommend purchasing thr usb cable (10')

I've never owned a VR headset and i had no idea it would be this much fun. Not only fun for me but my kids, wife, mom, inlaws, everyone is having a blast with it. I intended to give less stars because of the Facebook login requirement but its just to much fun. The normal games are a blast as well as the educational and my wife and I had a great time with an escape room game. Highly recommend.

It’s really fun for the family but it doesn’t come with many games. You have to purchase more games to have fun. I wish it came with more games loaded on it for free for the amount I paid for the Quest 2. For the games that it comes with for free they are really cool! I do like to roller coaster rides but wish those games you would ride faster on the roller coasters. The kids really like it!

Prior to purchasing the Oculus Quest 2, I had only experienced VR a couple times and they were both PC sets. I am definitely impressed with the capabilities of the quest 2, However I’m very disappointed for the price that it costs they skimp out on the comfortability and adjustment aspects. Obviously they did it in order to make money on the Oculus accessories line but it’s still upsetting.

The virtual world comes alive and you are immersed in this VR unit.
It’s like you are really there!! There are games, exercises and relaxation app’s that are all so awesome. If you play the table tennis, be sure you don’t lean on the table or set your controllers on it, cause it’s not really there even though it seems as though it is and you and/or your controllers  end up on the floor. Lol

Quest 2 is what the VR needed since the beginning..
Stand alone headset: perfect size and good balance on the head especially with the deluxe head-strap. 
Enhanced graphics, Great CPU.. etc.
Computer based VR through wireless (WIFI 6, 5GHz highly recommended)
or connected PC VR with USB 3 link.
Controllers are almost the best.
The price is awesome.
Only one curse .. FaceBook account needed

The Oculus -Quest 2 takes gaming to whole new level. I bought this for my son who is a huge gamer , but checked it out myself. It offers a variety of virtual experiences and you don't need to be a gamer to enjoy it . There are apps and videos that allow  you see nature and exotic places in a exciting new way and it feels like you are actually there. I'm looking forward to more exploration.

Yo 120 Hertz refresh on the screen is a game changer. No longer will you be dizzy from the flickering frames. With the three-point adjustable eye settings. You will be limited on the focus but they did a good job picking general sizes. It's not the best VR headset but the best affordable mobile one that you can buy. This is the revised quest 2 "Advance" so that's why I decided to get one.

It's a great product, there's just not a lot of content for it. They've had plenty of time to come out with entertainment other than zombie shooters and climbing. 

Great experience and still some fun to be had on it, but I guess we're still in the infancy of VR and no game or app developers really want to commit to anything substantial yet. 

Still, all in all, don't regret the purchase.

This is SPECTACULAR!! No review ever written will be able to fully describe how awesome this invention is!! The graphics are mind blowing and the surround sound is just wow. No other way to describe this. I bought it 2 weeks ago and have been Oculating practically every night on this.  I brought it to work to show to co-workers and they were just so impressed too.  It's worth every penny.

One of my favorite purchases ever! You do not need a gaming pc to use & enjoy! It truly feels like you are wherever you go in this VR! I love the quality of the games! I love the quality and feel of the YouTube videos. Everything we have tried so far is so much fun! I have been swimming with sharks, fish, etc., surfing, toured museums, killed zombies and so much more! Worth every penny!!!

Great so far. Purchased this product for our granddaughter and I am surprised how real it feels when you put it on. Tried the climbing game and actually gives you the feeling that you are hanging on the edge of the rocks. Only thing that I don't understand is why would you need a Facebook account for this. So everytime you have to purchase a game it has ro fo though your Facebook account.

The actual quality of the product is incredible. The tutorial game that teaches you the basic controls and functions looks so amazing and feels very intuitive. The biggest complaint I have is the selection of games, and how the movement in the games can feel a little awkward. Overall I like this purchase but dont use it all that much due to the lack of high quality adventure style games.

For the price you don’t get a whole lot of information about how to install and how to set up. Should’ve done a lot more research before I made my purchase. Broke one of my serious rules always do a lot of research before you make a big purchase.What was received as a gift is still not set up needs a huge investment in time and some money to get it set up and going.Somewhat disappointed

The product requires you to have a Facebook account. I bought three of these for my kids and there is no way I would let them have a Facebook account. And even if I wanted them to have a Facebook account, Facebook does not allow users under 13. To this product can't be used by anybody under 13. Oculus was a good company until Facebook bought them but they have gone downhill since then.

the headset is a 4.5 star and I'm coming from a PSVR.
no wires is AMAZING.
BUT and a super big BUT is Facebook spying on you.
YOU CAND USE IT UNLESS YOU HAVE A FACEBOOK ACCOUNT.
It has cameras  ,  a microphone , and WIFI.
Facebook collects as much data about you to sell to anyone and use it to change you habits.

The mic will pickup every sound you and around you and facebook will you that and sell that data.

The camera will capture and everything it see , faces , finger prints , bills you left out ,how messy you house is, your kids faces , if your window is open cars outside etc. collect that data and sell it.

etc. etc. etc.  this is will its really good and cheaper then most , the data it will collect will be far greater the what they are selling it for.
Its like having a Facebook data broker in your house recoding and 3d scanning your every time you use this headset.
Read the terms and service.

I have been enjoying this for about a month now and am happy I got it. The apps I have used have been a fun time. With the size of most apps, I will have plenty of space for quite a while.
The only complaint is, if you want to use headphones, you have to use a wired set as it doesn't support wireless ear buds. There may be adapters that would work but I haven't looked into those yet.

The Oculus is a truly gratifying experience.  Having never ventured into VR b4 I was blown away.  I’ve taken virtual tours of the Anne Franks house, Van Gough 3D, and the 7 wonders.  We tend to play Arizona Sunshine more then any other game.  Had been waiting for the PlayStation 5 since 2020 CHRISTMAS to no avail and thought we’d give this a try.  We liked it so much we each got one.

Had a Rift S and went to Quest 2 for the wireless upgrade. Worked great. Now I can play games locally on the headset and stream desktop VR games wirlessly as well (need third party paid apps to do this). Only downside I would say is the short battery. I just got a 10k mah battery to solve that. I would recommend to anyone looking to get into VR, can't beat what you get for the price.

Having owned an Oculus Quest - the 2 is great. Sure the strap quality is a bit lower - but the battery life in the handsets is stellar and the increased resolution just makes the experience that much better. Cannot understate how much fun this is, and how great the VR experience has come. For less than the price of most video cards (or a phone) - you will have a ton of fun with this.

This is my first experience with VR and I might say it was awesome! The graphics are beautiful, the sound quality is great! The instructions on how to work the controls are very self-explanatory. I am still a beginner, and have not gotten into the “meat and potatoes“ of the experience just yet, but I am so looking forward to it. I can only recommend the Oculus Quest 2 to……EVERYONE!!

This is one of the best vr headsets I've ever used (this is my first one so that's not saying a lot lmao). It's practical, convenient, and easy to use. Only downsides are that you have to have a Facebook account sadly and that you will find that the headstrap is unbelievably uncomfortabe (So is ths elite strap because it has no padding...). Really unfortunate but "it is what it is."

Overall the product its amazing. ONLY if quest 2 its your 1st Virtual game. Totally worhty. But if you already have Oculus Rift, I would not recommend it. Not fair that you have to purchase all of your favorite games all over again at its original price when you already purchased them in your Oculus rift. Not fair to pay double the price for the same game in order to play on the go.

My roommate won an 128GB version of the Oculus Quest 2 on a drawing. When he got his in, I'd tried it and got hooked, especially Beat Saber. So I went and got me the 256GB version. -2 Stars, it requires an active Facebook Account. Facebook don't like my kind and keep putting me in 30 days FB Jail. Not sure if it will render my Quest 2 useless if Facebook ever put me back in FB Jail.

The Quest 2 is a great all in one VR system. The only reason for 4 stars is that the facial foam has given several people, myself included, a severe reaction due to some kind of chemical. This seems like poor quality control to me. 

The head strap is also terrible compared to other VR systems. But upgrading the strap to a halo and the facial foam to VRCover make it a solid choice.

Very entertaining and enjoy the 360 view. Hate that there’s not many game options to choose from. There’s even less free games, unless it’s demo. I would still recommend this item to others. This product has to looked as an investment, rather than a basic gaming console.

FYI... It’s great for learning. To float in space, reaching for stars, while being educated about the universe.

Good overall. Graphics are good very few instances of lag. When you cast to your phone it slows down pixelates and sometimes freezes the screen. 
The first couple of days of use the headset died while charging and corrupted the memory. It took a couple of hours to reload the software after doing a factory reset. It seems to be working correctly now.
Best option for stand alone VR.

Build quality is bad. IDP adjustment is bad and a joke. Strap and face cover are insanely uncomfortable. Black levels suck. Battery life is horrible. Stop trying to make a cheap product. I’d be happy to pay more for a product that is built better. By the time you do all the mods to make it better you have spent 600. And nothing can fix the horrible black levels and ipd adjustment.

All I can say is that I am completely blown away by how well put together, versatile and functional the Oculus Quest 2 is versus the HTC Vive Cosmos Elite system. Two great gaming libraries (Hint, 4 Star Wars games in the Steam and Oculus Rift Stores combied). AN the headset is light, not cumbersome... and for some reason, when I put it on... it fits just right, out of the box, and my vision, with glasses, adjusted properly. With the VIVE... I have to keep adjusting the focus... every time, during games, out of games...  And the versatility of playing Oculus RIFT PC VR games from the store... on this device... via the seperately purchased USB-C cable (I would encourage ANYONE to watch a Youtube video or two and purchase a nice 3rd party cable for a fraction of the price) just expands the entire platform. THen once you have wireless Remote Desktop opened back up to your desktop PC.... whole new ball game...

This was a Christmas gift for my grandson and he absolutely loves it!  It was packaged very well. He has been playing with all day and said it makes him feel like he is actually inside the game. He likes how he is able to see his hands and the buttons easily on the controllers. The light the controllers project make it easy to know exactly where you are pointing with each hand.

My grandchildren are having a lot of fun with the Quest 2.  It appears they are getting more exercise than they normally get.  In addition they are spending more time with this then they do with Ipads and various games online.  The two grand children each have an Oculus so they are both involved at the same time.  It is now mid January and they play with them almost every day.

This headset is really good. I would recommend you buying this. First, it is light on your face. Unlike other headsets, this is one of the lightest. Another is that it has really good trackings. There are no tears whatsoever. A con is that the strap is uncomfortable, when buying this, you might need to get some other straps and replace it. Overall,  this device is really good!

Awesome system and wireless!  Perfect controller response and read!  It is my opinion that this is one of the best VR headsets on the market at the moment!  The only thing I hate is Mark Suckabuck having anything to do with this system.  He is a police state, censorship shill, who has no place in limiting, or removing anyone’s first amendment rights!  Otherwise....amazing buy!

Facebook is the grinch that stole Christmas for my son.  Could not sign up because his email was blocked; even using his phone was unable to setup account.  Oculus support is overwhelmed with a backlog of tickets and unable to assist.  Be aware that you are at the whims of facebook for access to your games and profile and they can turn it off for any or no reason at any time.

A friend came over with the VR.  The minute you put it on it’s like “WOW” it was so cool we went out and bought one.  For me it was a bit of a pain to setup because of the whole Facebook thing but once setup the adventure begins.  You are there, in the game. It’s so cool.  Your family will love it. You will love it.  I am 54 years old and love it. Get it.  I highly recommend.

We bought this with hopes the kids would enjoy it and I can assure you, after countless hours of pure enjoyment, the purchase was well worth the cost.  We have a 14 year old boy, going on 19 and a 12 year old girl going on 10 and they both love it.  Lol.  

In all seriousness, you will not regret buying this, especially if you have kids.  Lots of fun and good times to be had!

I was debating between the rift s and the quest 2. End up going with the quest 2 to since it can do stand alone vr and link to the pc. Glad I went with the quest 2. Wireless play is much more immersive but having the ability to connected to the pc to play steam vr is what I really wanted and it doesn't disappoint. I went into vr have a psvr and this is a couple great steps up

This is amazing. I’ve done VR before on the PlayStation and this is just as good screen wise but better because there are no wires. I appreciate that you don’t need headphones so you’re not completely cut off from the world unless you want to be. And I love how it protects you from hitting anything in the real world by letting you set up a playing boundary. It’s pretty great.

Amazing all-in-one headset. This is NOT baby-VR. This is full 6DOF full tilt VR for the masses, wireless, and no PC needed. It is like magic. Even better than the Quest 1. Lighter, smoother, faster, way reduced screen door effect. I have a Valve Index and but this headset is probably the best VR on the market ESPECIALLY for the price. You cant beat the price for what you get.

I had tried a brothers printer and it caused my circuit breaker’s to jump.  It was cheaper and I tried  to save money but I upgraded to an HP   This printer was worth every penny. I’m so glad that I spent the extra money    I run a 18 employee business and we use 1500 sheets of paper per week.  My HP easily handles the load    I definitely recommend the HP pro laser jet 428.

It was a little trouble to get all of it started, being that we had to get out 13yr old boy a Facebook account to fully utilize it. it’s a Facebook product. After a little bit of time tweaking here and there, it’s finally up and running. The boy loves it and we can hear him having a good time with it on while he explores the VR worlds he downloaded. Great system for a gamer.

My first Ouclus Quest 2 VR.  Only couple of hours to play.  My husband bought me battery headset with carry case and I also purchase at Best Buy rechargeable batteries for controllers. I bought cover grips for controller because those little sucker almost few out of my hands LOL Must have! 
Power Source is the brand silicone grips. On Amazon 
I really enjoy playing it a lot!

Honestly not impressed at all. 
Using on pc doesn't seem to work as it should. 
resolution on pc seems to be worse than the rift s
Battery life is poor
Heavy 
Not comfortable (even with the elite strap)
A lot of light leak around the nose. 
Have to sign in through facebook AND use a phone to do setup and other things after. No thanks. 

I'll be shelving this or returning it.

INCREDIBLE!  This is my second exposure to VR and unlike my first experience with a headset that used my iPhone for the image, this one blows me away.  The Oculus Quest 2 provides a truly alternative reality.  You are immersed in whatever environment you choose.  And you can interact directly with 3D virtual characters.  I can't wait to explore all the other things I can do.

So far, the best budget friendly VR experience ever, even more if you don't have a PC or a PS4(VR). I bought the PSVR and compared to this Oculus Quest 2, it feels like a Next Gen VR "console". I never owned the Oculus Quest 1 but I know that Quest 2 is even better. Game catalog is pretty decent for all player and budgets. I really recommend buying the version with more GBs.

This is the greatest toy for grown-ups. You can shed pounds and have fun at the same time. The games are reasonably priced, cheaper, and far more exciting than the $60+ games from X-Box and Playstation. I had the 64GB and switched to the 256GB. It's worth the investment. Once you see all the fun and cheap games to own, you will see the importance of the extra storage space.

VR games are very different from traditional PC and console games.
The experience is drastically different between watching someone playing on Youtube and playing it yourself with a headset.
The only problem I have is that the image can get blurry if I am not wearing it perfectly due to my glasses.
Also you need a lot of free space in your room to actually enjoy playing VR.

Extremely dissatisfied with this product will be returning after having less than a month.  There is a glitch in the system and games cannot be played. THERE IS NO SUPPORT OTHER THAN TO RETURN. May online reviews express similar issues its a 50/50 chance the device will work.
Over priced poor quality game system offers no solution to downloading glitches. Very disappointed.

I absolutely love the oculus quest 2. The games are so Immersive it really puts you right into the story of each game!  It can do so much more than just games!  You can be in a movie theater,  on a computer,  or even on a tour of another country or place of interest!! I have yet seen anyone not live it that I have showed it to!   Let it be in your next family get together!

3 stars for how awesome this could be. The device is buggy beyond reasonable glitches, this is a beta product. Almost unbelievable they released this to the market without working out major issues. Crashes, fail to run software as it should be, nonstop errors, very limited library of apps. Let’s hope Apple and MS will take notice and release their own competitive devices.

This is a great product and my first VR experience. After doing a lot of research I came to the conclusion that this is the best bang for your buck and one of the only headsets that do not require a PC to play your games. It’s completely portable which in itself is pretty amazing. It’s not without its few drawbacks but for what it is it’s very fun and extremely immersive.

Best VR headset for the money. Sure there are better, but they are 3x the price AND you need a gaming PC.

This gives you solid wire free VR gaming.

Also you have the option to play PC VR games with the provided link cable or VR Desktop if you do  have a gaming computer.

Not built as sturdy as the Quest 1, but for an entry level VR you can't beat the bang for your buck.

The hardware is great.  There is almost no screen door and once all the apps take full advantage of its capabilities it will take another leap.  The Facebook account requirement isn’t an issue for most, but it still is a problem. If you close your Facebook account after you have purchased games, you will lose the games. I hope they address this and change their policies.

Overall after using most Oculus products here is what I thought about this one. The tracking for the controllers is a little tricky. Your hands almost have to remain in sight of the front cameras at all times. If not it loses track of hand positioning. The battery life is ok, wish playtime lasted a little longer. Even with the little negatives it is a really good headset

Headset works great! Very easy setup if you already have a Facebook account. We were able to share games and play together on our other Oculus headset. We play it a lot more with two headsets because we can play a lot of games together at the same time. In an electronic world, it’s a great way to spend time with your kids. After you get over the motion sickness part! :-)

Received this as a gift from my kids and I love it. I  bought most of the Star Wars games for this and thoroughly enjoy them. Bought the Creed boxing game and its like being in the ring. So many things that you can do with this without having to leave the house. Makes for a fun family night since you can cast the Oculus image to your TV or tablet and see what's going on.

Had an Oculus Go. The Quest 2 is a great upgrade compared to the Go. Sharper images and better controllers along with better features for game play. Also great for watching movies on a "big screen" since the resolution is much improved over the Oculus Go. Only downside is that I must now create a Facebook account. After doing that, I'm now getting many unwanted request for "friends" request on Facebook. You have to install the Oculus software on your phone to be able to setup the Oculus Quest 2 so that must be the vector for all the notifications from Facebook that are trying to get me to participate on Facebook. I decided long ago that I would leave Facebook, but now I'm back on their platform. Not happy about that. I would have given 5 stars except for the Facebook account requirement. Would have been much happier if they just kept my Oculus account separate and not forced the account to be merged with Facebook.

If you want to take VR an AR to a whole new next level than this product is for you. You can literally go outside your backyard or anywhere and play games on this and you can have as much space as you want and I do recommend you buy the 256 gig because there’s tons of games that you’re gonna wanna play and a lot of environmental things that you’re gonna want to try out!

Absolutely horrible, not only is this stupid expensive, but Facebook requires you to put all of your sensitive information on here. IF you don't they can LOCK the device.  As soon as I noticed that, I returned this.  DO NOT BUY!!  Also Games or other things require a lot of money. If you do purchase this be prepared to spend a lot of money and loose all of your privacy.

Absolutely love my oculus quest 2!! Playing it as a stand-alone experience is fantastic. Getting a fit with the head bands can take a long time but that doesn’t take away from anything other than fatigue your head/forehead kinda fast. Using a link cable to my gaming computer expanded that experience even further making it extremely worth getting. I highly recommend it!

I am 75 years young and this thing is awesome ! ! !  Lets me experience places around the world in Virtual Reality that I would never EVER be able to get to.  It's like being there.  Plus, I am now able to download 360 videos that I have taken over the years and with this headset....I'm back to where I captured them.  Not just watching on a flat screen. I Love It ! ! !

The roller coaster game is so realistic feeling that when I went around a corner, I actually fell over on the floor. Pretty amazing how the technology makes you feel like you are really there. Game are fun, some of them even give you a bit of a workout and none of them require sitting on the couch doing nothing. So, I think this is a fun gaming addition for any family.

I upgraded from the 1st generation rift to the wireless quest 2. I don't notice a difference in the graphics and love the hands free of the quest. I love the fact its portable and use the boxing for fun workouts. Only con is that the head strap that comes with could use improvement. but I purchased a upgraded strap to address that issue. I would rate it as a must have.

Awesome headset. I’ve been using various VR setups since the original HTC Vive, and I’ll gladly say this is the best experience I’ve had in VR so far. Being completely wireless is a game changer. The games built into the headset are great, and if I want to play higher quality PC games, there’s are ways to do that wirelessly, also. Amazing headset, highly recommend it!

Great experience! Loads of fun for family and friends. Battery is fine for one or two people to enjoy but if your planning on sharing the experience you will be waiting around for it to charge. I plan on getting the upgraded headstrap with the extra battery. The face fabric also needs upgraded for longer use.  Works well with the pc as well. Go for the higher storage!

Such an awesome all-in-one VR solution. You can play fully wire free, or you can play PCVR games Steam link. Lastly, the new App labs for sideload games and wireless PCVR setup leave this to be an amazing headest. One grip would be that the included strap leaves much to be desired. I recommend upgrading to an "elite" strap of some kind as soon as you get your headset.

I had been waiting for this since it was first announced!! I have the Quest 1 and it is GREAT!! I love it!! The new Quest 2 is GREAT and I love it too!! The upgrades to the tech are noticeable and improve the experience quite a bit. The best part about this device is that it is actually cheaper than its predecessor so it is a great time to get into the VM experience.

The Oculus Quest 2 is EXTREMELY AWESOME as a wireless headset. It's also great that it can be linked to a gaming PC allowing you to also play Oculus Rift and Steam games. 

My only critique is that, in wireless mode, the battery life is not that great lasting only about 2-3 hours at the standard refresh rate. However, when linked to a gaming PC, this is not an issue.

Excellent headset. So much to do and the quality is great. With a USB 3.0 cable you can hook up to a computer and play PCVR games like Half-Life: Alyx, which I highly recommend.

Absolutely worth the purchase. Not only for gaming but movies, YouTube, concerts, sporting events, social networking and more. Gaming is honestly just a small part of what you can do in VR.

It’s amazing! This is the first Vr headset I’ve ever had, and I can’t stop having fun. Love the design, fits great, and keeps you moving! Definitely make sure you have the recommended space to play, because it can get painful playing in small spaces! The battery life on it is pretty decent, you get about 4 hours of straight playing. Overall, very worth the purchase!

What a fun little VR set. The Quest 2 was easy to set up and run, providing a really fast onboarding process to get playing very quickly. I've used it for games that come on the Quest 2 store, and for games that also come on the Oculus Store (some rift games) and on Steam, all through the link cable that's sold separately. The graphics have been pretty decent, and the options were decent for adjusting the eyepieces to avoid blurring. My 14 year-old son has gotten a pretty good cardio workout from some of the dance and sport games. What's even more fun is you can cast the image from the game onto a TV via Chromecast, so the whole family can be part of the experience. The only thing I've needed to work around has been getting my glasses on with the headset, but it comes with a spacer to help with that process. This is my first VR headset, so take this review with that grain of salt, but the it's been a lot of fun so far.

Took some time to get it setup.  Had to hook it up to my original Oc PC as it would connect to phone until then.
Pros.  No wires and no pc needed, well after setup anyway.
Get to watch my many 360 vids of places now.  
Cons.  Wish it could play my old Oculus games without the wire.  Some may port over I've heard so I'll see which ones do.  A little heavy on the head

This was a purchase for my 12 year old granddaughter and she loves it. She was able to try out a friend's set and decided to go with the same one, We paid the extra $100 over the 64GB set to get 4 times the memory and feel it was well worth it to save having to upgrade in the future. The set seems to be made of good quality components and she is very happy with it.

My wife doesn't know I've opened and played with my Christmas gift. This thing is awesome, I'm upgrading from the original rift and samsung gear vr. It's so nice to be able to get rid of those two for one that's better than both. My only qualm is that it is a tad fuzzy for me because the eye adjustment only has 3 settings instead of anything within a certain range.

I cannot put into words how fun this is to use.  I have read books and seen movies where people get lost in VR.  I am trying hard not to be one of those people but I have so much fun.  From the exercise apps to the game apps I am always trying something new. Got one for my husband.  Showed my neighbor and she got two for her grandkids.  You will not be disappointed

Love this VR set! Obviously MUCH MUCH MUCH better than the crappy ones where you put your phone in a headset. I never bought one of those, just tried someone else's. Those samples made me not think much of VR. THEN a friend had the Oculus and let me try it. Game changer! superb realistic video that has literally made me jump a few times... my wife has video proof.

such a fun device and I can see so many possibilities for it in the future.  Not being tethered to a computer was one reason I had not purchased a VR headset until now.  After buying 1 for my daughters birthday I ended up buying 1 for each family member so now we have 4.  So much fun.

Can't wait till they come out with more material like civilization style games.

Shipping came faster than the estimated 2 weeks. I have enjoyed playing on this system almost everyday since I received it. I am a 43 year old female. Who is finally having fun while exercising. I watch movies, solve puzzles and blast directional squares to a beat. Oh yeah, and the kids enjoy it too. I highly suggest this unit and would do I again in a heart beat.

Great vr system. Not as expensive as the others on the market but no computer necessary as it is a stand alone system. Lots of game options and they are not as pricey as the platform consoles. I like the way you actually have to have physical movement to play and ur not just sitting in a chair. But there is that option if you can’t  be on ur feet for long periods.

I dont care how old you are. This VR Quest 2 is awesome! I got it mostly for the workout games. I downloaded Supernatural and so far in only 2 weeks Ive lost 6 pounds. I feel great and cant wait to get off my daily job to go home and work out. Best motivation to stick with it. Love the product, and its easy enough for a beginner to use. Everyone should have one!!

Bought this for my daughter to play with. She loves it. I tried it out and ended up getting a second one so we didn’t have to wait for it to charge. Fun games to play. Some exercise games as well to keep you moving. Down side is you have to link them to a Facebook account.  Other than that I’d recommend for kids and adults for fun. Recommended for 13 plus though.

Got one for my husband and brother in law to play golf. They love it. Had to get extra to include grand sons. The graphics are amazing. The games included are mind blowing.  You can ride a rollarcoaster.  Play golf. Fight a dragon. The idea you can play with family membets in the game is a real plus. I Expect the grandsons to show grandpa some tricks. Fun for all

This is SO much better than the one I bought two or three years ago.  Light years ahead in graphics and reality.  The games it comes with are really fun and having two hands (the orig. had just one) makes all the difference.  The family from 5 to 62 years love this.  And the fact that it can be streamed to a cell phone or TV so the rest can watch is a major PLUS.

Perfect companion for this year of lockdowns and shelter in place orders.  I've been busy playing putt putt with friends or even watching sporting events in theaters with total strangers.  I am also practicing table tennis during my lunch break.  It's great exercise!  This is a great value either way but I think most folks would be just fine with the 64GB model.

I thought my wife wanted this for my son but she wanted it for herself.  5 stars.  Not just for kids.  My wife uses it for her daily workout.  She purchased a separate peace for workout and sweat.  

Everyone in the family uses it.  Great purchase.  Kids will like what you can purchase for the Oculus but there is a ton of free content / apps that are available.

I've own a couple of VR headsets before purchasing the Quest2. It has not disappointed me yet! Great system to have. It has a great safety feature that others did not. The graphics and choices of entertainment are almost limitless!  Has just enough if not more to cater to my kids ranging from 5-16 and also myself. Can't wait to see what they come out with next.

This is the first VR headset I have used and the experience has been mesmerizing. Good build quality. Battery life could be better on the headset but the controllers battery life is amazing. The best part about it is that you can use it on it's own without any other devices required or you could plug it into a gaming pc and enjoy full blown PC VR games as well!

Very easy to set-up and use. With just a little charging and updating of the software it was on to playing the rest of Christmas Day until dinner. I already had a Facebook account so that was one minor issue not to hassle with that others have said was a downside. This is a great gaming experaince with games and levels the whole family can experaince and enjoy.

So far after using it daily, This has been the best VR experience I've ever had! The Quest 1 was amazing, but it did have its bugs and crashes! The Quest 2 has the good parts of the Quest 1 without the bads!

The battery does seem to last a little less as long but you can get away with having a big portable battery in your pocket charging the quest as you play!

Oculus software is junk. They force you to take every update. Every update makes things worth. The current update has bricked my oculus. I have tried with tech support for so many hours it is obscene. they offer no useful support, there are online forums with thousand of people with the same issues. Dont waste your time on a meta product, get something usable.

My grandson loves it. I tried it riding the roller coaster, and was pleasantly surprised. I see that this could be used for all types of activities in the future. 10 years from now we may be using this technology for many things including health and employment. It is an interesting and provocative start for VR technology. Be ahead of the crowd and get one now.

A huge performance and graphical boost over the original Quest. Also, much more comfortable due to lighter weight and more compliant foam. The downgrade to a non-OLED screen is noticeable and somewhat detracts from the increased resolutions be power. Overall, an amazing product at a still-reasonable price. Bought it for my son. Wouldn’t upgrade from a Quest 1.

Oculus -- will provide hours of fun. While it would seem like a one person game, its not -- having friends take turns and watching them move around is hilarious . The graphics are amazing and realistic. It truly is like being in a different world while you playing . PS - the dinosaurs seem like you can reach out and touch them - a little pricy -- but worth if

I bought this for the kids for Christmas and they love it. After it first came in, the husband and I wanted to have it all set up and ready for the kids to use on Christmas Day, after messing around with it we were tempted to keep it for ourselves. In the end we decided we would all share, but next time we have some funds come available I want one for myself!

Prior to purchasing the Oculus Quest 2 I had pretty much zero experience with VR.  I've had the change to try it a few times, but both times (once in a Microsoft store, and another at a party) there was some kind of issue with the headset and they didn't fully work.  These were first gen headsets at the time.

Using VR for the first time is mind-blowing... You get super euphoric because it's such a true game changer (no pun intended)!  The games you can download that is native to this headset are super fun.. I played Onward (FPS/COD type game) mostly, and a few of the social games like Rec Room.... but things changed after a few weeks of use.  I learned I could connect to my VR capable gaming PC and have another ***WORLD*** of VR games to experience.  Currently I've got over 100 hours of gameplay logged on Phasmaphobia. 

Enough of what I've been playing... Do yourself a favor, and get one of these.  You won't be disappointed!

There are two cons for this product, (1) battery life is not very long and (2) the charge for the games or any add ons is too high. This item os already very expensive and to add additional high charges is tto much. Otger than that, the product is great, the graphics and features are awesome. Its a good purchase but the manufacturer should consider the cons.

Great buy ,i had the older models this is by far  the best yet .I would love to see alot more familiar games on the app store bit its alot of great games also . Only reason o didnt give 5 stars is because i feel like for 400 bicks alot of the accessories you have to pay for should have came with the product when purchased,like the case .but overall good buy

I love my Oculus Quest 2, the process was very easy to two young ladies was very nice at check out Bc the order was not ready when I got to the store and I had to go to work, they was trying to get everything ready fast for me to get work on time. The only the thing about the Quest is they died fast to me. Other than that it’s good I love the boxing games.

We absolutely loved it! the grandparents loved it! the kids love it! my wife loves it! So much fun so many different apps. The only problem that we have is that there is only one (for now) I love the fact that I can watch my YouTube stuff and then the kids can play their games. Even my toddler can play with the Tilt Brush and other games. Highly recommend

I had an Oculus Rift which requires you to be tethered to a computer with a long USB cord.  The great thing about the Quest is I don't need the computer and  can take it anywhere and not have to worry about cords.  I don't see any reduction to the graphics quality, controller tracking, and headset weight compared to the Rift.  

The only issues I have is the stock head strap is essentially an elastic band that wraps around your head.  It did not feel stable if I needed to turn or tilt my head and would slip loose.  When I tried to tighten it, the pressure on my head is not comfortable.  I would recommend getting the Elite Strap.  

Another thing to note is if you had an Oculus Rift and switch to the Quest, know that you may have to re-buy some games that you already have on the Rift.  You can check Oculus website to see which games have Cross Buy.  If a game has it, then it will be available on Quest without having to re-purchase.

An amazing leap forward over what was offered just a couple years ago.  Stand alone, wireless, clarity, refresh rate... all GREAT!  One star off for Facebook requirements.    Facebook is a huge negative at least IMO but not enough to discourage a recommendation to buy.  Very happy with the purchase.  Just make sure you block all of your privacy settings.

1. the screen door effect is less noticeable than that of the 1st Quest
2. the built quality is very poor
3. the visuals are blurry near the screens' edges. 
4. the sound is distorted
5. much more comfortable that Quest 1st gen. 
6. it is also faster than the previous version 
Summary: mixed feelings, but I don't regret the purchase considering the price

All products are in perfect condition. The service was great from the Davie location. 

Not Best Buys Fault: I had to return the pc To VR cord because it wasnt compatible. (Oculus issue) Had to order alternative fix . Best Buy gavee no issues returning item and also researched the cable I needed for oculus quest 2 system for my gaming PC. I'm satisfied.

My kid loves it! 
Games are not too expensive
Easy set up
Easy to use
Fun for hole family 

Only negative is that it needs to be linked to Facebook account to work. Hope they change this feature in the near future. 
If I knew this from the start I would have considered a different brand. Hate social media integration especially with kids using the game.

This was so easy to set up!  Very easy to use once you get used to the virtual world around you.  You must try virtual roller coasters!  Aside from no jarring or bumps, You actually feel like you're riding them.  I love the fact that there is no cords to get tangled up in so I can sit at my desk and not worry about cords getting stuck in my char wheels.

I enjoy my Oculus- Quest 2 Virtual Reality Headset 256 GB. There are so many different functions on the device. You can play virtual reality games, watch movies, chat with people from around the world, play games for family and friends, and play the games with one another if you have mulitiple head-sets. Wifi is a must, and a Facebook account is a must.

Bought this for our son. Upon reading various reviews, we decided that the Oculus 2 is the best fit for us.  
Love the fact that its a free standing console and you don’t have to juggle with cables. 
Logging in through Facebook wasn’t an issue either. 
As for durability , I will have to update. But so far, our son is loving it. That’s all that matters.

Have had other vrs but this one is by far the best. There are no cables that way You down. It’s comfortable. Has adjustable straps and lens. Has many options to add for comfort. It has many games and programs. Really like beats game and new app they have that allows You to paint.  I would definitely recommend this if Your looking to get virtual system.

Works a little better than the first quest. Tracking seems to be better and the screen door look is nearly gone. Games play more smoothly. Did run into some issues with certain games but they were being run through the oculus link cable, so there may be some issues that need to be fixed later on. Overall it is a better but cheaper version of the quest.

This is much better than the original Quest and, in my opinion, better than the Rift. Graphics are very good and controls are simple. Glasses can still be an issue, even with the included extension added. Build quality feels good, but, like the RIFT and original Quest, if the headset breaks, you cannot send it back for repair, so purchase the warranty.

HOLY CRAP!!! VR is finally here and affordable. I have been on the fence about buying into VR. Afraid it was a fad (3D TV's *cough) and the wow factor would wear off in a week and the unit would just sit in the corner collecting dust. I'm glad I jumped off that fence and got a Quest 2. 
The reason I chose the Quest is it's ability to be a stand alone unit yet, works perfectly fine with a USB-C 3.0 or higher cable (or if you're lucky enough to have good enough internet, you can use Virtual Desktop, to ditch the cable and run PCVR wirelessly.) You do need to have a some what decent computer. I'm currently running it with a relatively new gaming laptop and it runs decently.
If you were like me, do yourself a favour and just buy it already. Take the plunge and see you in the Oasis!

Pro-tip: Vive has a service called Viveport, that is kind of like Game Pass. Where you pay a monthly subscription and you can play as many games as you like.

Kids love it. I don’t. It makes me so nauseous. I like the potential of VR headsets. I don’t think the technology is quite there yet. If It’s like, the sega genesis level of gaming. I can’t wait till we reach a ps5 level, also requiring a Facebook account is dumb. I don’t have one and never will. I used the gf’s. Otherwise it would have been returned.

I sold my PSVR to get this so I wouldn’t have any wires in the way when playing. I love the controls but seem a little difficult to hold for certain games, like boxing without all the buttons getting in the way. It’s very fun and the family loves the games, doesn’t seem like a huge assortment of games for it but hopefully that will improve with time.

Great value and versatile VR solution that is  great for beginners in vr or experienced upgrading from Original oculus rift or hatch vive. No mess of cables / breakout boxes separate tracking sensors mess just 1 usb -c cable. Really cleans things up and makes very experience portable and playable basically anywhere. Simple setup best way to go in vr.

My son loves it.  The only downside is that you're now forced to have a Facebook account to use it - versus the old "Oculus" account.  I don't like the concept of my son having a Facebook account / social media at a young age, but Facebook owns Oculus and thus controls those strings.

The interface is great, very easy to use.  Son loves it, so do it.

Looked to be the best option. Sales staff nice and knowledgeable.  Just got it yesterday so I don’t really have a comment on the product itself, but reviews are great everywhere except the Facebook thing.  Started a credit account with them so we will see how the rewards program goes. Christmas is here, so I have an opportunity to do some purchasing!

Went with the Oculus when it was clear I wasn't getting a PS5 and I couldn't be more happy with it.  Its very easy to set up and offers a really unique gaming experience.  My only complaint is I wish the games' graphics were a little more competitive with whats cutting edge but should I ever connect my Oculus to a gaming pc, I think it would keep up.

I wanted the Oculus for some time and had bought the "lower" one years ago and wasn't happy with it. This one I'm addicted to. I got some of the programs that come with it free but I have the membership to SuperNatural that has taken my expertise to the next level. I work remotely and can do this daily without feeling tired from a long day at work.

I've been holding out on vr for a long time until the graphics got to a point I could tolerate, and I played echo vr last night which is a free title and it blew me away I never thought we had got this far. Just blown away. 
The only downside is if your switching back and forth with your kids like I am upgrade to the pro strap Im getting one today.

You want to get into VR? You want clarity? You want fun? The Oculus Quest 2 has it all and more. From the no screen door effect to just being wireless, you cannot go wrong with the Quest 2. If you have the funds, get the 256 gig model and if you have the PC that can game, then opt to get the Oculus Link cable as your Quest 2 can now become a PCVR headset. 

The new Oculus Touch controllers feel great and I have yet to lose any tracking and everything flows. There is also the Guardian System that you set up by drawing your boundaries your play area and will come on if you start to get near those boundaries. And since a lot of Oculus titles are cross-buy, meaning if you have an Oculus Rift/Rift S, you can play those titles directly from the Quest 2. 

When you add the ability of your hands being the controllers, along with some amazing titles and experiences, the Oculus Quest 2 is going to be a great headset for those beginners to experts.

Easy to  use. 
Down loading games are very user friendly.                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                    
Uploading games are easy and Oculus  has a great return policy.

Love the higher resolution when compared with older VR headsets. It’s a much smoother picture. The tethered free experience is truly amazing. Love how all the sensors are built in to the headset without external cameras. Amazing how it can detect fingers as well during navigation without the controllers. I truly felt like I was in another world.

Before seeing these I absolutely hated Virtual Reality. I am sensitive to 3D glasses and vr headsets. However, my friend let me try this and that is why I ended up buying it. It is an unreal experience and I find myself playing Eleven Table Tennis a majority of the time. There’s only a few games I like but this was definitely worth the purchase!

I really enjoy playing games on my Quest. I play Beat Saber along with other types of exercise games for hours, and normally I can't get myself to be physically active that long. The only thing that I am waiting for is a direct connection to my computer's internet so then I don't have to cope with my spotty wi-fi, but that should be coming soon.

I am a vr enthusiast. I have owned and played with every headset from the original vive to the valve index. They all have their strengths and weaknesses. But boy oh boy the Quest 2 hits a home run. Sure there are some trade offs. Some of the visual sparkle and perfect tracking are a small step behind the index paired with my rtx 2080ti,  but honestly not much. I'm sure side by side one can tell the difference, but pop on the Quest 2, jump into the world of VR and totally enjoy your experience. The wireless freedom is amazing no more tripping over cords. I am totally sold! I truly believe this is the way vr is heading. So in summary save one to two thousand on a gaming pc and monitor. Plunk down $300 to $400 on an all in one system. $50 to $150 on accessories and be wowed with the new worlds you will soon be  experiencing. And if you still want to play pc exclusives wile they last pick up a link cable because oh yeah the Quest 2 does that too

My first real VR experience was the Gear VR, which I loved. But using my friend's Vive on PC was a revelation. The Quest 2 is the next best thing. Visual fidelity won't be as high since it's a standalone device but it still has a very high resolution display. And if you have a powerful enough PC, you can always hook it up to that for more games/better visuals.

So far my experience with it, the "downgrade" in visuals hasn't been noticeable. Walking Dead is fun af. Beat Saber and Superhot look just as I remember on PC.

The biggest downside so far is the fit. I wear glasses and have bushy/thick hair so it's hard to get the headset on easily with my glasses and I usually have to go without glasses.

Another downside is a smaller library of games. Using it as a PC headset, you'll have access to a larger amount of officially released games, even on the official Oculus storefront. As a standalone device their are far fewer games available to you.

Easy to use, unfortunately there is no way to use it without Facebook Account, you can’t create different users profiles without Facebook accounts which it’s hard if your younger child wants to play, he need to use your Facebook account. Besides for the account issues the games are really nice and easy to play one of my favorite games console.

Bought this for my kids because they kept bugging me about it.  Kids love it.. adults can get a little dizzy and nauseated after playing some games that move alot.  I recommend playing a little bit at a time..kids didn't have a problem.  I recommend buying an after market strap because the factory one sucks and doesn't fit some small children.

My first VR experience. I was very pleased with the level of quality albeit still a work in progress.  Several great experiences.  Cannot wait for more production.  Having a lot of fun with Wander, which uses Street View to go anyplace Street View supports. Value is reasonable but if you want to enjoy with you family multiple headsets is best.

Motion sickness is real, any other games that are not stationary if its your first time playing you will get motion sickness. But other than that the audio is good enough the graphics is Amazing ! And definitely worth the buy. The controls are also super responsive. And able to pair with steam games. You will have an uncap gaming experience!!!

Best portable VR system ever......as long as you can tolerate the mandatory Facebook data mining, login restrictions, potential lockouts, and usage tracking.  Accurate hand tracking and crisp visual quality make for a realistic VR environment for a reasonable price.  Such a shame about the Facebook relationship however.  Truly an evil company.

soooo freaking worth it my fellow geeks!!! it for all ages, break the ice at a gathering and it so much better than our playstation vr because it is wireless!! My sons love it and they were the ones who set it all up, ages 14 and 8. They have a work out from beats savers. Even my 81 year old grandma played it and she thought it was beautiful!!

It took me many months of debating before I got amped up enough after talking to some people to just buy it! Not even kidding, as someone who gets bored with game consoles, I was worried I’d get bored with this! Nope! Every time I put on the headset I have a completely new experience and it was always a chance to break away from “reality” (R).

Came quickly and love the headset! It is so real when you are in it! It also sets the boundary when you first put it on to prevent hurting yourself and running into things! This is a huge bonus! Only downfall is only one person account can be logged in and you need a facebook account so a pain for the family who all wanted their own accounts.

This could come with a much better head strap. Since, the one that comes with it isn’t the best. Also, with how much this cost, you would think it would come with a game or some kind of warranty. Nope. The only game that my daughter can play it is an additional $40. Not too mention, it requires a Facebook account to which, I don’t agree with.

Awesome experience. The freedom of not being wired (compared to the PSVR) is amazing. The headstrap isn't the most comfortable, but after 3D printing a freely available support for the back of it, it works well enough that I decided to spend the money on a few more games rather than upgrading the strap right now. Highly recommend this device.

This VR lives up to the hype.  I've used phone based VR units in the past,  but the Quest 2 leaves them in the dust. The video is crisp and the headset is a highly responsive to the controllers. 
The only downside is the battery life.  They have aftermarket solutions though,  if your comfortable strapping a battery to the back of your head...

This is an awesome piece of technology. I bought it for my son and figured I might play a game or two every once in a while. But, after exploring all that it does for a couple of weeks, I bought one for myself as well. From social interactions, to productivity, to entertainment, to (of course) games, this thing is awesome. Highly recommended.

Excellent gaming experience definitely a must have takes gaming to an entirely new level i own the Xbox one, ps4, switch, tablet, gaming laptop & now i finally crossed over to the wonderful world of virtual reality hands down a game changer however i will be ordering a head support accessory for extra comfort as the straps are not comfortable

Order and pickup were fast. Picture is clear and sharing to a tv is fun so we can “share the experience “ is great when playing with multiple people.  The only thing Inplan on changing soon is the head strap to the one with the battery.  The strap that comes with it is ok, but I tried the other one and fit and comfort are far above the stock.

This is worth the price. My son loves playing on it, almost too much, lol. I’ve even played on it a little. Pretty cool. The user interface is pretty easy to get a hang of. Easy to set up. Easy to download games. You can even log in from your phone (through the app) and watch what your child (or whoever is playing) is doing/playing/watching.

Great headset. The improved resolution gets rid of the screen door effect seen on the first Quest. This is an LCD instead of an OLED display, so black environments are much more washed out / more grey. Still well worth the upgrade. Watching video / movies in this headset looks much more like television quality without the screen door effect.

Fun for all and very fun. Works great however, if you are not used to virtual reality then you may experience motion sickness. It’s that good. I have never had motion sickness in my life whether on boats, helicopters or airplanes. I find that sitting in a chair while playing helps. My online knock is that the battery does not last very long.

Excellent VR headset as a standalone device. Been using it since the holiday and its worked excellently. All the games ive played on it worked quite well and have had a lot of fun with it. Beatsaber is my biggest game. I have yet to try it with the link cable for full pc capability but from what ive heard from friends doing so it works well.

By all that is Holy, this thing ROCKS!  When they say One in One, they are not kidding, the Q2 delivers on the hype and then some.  The Q2 is smooth and comfortable once the straps are adjusted right, though I do recommend the Elite Strap for added comfort.  This is the VR set I've been waiting for and you need to stop waiting and get yours!

Was perfect the first few, super easy to set up and super easy to use. The games are a lot of fun once you get the hang of the VR.  Than the left controller started to drift, similar to how the joy con drift. Waiting a month now for customer service to send another. I believe it’s a one and 100 type of situation but it’s still very annoying

Graphics are amazing.  Even games keep you active.  The entire family loves it.  The head strap is horrible however I purchased the elite options and it’s amazing.  

Battery lasts only 2 hours which is a pain when multiple people want to play.  Will be purchasing the extra battery pack soon.  All in all, I would recommend this to everyone.

I just hate the fact a phones battery lasts longer then a oculus, at the end of the day it was a purchase i probably won’t make again or recommend for fellow friends and family members the games are just boring to begin with not many titles that got my attention I honestly thought for $500 this would be solid of a purchase but was wrong…..

Headset has descent graphics and very entertaining.  256gig will allow you load an extensive amount of games onto head set. 
 Only cons are the strap(does not hold headset securely on your head)  and face cushion(makes your head sweat and isn't comfortable for extended play) but both can be replaced with improved after market replacements.

I've always wanted one and wondered if I should have gotten it. My dad who is 66 by the way had the 1st version. I played on his and that was it. Play beat saber on a medium level for a work out and watch how much you sweat lol.. He did advise to get the larger storage due to how much space some games do take up. So just be aware of that.

I've bought four of these now (the 256 gb version). I bought okbe for myself, one for my fiance, one for my son, and one for my daughter. This thing is amazing!! The games are fun and the experiences, like Jurassic World and IT are mindblowing. The exercise games are intense too. If you want one of these get it. You won't be disappointed.

I was already a believe in VR and how amazing it is but was disappointed in the headset having to be tethered to my gaming PC. Then Oculus comes along with true 6DoF un-tethered VR with well over 100+ titles. Oh My Goodness, what a great time to be alive and experience the next generation of home gaming experience. Thank you gaming gods!

This Oculus-Quest 2 Virtual Reality is the best playing game ever.
It made our Christmas so much fun.  Everyone from 84 yrs old 
60yr old 40yr old 20yr old 10yr old even down to our 6yr old  enjoyed it so much.  They were fighting  to be the next person        to play. It was a little expensive but I'll tell you it is worth every penny.

Quest 2 is awesome. We bought for Resident Evil 4 as its one of our all time favorite games. Their is lots of free games as well. This was a great purchase and we have had a lot of fun with it. Downside - the controller has no grip so sometimes its slips out my hand. Be sure to use the attached wrist straps. Similar to the Nintendo Wii.

I'm a huge fan of the Quest 2.  It is the perfect entry device for VR.  Light, great form factor, great library of content.  Highly recommend.  Only drawback is not having the built in headphones similar to the Rift/S; but that's easily fixed with earpods or headphone.  But in audio channel does sound better than the original Quest tho.

Absolutely love the Oculus, it is so much fun, so worth the money and if you watch a lot of Netflix you can watch Netflix on this in a virtual theater environment that looks like watching Netflix on a huge movie screen.  Definitely recommend the upgraded head strap/mount as it is easier to adjust and helps with the weight of the device.

So I've had my Oculus Quest 2 for a few weeks now and I love it. I was out of doing gaming for a while but my kids convinced me to give it a try. For the price you can't beat this thing to get into VR. The sound is very amazing considering you don't have actual head sets on. It is very immersive and real feel experience.

A couple of small critiques but nothing that would stop me from recommending.

1. The battery life isn't that great but you can resolve that by plugging in an external battery pack.
2. On the hand controllers, I keep pushing the button that pauses the game. I'm sure there may be a way to adjust that in the settings but I haven't figured that out yet.
3. I did try and connect my Sony blue tooth headset and although it did work, it slowed down the gaming experience and made things jittery. But you can hook up the headset to a audio jack on the Quest 2 and headphones so that is a work around.

So I will give a huge thumbs up to this!

Nice Product, Need more free/demo game offerings though with the product.  Need ability to wear/use without glasses, if they could somehow allow user to control focus that would help.  I've found some cheaper VR Glasses that manually allow this function, why doesn't oculus have on their glasses.  Other than that I recommend and like it

The oculus is way better than I imagined. It is easy to use.. It’s not super heavy. I like how clear and realist everything is on the oculus. My kids are in love it! I think I might want one of my own lol. I love the add on strap, because it keeps it from weighing your head down. That is an absolute game changer! I highly recommend it.
