Wasn’t as I expected or what I seen on tv. False advertising thinking the games that were displayed were going to be on app for free. Not any good games unless you are willing to spend $40 for each game to play. Not bad for the price but it should be more downloadable free games to play but ehhh at least it’s got the boxing game on it.

Great VR device, good quality in graphics/resolution. The only think i didn't like are the strap and face mask, literally is a sponge absorving your sweat and the strap doesn't balance the weght of the device, not confortable, so definitivelly need to order the two items so the experience can be better. Rather than that i recommend it,

This is the first VR console that we own. This is definitely next level entertainment. Great way to get up and experience something else. Even the demos keep you entertained. Taking turns allows each of us to enjoy different things. I am looking into a different or addition strap to keep the product stable and solid. Highly recommend!!

We purchased two Oculus Quest 2 units and both my wife and I are amazed at the quality of every fantastic virtual experience! From games, to worldwide travel programs and experiences and even watching movies in a virtual theater, we are literally surrounded 360 degrees of visual stimulation and experiences from the comfort of our home.

I've had so much fun using this over the past week. Setting it up was easy, the graphics are amazing, and continue to impress with each game I play. I'm looking forward to what Oculus continues to do with VR and hopefully with this system, and it's great price point, more people will get in and developers will make more apps and games.

For the most part it is fantastic.  Much better resolution than prior generations.  Much sharper and better battery life than the first generation Oculus.  Only annoying thing is not being able to purchase the elite strap... Sold out everywhere and the built-in strap is not too comfortable.  Need more titles or at least demo versions.

Pretty amazing VR! Bought this for an early Christmas gift fir my son as I expected it to be out of stock when Christmas actually rolled around. He absolutely loves it and is 13!

I have a smaller head than him so it takes a bit to adjust the headset to get it to stay on my head versus his. 

Otherwise this is a very entertaining buy!

It works great as a stand-alone unit but I want to review its ability to connect to Steam via airlink.  If that is a reason you may be considering this product, let me assure you, it worked great!  Next to no lag.  Let me access my Steam library within the Oculus interface.  Controllers mapped perfectly.  Half-life Alyx, here I come!

Good as a standalone better tethered to your pc. The games for the quest 2 just aren't very big. It is basically a phone vr. Plug it into your pc and play the big games and also use Steam or other vr sites. You don't have to buy the link cable from Oculus, there are plenty of good cheap ones out there. We have one and it works great.

The best overall headset you can currently buy. Excellent visuals and controllers. The user interface is very easy and clean. The current library of games is pretty decent with sime real gems in there. My only complaints are battery life and the fact that you HAVE to have a facebook account to use it. Other than that it is very good.

Purchased this for my children for Christmas, and I've actually ended up using it more frequently than they do and it's tremendous. I have another VR system, but it is wired to another device and frustrated to set up. This is completely wireless when in use, and I have enjoyed not only playing games but also watching movies using it.

The only drawback is that you really need more than the flimsy underwear tight e white e strap to hold this incredible technology to your forehead.And the flimsy cover for your face is really lame.Thank the nerd gods that many after market companies have filled the need for all the other things to make this a comfortable experience.

What an experience! I've played other VR headsets and while gaming still has a way to go, the potential is there. The video immersion is out of this world. If this is the future and I believe it is, the Metaverse will begin with the Oculus Quest 2. Also, read The History of the Future for context for the creation of the Oculus.

First of all, I’m a purrrrrety great person and even better customer. No, it’s true! I’ve read so in other reviews I’ve written. 
Anywho, so I had the oculus go which is neat but kinda bottom of the oculus barrel, so to speak, so I wanted an upgrade.  This thing is awesome, kinda like me, which explains why we get along smashingly.

The Oculus Quest 2 is the best overall headset on the market right now, and it's also one of the cheapest. It does have some issues, though. They seem to introduce technical issues with each firmware update and don't always fix them with the next one. But you can't beat a completely wireless and self-contained VR kit for $300-$400.

This is by far the best device device for virtual reality I've ever used before. I bought this for my 16 year old son, And we have used other virtual reality headsets But none of them compare or even come close to the oculus system Far more superior and highly recommended. And all the things you can do with this system is amazing.

I upgraded to this from a Oculus Rift CV1.
Stand-alone Quest games work great, PCVR games on Oculus store and Steam have worked great, both with Link and Virtual Desktop (wireless PCVR!!!!)

Inside-out tracking works really well. My PC had issues trying to run 3 sensors for the Rift so the Quest 2 is a huge upgrade in this regard.

Felt amazing the first time i put it on. So many games to play and they all look and feel so realistic. It has a little elarning curve but once you get a hang of it its amazing to get lost in for hours. If youre going to get one get the 256 GB one. The games take up room and if you dont want to keep deleting games get more memory.

So glad we went with the larger storage capacity. My son and I have been having so much fun finding new games and apps. The interface is extremely intuitive, so we were playing in no time. The only drawback is the required Facebook account. I had finally escaped that cesspool and had to create a new account just to use the Oculus.

I finally bought the Oculus 2 and man is it everything and much more that I was hoping for.  I initially got it for the games but I actually love the other content even better.  Going to the hottest nightclub in Tokyo and getting a VIP experience, swimming with a great white shark, traveling to Mars... and on and on, just awesome.

Good VR headset overall. Easy to set up, controls are easy to use, and gameplay is fun overall. Oculus' store has a fairly broad selection of interesting titles.

If you buy the optional Oculus Link cable, then you can pair this with a PC. That's where the real selection of games can be found (e.g., Half-Life Alyx). Well worth it.

Insane!  You are easily transported to a different world once you out these on.  Best invention since the DVR.  So much free stuff to do also including games and immersive videos which are fantastic.  I’ve already had my brother and 3 friends buy this in November and they all loved it too.  Try and find it now, sold out all over.

This is amazing, stand alone VR Gaming or connect to a PC for additional games.  Glad I got the 256 I would have filled a 64gig already.  Can't wait to try this with a PC!  One thing I wish the battery life was better.  about 2.5 hours per charge.  Lot of people say get the pro head strap but I've had no issues with the standard.

I bought two of these, one for each of my son's. One is 12 and one is 25. They both could NOT be HAPPIER. They love the Oculus 2, and word is a lot of the bugs that the first edition had are all ironed out. All I hear are rave reviews about this. So while I cannot speak for myself, as I'm not a gamer, my boys give it 10 stars. :)

It definitely feels like ur right there but adjusting the headset gets frustrating.  As ur moving around sometimes it slips down due to sweat or just plain moving n u have to readjust which is not easy to do when its on u. Also all games have to be bought and some are not compatible with this vr. I wish they had more free games.

There's a lot of competition for our time these days PS5,  gaming computers,  virtual reality land real life , but make sure you make time for this oculus its definitely better than oculus quest 1 ,  it's faster,  clear picture , definitely worth it,  a lot of kinks worked out also , got the pro headgear  makes a huge difference

I only give a 4 star because after a while I do get a slight head ache and some motion sickness.  I'm 65, retired Navy and never got motion sickness before.  Over all though, it's pretty cool.  I do like the ability of talking with other players on line.  That too is a first for me.  I'm sure I'll enjoy it once I get use to it.

Coming from an Oculus Rift, the ease of setup with the Quest is kind of a game changer. I was able to just charge it up, stick in on my head and with a few minutes of setting up accounts, connecting to wifi, and play space, I was good to go to start browsing and downloading games (vs the Rift which required a gaming PC, setting up wired sensors and a wired headset). It's essentially a handheld console in terms of being able to bring it with me to a friend's place and be good to play within minutes. 

Be aware that this currently requires you to link a Facebook account even if you have a separate Oculus Account. If you currently/previously owned an Oculus headset, be aware that not all games are crossbuy (eg, I bought Beat Saber for the Rift but had to repurchase for the Quest 2. I have RoboRecall on the Rift and it was available for me to download on Quest for free).

I would recommend getting a different headband since the stock headband isn't comfortable.

What a great store.  I was about to give up and go home when I saws they were out and when to salesperson ran up to counter to let me know there were more coming off truck to please wait.  It really made my night and my daughters as well.  She also purchased one as well.  Thank you Best Buy for looking out for my best interest.

The oculus was a gift. My son loves it! I also love it as it gets him moving with some of the games like beat saber. The only thing we had a problem with was the strap on the oculus wasn’t for smaller heads as it kept falling down. So I was able to find a different head brace that’s compatible with the oculus and it fits great.

Definitely a sweet upgrade from the cell phone magnifies! Not xbox / PS4 level visuals but the immersion makes up for it. Beat saber is a ton of fun.  Guitar hero but with light sabers. Plenty of fun immersive games. 

Eleven ping pong is pretty dang close to real life you'll even try to place your paddle on the virtual table!

It's fun, my son really likes it and likes sharing its inner operability with his friends...  Could use more games though. Or at least access to some of the games that PlayStation and Xbox have. Those would be great in three dimensions. Or those kinds of games in Oculus. But that's not the Best buy issues it's an Oculus issue.

My son loves his Oculus Quest 2.  With covid, it has been really difficult for him dealing with isolation.  This has opened up a whole new world for him.  A way to be in alternate realities, and connect with other individuals.  I have nothing but good things to say about it.  Works great, and seems pretty sturdy and well made.

it fits on your head nice taking some time adjusting it but once I bought some accessories I don't have to adjust it anymore there aren't many free games that aren't multiplayer (vrchat/rec room) but I've liked all the other games (walking dead and Robo-Recall) I've had to buy so at least the games you can buy are top quality

These things are awesome! I bought this to lure the grandkids over! It worked! Simple to use, simple to set up. I already own Oculus one and wanted two so two kids could compete in the same game. Unfortunately as of now I would have to purchase games a second time because they have yet perfected sharing games from one to two.

Bought as a Christmas gift for my visual impaired husband (AMD).  It provides him with the ability to see beyond what he sees in the real world, while giving him a new source of entertainment.
Just wish it was a little easier to use on start-up.  We're still figuring out the games, and what to do, but it is very entertaining.

Best Vr head set bang for your buck. Does not come with any games though but for the price its great. Sort of down played as you sort of need accessories the better strap and  to have the best experience making the real cost somewhere in the 600 dollar range. Even then its still a fraction of other sets like the HTC vive ect.

This was my first experience with a VR headset and I am totally impressed. The set up was extremely easy and the equipment far exceeds my expectations! It’s intuitive to use right out of the box and there are many games available for beginners and advanced alike.I got a great price on it over the holidays and I’m glad I did.

Previously had Oculus Go.  Battery in hand controller corroded and ruined it.  This was to replace it.  Only issue has been living in rural area with no fiberoptic internet service.  Large downloads require going to town for more reliable connection. This is not an issue with the Oculus, but with local internet. Enjoying it!

Bought this for myself to use with the occasional gaming and workout.   Love this device.  I am now more active than ever with all the workout games.  Instead of just sitting i am moving and breaking sweats.   Highly recommend for those that are in the fence of buying one.   Lots of great fun while giving you a good workout.

Out of this world! Bought this for the kids for Christmas and wanted to have it set up for Christmas morning. Of course we had to test them out and it was a blast! EZ to set up and the experiences with the games we downloaded were intense. We were both sweaty messes by the end of it and exhausted from laughing at each other.

Great buy for my birthday!!

Pros:

It’s so much better then the previous versions. We can play some really cool games present on the oculus store but I hope it just get better from here.

Cons:
Playing for more then 40 mins becomes a little uncomfortable
The graphics needs improvement 
Sometime the oculus freezes sometimes

Love this thing!  I bought the first Quest and this one is decidedly lighter.  I also bought that head strap that doesn't have the battery and that is worth the $50 I paid. Much easier and quicker to put on and no adjusting for other users.
I haven't used it with a computer yet, but excited to try it with some other VR apps

We've had so much fun with this headset. The available games ensure that there is something for everyone. I feel like im getting a workout too!

I only gave ot a 4 because white is a silly color to have made it. The games make you sweat so otbstains pretty quick. 

Really that's it. No other negative things to say about it.

In love with my new Quest 2!  Nothing beats the simplicity of just putting on the headset and being ready to go.  Played capture the flag in the free Rec Room app and felt like I was 13 years old playing laser tag again.  Its really  like have the world at your fingertips, which is really incredible and difficult to describe. It has great resolution and absolutely stunning visuals and its a great price.
The head strap isn't very comfortable but so I've ordered a replacement.
The Facebook account isn't a big deal to me, already had an one, which I barley used. If you actually read the oculus privacy policy they only collect general user data and they only do it to improve the experience in the future.
Would recommend creating an oculus account with facebook, or merging your 2 accounts before buying because I've heard some have had issues, but Im sure they'll fix them soon.  And the library is great and expanding plus tons of free content. 
Definitely recommended

Coulda went with the smaller storage one tbh, but using it I’ve found it to be way more awesome then I thought it would be. Watching movies and playing games are great. All the other little things as well. Definitely worth it. I ended up buying the extra battery with the elite strap though. Only downfall is the battery life

I've tried other vr headsets, and this hands down is the best. No wires need, and the ability to map a room and play VR within in it is priceless. Also if you want higher fidelity vr games you can use air link and stream games from your vr ready gaming PC. I also recommend the elite strap for extra comfort and battery life.

WOW.  I had seen videos and heard it was crazy good...BUT NOW I KNOW! This has opened my "virtual" eyes to a world that is crazy.  There are so many functions/options besides gaming to get connected with.  Depending on the app or function, you will be immersed in a new "world" that may catch you off guard with its reality.

I can't believe how amazing this thing is!!!! I'm just now getting to set it up and I absolutely love it! Having a blast. Wish my parents could've experienced this. Graphics are phenomenal and the fact I can use my hands instead of the controllers makes me like we have finally arrived in the new millennium with some style.

This thing is great so far the whole family loves it. One thing I did not know at the time is  there is no reason to buy the 256gb unit since the 128gb unit is plenty of space since most games we have downloaded so far are like 1.3 gb or less. We have liked it so much that one unit was not enough so we bought a second one.

I didn't know what to expect.  I have a PlayStation VR and I have had a lot of fun with it.  I didn't know if the experience would be the same.  Boy!  Was I surprised.  What great fun this is.  There are a lot of great games to play and things to go.  It works flawlessly.  I don't know why I didn't get one of these sooner.

do I need to say anything? 
THIS IS F****ING AMAZING!!!

my wife is having a blast, and she does not like videogames,
but this is something else! this makes you wake up and exercise, makes you want to drink more water, give you energy to deal with your day... that is how we are feeling inside of our home with our new toy!

My 11yr old loves this... and we thought it required a desktop PC to use although it says all in one we weren’t clear on that and searched relentlessly to try to find... so we ended up buying a PC we didn’t need.  But he does love it and only negative is the mask does make his face red and hurt since padding not that soft

Always wanted a VR headset. Finally committed and bought the headset. The whole family loves it! Only thing I recommend is buying the elite head strap with battery charger so you can play the oculus while it’s charging. Battery life without it is usually about two hours. Also you need a FaceBook account to use the oculus.

The Oculus is a perfect device to purchase if you want to experience vr without the trouble of wires or any more complicated steps but I do must point out that the vr does run out of battery quickly and games must be bought within the vr sequnce to be played and don't worry there are free games but most games aren't free.

Wow.  I have been enjoying the Quest 2, playing daily since I got it.  There is so much more content available now than there was 4 years ago when I last tried VR.  Granted, a number of games are gory shoot-'em-ups, but there are more than enough other games and video to keep me happy for a long time.  Tip: try mini-golf!

I love this don’t get me wrong.. but for the price there’s not a big variety of things to do. It’s interesting yet gets boring fast at the same time. And the 100 dollar charging deck is a waste of money. It charges everything on different levels. Not worth the buy honestly rather wait for the PlayStation one to come out.

Sooo much fun! Gave 4 stars because of tracking issues with the controllers especially with games that have faster movements like Beat Saber. I do wish the battery life was a bit longer but it’s so nice to be able to take it anywhere with wifi access. Took it to work to share with coworkers and now they all want one too!

I bought this for my husband to watch basketball games which is awesome! Feels like you're standing courtside. The kids and I have fun with the games and boxing.  It feels so real! And great exercise too. I thought it was expensive initially but after using it and seeing all the things it can do, totally worth the money!

The Quest 2 is a fantastic standalone VR platform, my first headset. Aside from the Facebook requirement and questionable privacy policy, I have been nothing but satisfied with this headset. Easy to use and set up, no loss of tracking, solid hardware, and a decent game library make this a fantastic purchase at $299/$399.

I’m very disappointed with how much it cost besides the warranty, that it doesn’t include a cable link for which not even the store associate didn’t say anything when I asked was there anything else I would need for this device. It was very disappointing when they open it up for Christmas and they couldn’t even play it.

After doing some online research we decided to go with this unit and of course Best Buy had it in stock and had a great price too! Was able to order and pick up in store, which was amazing and super fast! Our sons love this thing. The only complaint from them is that we don’t have two and the battery doesn’t last long.

Purchased this for my husbands birthday. He loves how you can take it into any room and doesn't have to be connected to your computer to use it. Very user friendly. I am not a gamer and I love this thing. Beat Saber is awesome on it. We have owned it for a few weeks now and it has been played nonstop. Highly recommend!

Surprisingly, i love this thing ! the whole family does. I was very pleased with everything the oculus had to offer. I wasn't expecting it to be this good. The only downside is that i wanted a bunch of games  right off the bat , and i spent too much money ordering them. its amazing I don't regret this purchase at all !

I bought this for my kids thinking it might be an item they play with for a while and then move on to something else. Boy was I wrong. They use it 2 or 3 times a week (I have to limit their playtime) and never tired of it. I wish there were more games for the kids but the ones they have keep them entertained for hours.

This manager I believe his name was Antonio was by far the best problem solver , communicated very well and did as he promise , a true leader and very knowledgeable guy , as a company owner my self this young man is what real companies are made of , highly skilled and again one of the best representations of Best Buy .

I purchased the Oculus- Quest 2 VR headset for my 14 year old son. He is enjoying it for gaming, but needs to purchase more game options. Very good quality image with cable. He had originally complained about headaches and feeling motion sick when he used it. I hope that passes or is something that he will get used to.

Have not received Oculus. Ordered on 12/04/2020. Shipped from NJ, received no updates for 10 days. Contacted usps, they finally found package in Austin,TX. It then went to San Antonio. From there it went to Columbus,OH. The latest status is in transit, will be late (duh). We're begining to believe it will never arrive.

I've had my Oculus Quest 2 for about 2 months now. I absolutely love it. I understand the privacy issues, with having to link a Facebook account to use the device, but since I already have a Facebook account, I was ok with it. 

The only gripe, and it's very small, is that dirt or sweat grime shows up since it's white.

Got these for the fam so I could get my playstation 4 back haha! They are very light in weight and can be adjusted to fit the head better than our ps4 vr. Feels better control wise too, and a larger selection of games are available. Easy for the kids (ages 8 to 16) to navigate and load up themselves. Glad we switched.

So awesome! You will love this. Your kids will love this. So much fun that even the initial tutorial they have you use to set this up is a blast! If you're into VR even a little bit, you will really enjoy playing with this. And there's enough free/not expensive games that you don't feel like it's a money pit purchase.

Admittedly this is my first experience with VR and I am impressed!  Being a fan of the original Myst game from 1993 it was the first game I tried in VR.  The experience is amazing. You are in the game instead of viewing it on a flat pc screen.  Easy to set up and am anxious to explore other games.  Highly recommended!

Very cool system.  Not just games but work out, programs, and much more.  Takes some getting used to.  Had some head aches from playing to long. Felt like I was on amusement rides all day. Ha. But short times were no problem. Movement games can be really troublesome.  hopefully I will used to it as I use system more.

I know it may be proxy, but this has to be the most fun we have had as a family right at home.  Gaming experiences set to a real life feel.  And where else can you experience BASE jumping without the risk!
Visuals are just so real.  And bonus- this can give you quite the workout with some of the games and experiences

Im so glad I made this purchase, it's like having a vacation at your fingertips, the app tripp is a definite must try. I also love wander, when I just need a change of scenery.  Excellent dedign, not to heavy on the head. The pixels are very good, but could use a bit of Improvement. Overall this was a great purchase.

My son loves his oculus. He plays with it all the time. It can be a bit heavy on the head if you wear it for a long time....but it's a very cool and sturdy headset.
It really gives you a great virtual reality once you adjust the headset. It can also make you a bit dizzy if you are not used to it, at the beginning....

Great product, my first vr headset. Easy to use and start. Recommend buying an additional battery pack, only lasts around 2 hours on reg battery. Don't like having to tie it to my Facebook account. Needs more stand alone games. Have it hooked to pc with link cable... Lots of fun, great for watching TV and movies too.

We are enjoying the Oculus very much!  I am considering getting a second unit so we can share experiences at the same time.  I have used it for entertainment, learning, and general relaxation.  It can even be used to view and operate your home computers remotely!  I think every home can benefit from this technology!

This made an excellent birthday gift for my significant other. We immediately got Beat Saber & Pistol Whip on it and it's been a blast. The only downside is that a lot of games still don't support account sharing on the same device (looking at you Beat Saber) so we haven't been able to track individual achievements.

Definitely an improvement over the Quest as far as comfort, resolution, memory and processing. All at the same cost point. One thing on the Quest I thought was better is the lens width adjustment. On the Quest 2 you have to take it off to adjust it and then put it on to check if it's right not as efficient for sure.

Pretty good i have to admit I love what this has done for Oculus and the games it inspires. This is our 4th to our Oculus family and I am for the most part pleased but I think the upgrade for the head strap should have been included. But not too big of a deal. I also wish there was an option for adding memory card.

I was incredibly concerned that the new IPD system would negatively affect my experience with this device. I have an IPD of 71mm. But I’m happy to say there is a fair bit of tolerance built in despite the max setting of 68mm. They screens are crystal clear and the experience is somehow even better than the Quest 1.

Easy set up, but game selection is a little limited.  Kid was happy, and that’s what truly matters. Battery life is limited, but hat reduces the argument between you and your kid because it’s time to rest his eyes.  All in all it’s a nice little system, we like the grid guardian system to keep you in the safe zone.

Was a birthday gift for our son - but has been a fun addition for the whole family.  We took this on our Christmas "tour" to see family - and needless to say, every kid who used this VR gaming headset now wants one!  Has great battery life and much better processing speed compared to the Oculus Go we've also owned.

The Oculus - Quest 2 is fair hardware. But the setup and log on is cow dung, manure or dropping because you must use Facebook. Also, there is no support from Oculus or Face book. Before you buy this VR head set, check out the forums and blogs. What ever you do, DO NOT SET A SEPARATE FACEBOOK ACCOUNT FOR THE OCULUS.

I never had before a VR because  years ago the vr games are too bad, but now is all different!. I think is the best thing i bought for years, greats views, greats games, its all excelent!. You can play horror games like a phasmophobia with this VR without problems (Only you need to link the oculus to PC to play it)

Christmas gift for my 15 year old son. He was so excited. He set the  system up himself. Easy to use. Make sure you have space to move around. For the $ there should have been at least a couple popular games. It has no micro sd slot so I bought the 256GB. There are a lot of different Apps. Still so much to explore.

If you want to be social without leaving your house, this is the way to go.  With the many apps available,  from games to social connections  to watching TV and movies (yes, Netflix is available on here too!), this is a good investment. 
I would also recommend the adjustable strap and hard shell case to go with it.

For the price, this vr headset is incredible. The native games look great but if you got a vr ready gaming pc, you can literally play steamvr and other pc vr content without the wires and hassle with light houses. The only con is that the stock face interface is really spongey. Go to VR cover and get a replacement.

My son was saving his money to buy this Oculus for a little while. He bought it and loves it. Then he suggested that I try it....big mistake. This is awesome and I want to play every chance that I can. I was playing that boxing game and with in 5 minutes I was poring sweat and great work out. My son and I love it.

The Pros: Wireless, better optics, less nausea.

The Cons: They make you have a facebook account, short battery life, not all games are available on Quest 2 that were available on rift.

I'm glad I bought it but facebook tracking me is bothersome. I also miss Google earth and Discovering space which I had on Rift.

Im actually really impressed with the Oculus Quest 2. Its an incredibly different style of gaming. The headset is comfortable as is, but I highly recommend getting the pro strap. Its a game changer! Charge lasts about 2-2½ hours which is perfect actually. It kinda forces you to take a break. Set-up is super easy!

We love it! It’s a fun system that the whole family can enjoy. There are demos to most games so you can try it before you purchase them. We tried beat saber first and I am addicted to it. I am still trying to figure out how to get it to cast to our TV so we can watch what other people do but it’s fun nonetheless.

This is a great standalone VR gaming system!  Nothing else required…just slip it on, connect to your WiFi, and go!  There’s a great selection of games to play, purchase, and download right to your headset. If you’re questioning if you’re ready for VR, this is the gaming system to try it out on.  You’ll be hooked!

Great product. Fits great. A little adjustment is needed between players yet not hard to do. IDP setting is easy to setup. I’ve really enjoyed the games as well as the movies and other short 360 videos. Well done! If you are prone to motion sickness or are movement sensitive you may want to try sitting down first

Had this for one year in January. Latest update and right controller keeps connecting and reconnecting. Happy coincidence for Oculus it is out of warranty and the update broke my controller. I went on the forum and lots of people are having the same issue after update but Customer Service says they know nothing.

Wish I would’ve gotten one years ago. The games are short but fun, interactive and interesting. I like that I can travel and see concert live despite COVID restrictions. System is lightweight. easy to wear. Sound quality is amazing on the device but I connect my Beats headphones and it feels even more immersive.

This product is worth every penny you've spent on it. VR has improved so much that it almost makes you feel like you are there. One great thing is that when you put it on you can see outside the VR and make your own safty box. Plus when you take it off and come back to it the occulus remembers the spot you made.

My teenage son has asked for one of these since Christmas.  He worked and saved money to put towards this purchase.  We made up the difference.  I had several friends recommend the Oculus.  Not only are the games awesome but my son can take virtual tours using it as part of his homeschool curriculum.  Win!  Win!

Quest 2 has a significantly higher image quality and resolution when compared to the Rift. The wireless feature allows for a massive "free-range" VR game. When using the Quest 2 with the Oculus Link, the user can use PC VR to open the door to games that are only available on PC and are not typically VR capable.

Oculus 2 is amazing! I love the immersion experience it provides. I bought one for my kids I but I loved it so much that I bought one just for myself!
I have a lot of fun with the games and also watching movies and TV shows laying down on my bed. It s very comfortable to watch movies “projected to the ceiling”.

This thing is a definite game changer for me, being a graffiti artist I naturally gravitated to the “King Spray” app and it is so accurate and realistic! I can not get enough of it, I am about to purchase my first shooter game I am extremely excited! Money well spent and I can not suggest it enough, ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

A new experience, for me in gaming platform. really impressed with the graphics.
Outside of the gaming, very interesting interactive programs that I need to explore a bit more.
I do like the ability to connect to my cell phone to receive notifications.
Again, I am still exploring all of what this has to offer.

I cannot recommend this enough! I tried my sister's out for a few days and immediately got one for myself. I mostly use it to workout (which I normally HATE but now absolutely LOVE). But it's also great for playing games, especially multiplayer ones. I'm able to play with friends and family all over the place.

It's fun, but expensive. The battery goes out way too soon so I would suggest buying the headstrap with the battery in it. Also, you need room to move around, not for tiny spaces. If you have problems with visiion, or motion sickness, you might want to pass. It is easy to rack up a bill buying games as you go.

Poor design if you wear glasses,even with the spacer its painful to wear,not enough room constant pressure on your glasses which makes the bridge jam into your nose. No diffence between this and the oculus go. Very poor menu layout unable to move and for it to stay where you want it,mind of its own.  Sensors dont work in the dark. Browser doesn't work on internet vr sites ,there no way to return to the menu screen, have to turn off headset. Nauseous toxic burning  plastic smell  makes you wanna take a break for some fresh air. Straps suck forcing you to buy an upgrade. All the games or apps are costly with most  at $29 $39 dollarsI honestly like the oculus go way better. Facebook in general is a joke with constant issues ,what makes anyone think they would be able produce anything of quality. Put on a oculus go and you'll see and feel how unstable the quest2 is.i find myself getting tired and bored after 15min of use, glad I didn't buy b the extra battery,no way I'd need it.

The build quality is really great.  As a developer, this is on and off of my head hundreds of times a day and it still looks and feels brand new.  Very well built inside and out.  Excellent tracking of both the controllers and hands.

My only complaints of the headset itself are the relatively low resolution of the lenses and the restricted field of view.  It never really has that "Fully Immersed" feel of some other headsets.  However, it runs flawlessly.  Seriously, even though we push (and even break) the limits of what the software can do, we never have any complaints with the headset hardware itself.  

Another negative to keep in mind.  If you aren't familiar with VR setup and navigation, trying to work with Facebook's Landings/home room can be...frustrating (and that's being nice).  Poorly designed by committee is the best description I can think of.  There are tons of work-arounds and sideloads that can fix things but it takes a fair bit of work and expertise to do so.

For a starter VR, this one is fantastic. However, there are just a couple downsides. The eyepiece should a little more adjustable for comfortability and to ensure you can see. Also, the graphical quality when playing more demanding games is not that great, even when the settings are enhanced and using the pc.

Amazing experience.  During pandemic times this has enabled the ability to spend time with distant family members as if they were in the room with me.  Multiplayer with people you know is the way to go.  The power of the device and the clarity of the screen is insane for something that is completely wireless.

This is a really good headset if you want it on the go if you dont have a pc or have one but dont want to use your pc the 256 gb version is good for you but if you want to have a vr and use it for yoir pc games i would recomend the 64 gb verion but either way it is a great gaming console and y9u should get it

I own an HTC Vive and love it but the Oculus Quest 2 is a much better value. Wireless (and the option to use it as a Rift s with a cheap cable) is far superior to HTC in every regard. The resolution is  far better too. The only slight difference is the field of view. The HTC Vive definitely immerses you more.

I purchase the Oculus Quest 2 for my son's birthday! He's been loving it since the first day. It's very easy to set up.

The only reason why I knocked off one star on this item was because you HAVE to use a Facebook account. Not a deal break, but creating an independent account based on email would be better.

Having the Quest 1, I was hoping for a dramatic improvement in visual quality. Yes, there is a higher resolution with the Quest 2, but the OLED optics are so much easier to adjust, and there is a lot less fatigue with the Quest 1. I'll wait and see what firmware can do for the Q2 and maybe take another look.

Love the oculus but we paid 399.00 and when we tried to set it up someone else’s account was already set up on it. Considering we paid more I don’t think we should have gotten someone’s return. We figured out how to reset it back to the original settings hours later, and finally got our account set up to it.

I absolutely love my Oculus Quest 2! It’s so much fun! The only thing that would improve it for me is the battery life. Other than that, it’s easy to use, the graphics are awesome, the game selection is huge! There are so many things to do, places to visit and people to meet! I highly recommend this product!

The Oculus Quest 2 simply put....ROCKS!!!  I used to be a competitive table tennis player when I was younger.  The engine for 11 table tennis is amazing.  I got it because I enjoyed the VR games I tried in Japan and Vegas.  The Oculus Quest 2 is just as good as the VR games we played and paid $45-$75 a turn.

This is my first VR headset and I love it so far! Controller battery life is phenomenal, still at 100% after almost 1 week and the headset has about 3-4 hours of life per charge. I have downloaded about 100 apps and games and that has consumed about 1/3 of the 256gb storage. Absolutely no complaints so far.

The Oculus Quest 2 is a huge let down. The games are very expensive and only give you a couple hours of playtime per game. The battery runs out in 45 minutes. The social platforms (free) are full of sick people (Offensive, Bullying, Abuse of young children). This Metaverse is unsafe! Don't waste your money.

When my rift s was first replaced under warranty I was not sure how well the quest 2 would replace it. I was shocked at how well the wireless pc connection works the screen has a amazing resolution. Great buy and spend the extra $$ for the 256 gb model.

My family already has 30 hours of use on this beast.

Love... love... love this headset!  While not the most graphically advanced, you do get a perfect balance of capability and price.  Pair this with a Gaming computer capable of running high res graphics via a Link cable and a whole new world opens up... one of my best electronic purchases of recent months..

-High resolution compared to what's on the market now
-All in one system don't need a PC to play games
-Surprisingly good tracking no need for external sensors
-Has to option to connect to pc and use SteamVR
If you want to get into VR or even upgrade from gen1 HTC vive or oculus CV1 this is a great choice.

first vr headset and first time using one. unfortunately i dont have another type of vr headset to compare it to but works good although i need to get more use to it. does give me a headache over time of use but slowly getting comfortable with it. nice that you dont need a pc to use it if you dont want to.

My kids love this system. I like how it holds the game in the memory so I can just buy them online and not have to deal with disks. I did get the feeling of motion on the skydiving game but a little dizzy afterwards though. I guess nothing can compare to the actual experience of skydiving but second best.

Whilst the games do seem to be a little limited by the standards of PC and console based games, the VR element remains engaging and absorbing for gamers and the curious alike. Easy and logical set up means the Occulus is quick for both the tech savvy and their parents to be playing in a matter of minutes.

This is such a great, innovative tech device.  I did not know much about VR when I bought it.  I had heard good things and decided to take a chance on it. I was amazed at how real it was when I tried it out and how fun the games were.  The streaming movie media apps are fantastic too.  I love my Oculus 2.

I was in the market to buy a gaming system for the family for Christmas. To be honest, I only purchased this because I couldn't find a Ps5 anywhere.  But, I'm glad I made the purchase because I love it.  this system is much more than I expected.  Lots of games to select from.  Very happy with my purchase.

Very great experience, my son loves it so much I forgot he lives with us. It’s very immersive and quite impressive at how quick you forget your reality. I would recommend limiting play time because it causes dizziness and nausea in some instances. Try rock climbing my husband thought he fell off a cliff.

These things are a bit prone to complete system failure. I've had to return the headset twice and the controllers once. When you return it, they make you send it back first, then sent the replacement, so you lose about three weeks of use.

I use the SuperNatural app every day, or I'd have given up on it.

Really fantastic after playing PSVR for the last 4 years. Zero wires, no computer or console just the headset and 2 controllers. Resolution and clarity is miles ahead of PSVR. I would definitely recommend for a mid range VR experience. Only downside is you have to have it connected to a Facebook account.

Starting at $299 (64GB) no other VR head beat this and it’s a stand alone, no PC require to play, it’s great it even have a refresh rate of 120hz (with update) beating out most other VR double in price. The VR headset also have hand tracking mode where you use your hand to play instead of the controllers

The virtual headset is AMAZING!!  I am a senior citizen and I don’t have an gaming devices and do not need any with virtual entertainment. 

I do not recommend for children under 16 years who are still developing their five senses and if you do get headset for someone young, their time must be monitored.

If you wear glasses this will not fit your face out of the box. Now I need to spend more time and money on prescription lens or something. I feel lied to and cheated. I have a $400 paper weight right now. Totally uncomfortable, small, and just sucks! They should specifically warn the customer about this.

A little disappointed that all the games that I bought for my recently discontinued Rift S require attaching a cable to my PC to use.  They also seem to have a lot of accessories that should've been included in the purchase of the system. Half of it which is really overpriced for what it is nevertheless.

I was trying to get it last year and it was always sold out. I waited and waited to get it and when I did, it was well worth it. I loved it so much I convinced my friend to get one too!! We play Beat Saber everyday. What a fun workout!!! I also have watched Netflix with another friend and we had a blast.

Having owned a VR headset that ran using my phone that I was always disappointed with the resolution, I am so impressed with the new Oculus Quest 2. This device is what VR headsets should be. It's self-reliant and does not need your phone or computer. It's very easy to learn to use and extremely capable.

The headset fits comfortably and hand controllers are easy to grip. Battery life is impressive and unit can still be used when charging. Game selection is quite extensive. Graphics is stunning. It operates as a standalone unit, PC or game console not required, making it quite portable and easy to setup.

This thing is great. It is just like having a portable Rift. The screen door effect is gone. The fact that it can run so many titles on it's on is great and to get AAA titles out of it, you can just link it to your PC. I don't have an issue with the IPD. I know on the rift that I had it set to 64-65. On the Quest 2 I have it set to 2, and the is 63 according to the settings. The only thin I can recommend for it is the better head strap, and adjusting the unit up or down on my face to get the sweet spot. It has a huge library already available, and the fact they are adding in life events is the coolest idea ever. especially in the time we are living in. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to get into VR, or if you just want to upgrade. And I had zero issue setting it up. But I have used the gen 1 Rift. there is a companion app for it, so you do need a phone. But keep in mind you can show others what you are doing in the Quest 2 with it via video stream. So that is pretty handy.

bought two. one for each of my teenage sons. they love them! the facebook thing was almost a deal breaker, but we got them an account and seems to be ok so far. not a big fan of that, but it is what it is. the creed game is their favorite and they have also watched video, etc. and enjoyed them very much

I'm not even a gamer,  but this is the truth. I was always into VR though. 

The headset lenses took about 2 or 3 times for me to get use to. Not sure if my mild astigmatism plays a part in that though.

Great for working out,makes it fun and makes you want to do it.

Only con is it's a bit money hungry

This thing is awesome. I used one at a friends house and knew immediately that I wanted one. This thing is great fun especially when challenging my wife to beat my score in Beat Saber. Having to connect to Facebook isn't ideal but if you can get over that this is a great device to get into the vr world.

Great gaming console. Very easy to use and set up. Wide array of games to choose from. Amazed with how many people complain that it has to be linked to your Facebook account. You put your life’s journal on their for the world to see but don’t want people to know you have an Oculus? Get over yourselves.

My kids love this product. Ages 8-14 and there is something for everyone to enjoy! Keeps them occupied for hours. Their favorite game let's them experience what it's like to have a part-time job in a restaurant - virtual reality providing real-world experience. Best purchase of the 2020 holiday season.

I have bought several Oculus Quest 2s for several of my friends and family members.
So many updates and improvements it's really incredible. I will be buying more! 
So many things to do:
Games
Fitness
Infinite Office (Bluetooth mouse and keyboard make it even better)
Entertainment 
Productivity 
etc...

Christmas gift for my son, and I can't believe how incredible the virtual reality scene has gotten.  He played it everyday at first, but now he divides his time between the oculus and his gaming PC.  I tried it and was super impressed with the refresh rate and the lack of assumed dizziness I would get.

Love this product. This product is definitely great for all ages. I use it for primarily working out, but it is also great to play games like table tennis, bowling, or even to explore. I love the fact that I don't even need to use my phone to enjoy the VR. It is definitely a product II would recommend.

It’s definitely worth the price. The games are great, though I do wish the standalone library was as big as what you can get tethered to a PC. Be careful and pay attention to the guardian haha it can be a painful lesson. Pain aside, it’s a ton of fun … the rest of my family is still waiting their turn.

While the experience is totally immersing and the gaming experience different, the system is still yet in its infancy when it comes to games available for play. 
Highly recommended to purchase the 256Gb as the games fill up fast but again it’s a great experience if you looking for something different.

I have not played around too much with the Oculus Quest 2.  But the space station simulation is cool, disorienting, and takes getting used to.  I assume all games will take getting used to.  I got a tad woozy the 1st time using the Oculus Quest 2.  But after a couple of uses, I think I got used to it.

I got this for my Wife for Christmas, and she loves it.  Be sure to take the training, it helps with working in the environment for the games.  Shortly after getting it - she got COVID, and while she was in isolation, it was Reading, IPAD games, and exploring in VR - and it was very valuable for that.

So far been great.  Have not purchased any games yet.  Just doing free ones and getting used to all the things you can do with the joy sticks.  The granddaughter likes it, but head straps dont go small enough for it to fit & stay on her head.  Had to put her hair in a ponytail & that helps keep it on.

Almost everything you need for solo VR with out a PC BUT!!!!! You might need to get the elite head strap for longer play session and a facebook account which is annoying 
But the biggest problem i have with this is its not really the friendish for people who wear glasses 
Some people may be ok with it

The Oculus is great for the family. Each family member has their own game to play. Most games are about the same price as a Xbox or play station game, even cheaper. It also gets them off the couch to play.  Only con to it , it needs a longer battery charge to play. Usually good for 2 and a half hours.

I’m rating this product a 1 because, now that Facebook owns Oculus, they are forcing you to have a Facebook account instead of allowing you to use an existing Oculus account.  Basically, they are forcing you into their profiling machine.  Since that is the case they should be giving away the hardware.

I bought this for my son for Christmas.  He is havin so much fun with it.  He is playing solo games as well as on teams with other people.  He is also getting lots of exercise, a great work out.  I tried it, thinking this is not my thing and was amazed.  The entire time I was playing it I was in awe.

Requires a Facebook account !! Not for those who dislike social media, especially Facebook. With so much damaged to society caused by FB, those of us who object cannot add to their stream of income. Seems like a great product otherwise. I didn't go beyond reading the FB account requirement to return.

This piece of kit is just incredible quality for the price, i've had so much fun playing in VR and have had absolutely no issues with it! Considering the amount of investment that usually goes into a gaming pc and then a vr headset, the fact you get such quality in a standalone VR headset is amazing.

This is my first experience with VR. I have really enjoyed the whole experience. The headset is very comfortable and the controls are very comfortable as well. First few times I got a little motion sickness. But the more you play the less you feel it. I am am completely happy with the oculus quest 2.

Most amazing entertainment you can buy. I can travel all over the world and sight see countries and museums.  I can go on roller coasters go in haunted  houses. I love going to concerts because you are on stage with the band. Your not only playing  games but you are in the game. So worth every penny.

Incredible value. Great games and library is growing fast. It’s awesome to play and have the full vr experience that is portable and can be used anywhere. And if you’re looking for more powerful gaming you can play pc games when plugged into a laptop or even wirelessly. Very affordable and addictive.

My grandson asked for the oculus for Christmas and at first I thought it was the worst thing ever! He would bump into walls and wouldn’t get off. But when I finally used it to see what’s the big deal, LOL I showed him to set up perimeters which avoid accidents and bumping into walls and it’s awesome!

For a First time VR user & owner I am very impressed with this headset. I absolutely love it and would totally recommend it to anyone looking for a first time headset. it is even comfortable for anyone who wears glasses like I do I have not had a problem at all with wearing my glasses in the headset.

At first I thought this was too pricey, but my son used it all the time and loves it. He can play with friends on line that he can no longer see due to distance learning.  He can cast the screen to our tv so I can see the live action as well. Well worth the price. It is a heck of a work out as well.

I really wanted to love this product, but I can't seem to get a clear picture.  It's cloudy and blurry outside your direct line of sight. I bought the oculus fit package which includes a spacer for glasses and various faceplate widths.  Nothing I've tried has improved clarity.  Returning for refund.

I bought this for my son for Xmas this year.  What he told me he likes is that it's "backwards compatible" with older Oculus software.  Which is great until new Quest software becomes available.  It's easy to use and very comfortable.  But be advised it can seem a bit heavy until you get used to it.

I bought oculus and delivery man calls me that there is no parking outside so he decides to return it and now the option to pick it up or have it re-delivered was taken from me and it's been going on 3 wks and I am still waiting for my refund so I can re-purchase item, terrible business on this sale

I wish I could review this item but I haven't received it yet. Ordered it the beginning of December and it was to be delivered by the 12th. The latest tracking update is from the 19th and it appears to be in Jacksonville, FL since then. Very disappointed as this was a Christmas gift for my daughter.

The Oculus Quest 2 provides an exciting new world of immersion. My whole family has loved the 360 degree nature and rollercoaster videos. A better strap is a good idea, such as Oculus 2 Elite Strap. They are far more adjustable. My only issue is that I might like finer control over the lens spacing.

I bought this for my daughter for her birthday and she loves it! I play it too, probably more than her lol. It’s cool but it needs more games. Or at least let you preview the games before spending $35-50 on one game. And i don’t like the fact that she had to create a Facebook account just to use it.

Everything they said it was.  Love the virtual reality quality.  Only con is the battery last about two hours.  Bought the link cable which allows charging as you play.  At 67 years old i am shocked at how much i enjoy it.  Even watching 3d movies that are from the past and present is an experience.

I have been a mid level gamer and tech nerd for about 20 years. I had held off on VR stuff until I tried the oculus quest 2. This little unit blew me away. The format is great,  the apps are mostly well received,  and  the motion tracking is excellent.  The only negative is it is owned by Facebook.

Incredible experience, entertaining and active! Very clear image quality, Price point is spot on.
Great game selection (with the proper USB cable play any Steam VR game).

Cons:
Head strap is not very tight or it will "sag" on your face or fall off back of head (so you really want the Elite strap).

Lot of fun, graphics are great.  Its nice to chromcast it to the TV so others can see you play and share in the fun.  The virutal reality really pulls you in on some of the games.  I've almost dropped the controllers a couple times when I reach out to set them down on the "virtual" table top, Oops!

The Oculus Quest 2 was originally a gift for my 9 year old to get him moving and in better shape.  Now my wife and I probably use it as much as he does and have a great time getting an amazing sweat.  Our favorite game right now is Creed 2 but we look forward to exploring this unique digital world.

I have anticipated owning a VR system for years but held off due to price. This unit is extremely inexpensive for what you get. I would have easily spent the price of the unit on the first game I played it was so much fun and so amazing. Well worth the money if you have ever been curious about VR.

It's a great system. Very easy to use and setup. Only drawback is the Facebook requirement but I think they are changing that. You can essentially do anything you'd do on a phone but also play amazing VR games and find easy access to a lot of exciting VR content like concerts and videos. Very fun!

Oculus quest 2 is a great buy from best buy.  I walked in with my daughter and we walked out in a few minutes with the 256 gb model in our hands.  I also bought the upgraded adjustable strap and it was well worth the money.  We have had it for a few weeks now and our whole family loves playing it.

The oculus rift 2 is a great step in creating technology. If interested in be, this is hands down the best vr headset money can buy. The experience is like no other. I recommend everyone to try brunch at lest once in your life to experience something different from the everyday experience of life.

Great Headset.  I've used the original quest and the vive and this is better than both!  Coming from those two I will miss the black levels but I've adjusted and must say the new higher res screen is worth the tradeoffs!  I even like the new strap although I think I'm in the minority on that one.

There’s a difference between playing video games and playing IN a video game.  I had dinner at a friends and they introduced me to their Oculus Quest 1st generation.  What an experience!  So I absolutely had to get the Oculus Quest 2.  I’ve been playing video games since PONG was considered cutting-edge, and I’ve played almost all of the the consoles from then to now and while the games get shinier and shinier, it’s been the same experience, sitting in front of the t.v. with a controller mashing away.  I’ve been wanting more from gaming for years and the OQ2 gives me what I’ve been wanting.  Playing in the games with the OQ2, (and I do mean IN, you are IN the games, or should I say immersed), gets you off the couch and moving and it’s so much fun.  The graphics are terrific and the experience is beyond any gaming on any console. No wires needed!  

I highly recommend upgrading from the stock head-strap to the HTC Deluxe Audio Strap.  The DAS increases comfort and adds built-in headphones.

Super awesome, did not think we would need to get the 256gb, but after doing some research the 256gb is perfect, since you will find yourself downloading many demos and games. There are some cool affordable games from 5.00 -10.00  and then you have your top quality games 29.99 and up. Super fun !

Purchased this as an upgrade from the first Quest and you can immediately tell the difference: it’s smaller, lighter, and feels higher quality. This is an improvement on something I thought was already great. Excited for RE4, and am enjoying the wireless PC streaming (which is coming to Quest 1)

I got to admit I didn't know much about this product got it as a gift for my daughter.  After playing along side her I can see why she wanted them.  Great immersive play and top of the line graphics.
Good audio and controllers are easy to use to jp in to the action after  few minutes of tutorial

This this is AWESOME!! Yes, it is $399 but, the games are very well priced and there is something for everyone. I started working out with this and I have never had more fun sweating! You can shoot, fly, go fishing. WE LOVE IT! Going to get another one so I don’t have to share with my husband :)

I'm a "little older" but a newbie to the VR world.  Those young kids now days would call me a Boomer  :)  But, that doesn't mean I can't appreciate really cool stuff.  I've been waiting to buy into the Oculus world for a couple years because I didn't think it was quite mature enough.  However, with the Quest 2, I felt the time had come.  I will never get into the high end action games that are being introduced for the VR world, but even the simple, free media that comes bundled with the headset is cool.  iMax theaters will no longer be needed with the filming that is being adapted to the VR headset world

Just make sure you have decent internet service as the file downloads are large.  20mbps download speeds are what I consider a minimum as the files are quite large.  However, once you get the downloads completed and they then reside on the headset, it's no longer a concern.

I'm very satisfied with my purchase and look forward to the limited time I get to spend exploring the new VR world.

I will be returning this.
It requires a Facebook account to work and that is unacceptable as it was not stated clearly in the advertising.  I am terribly disappointed as other VR headsets are not so encumbered by this miserable tie in.  Best Buy should review its deceptive advertising practices.

This has been so much fun. We got this for Christmas. The games have been great but be careful if you get motion sickness easily. A few minutes in the wrong game knocked me off my feet for an entire day. Also be sure to get the elite head strap it’s rough on hair, and a bit of a pain to adjust.

For an at-home VR experience, it's an overall fun time and the great graphics. If this is for a younger/little kid, keep in mind that it will be loose, even on its smallest adjustment. If you have eye problems or wear glasses, it might be uncomfortable after some time so also keep that in mind.

Great VR experience but you need to know that you will be spending extra money to get the software to play and it can  be pricy. However, it is easy to use and lots of fun. I found that it was worth the upgrading to the better quality head strap and the better quality foam around the face part.

Such a great product! I bought this, wanting to get into VR but being unsure at first. But once it got here, I loved using it. Its super fun and many games to play on it. You're even able to link it up to your PC to play games from there (with some setup). But this headset offers the convivence of straight out of the box and play feeling. There are no wires or cables needed while playing, only when you need to charge it.

Some of my only concerns with this is that you do need a bit of setting up if you would like to play Steam games on here, more so if you plan to do it wirelessly and stream them to the headset. You need to purchase another application to do so.

You do also need a Facebook account to buy and play games from the store, since Oculus is owned by Facebook. I created a separate account just to use the Oculus for, so you can do that if you'd like.

It is a very neat product and already as some great applications and games you can use with it, along with many more coming out soon.

Easy to set up. The VR is very crisp. The sound is very good. Overall I will recommend it. Connecting the device to my phone is a little bit slow during casting. I needed to get the bigger memory and its worth it for longer use. I can download games and apps. Some were free from the app store.

In the back of my mind, being completely oblivious to todays RV world, I assumed we were years away from an enjoyable VR experience, because of this, I waited to buy one of things.  Until now.  Let me say, this device really blew my mind!  The Ease of use made it fun from the start.  And the virtual environment..breathtaking!  It really is an experience that’s better experienced than explained.  I watched an animated roller coaster and let me tell you, even if you’ve never been on a roller coaster before, the ability to look all around you, below you, the immersion itself will make you feel like you’re in the coaster seat!  It does this so well, you’ll feel the anxiety and thrills of the ride.  If your on the fence about getting one, I urge you to try it out.  The worlds and environments are so beautiful and real, and you go anywhere.  Aside from gaming, there are meditation apps, workout apps, and other vividly awesome ways to interact with friends and family.  Pretty fantastic product. A++

I had the original Quest and loved it.  It took a little while to get used to the new design of the controllers and head strap, but I am enjoying the new one.  My only complaint is that charging cable that comes with the Quest 2 is so much shorter and doesn't allow you to charge while playing.

Oculus Quest 2 is quite amazing... My 12 year old and I love this. True that you want to stagger your use as it can be intense, but the ability to experience a 360 degree reality as you watch videos of amazing experiences around the world, games and also dabble in the metaverse is super cool!!

A great VR headset for the value. Made better with additional accessories such as a carrying case if you are on the go and replacement face gasket and/or head strap for long term play sessions. Very fun and capable of playing the available games with decent performance for a standalone device.

Great fun, fully immersive experience. I absolutely love it. I ruminated for over a year whether I would be buying one or not. I am totally happy with my decision. Everything from the games that are available to the fully immersive videos and films that one can step into. I absolutely love it.

I gave it 4 stars because they are a bit too heavy and even when you adjusted still presses on your nose alot. The fact that you have to have a facebook account it's not such a great idea. Some games are pay monthly and I have a gamjng computer and it still lags a little. 
 Overall I love it.

Very cool experience. Our kids love it. We did notice that two out of four family members are sensitive to the foam that touches the face. We broke out in Oculus face (red, itchy skin) I ordered the faux leather face shield for us, but this cost additional fees. This part has not arrived yet.

Excellent VR headset.    Honestly the ease of use is probably the best thing about this headset, you can use it "virtually" anywhere you want to, and it will set it's boundaries to the space you are in.   Large gaming library and the option to connect directly to a PC to play even more games.

This was a great purchase. All six of us have played it so far and love it. There's many games to choose from. We also purchased the cord to connect it to our computer to play even more games.

One con is the strap is not comfortable. I plan on purchasing a different strap to see it's better.

The Oculus is a great way to escape while on lockdown.  If you have parents like my mum who happen to be going nuts with the lockdown, sending them on a virtual trip has been amazing.  She went from a 72yo grandma to a kid within minutes.  These should be used more often for this very reason.

Great VR set. Impressive quality for the price. I got this for my kids and although I admit they don't put it on as much as I thought they wound but that is just because their interests keep changing to other things. But I still love it, and it still delivers amazing 3D graphics and content.

Great upgrade from the oculus quest 1. The headset is lighter and the graphics are better. The material used to make this one is not as premium as the first quest but I don’t mind that if it makes it not as heavy on the face. My only gripe is the head strap could have been more user friendly

Great new toy!  Truly did not understand the VR world and if this is a glimpse of that then I’m all in!!  Definitely recommend getting the elite strap though as the head strap that comes with it is a “challenge”.  It works, but nothing compared to the strap that “cups” the back of your head.

From fun workouts that feel more like games to watching immersive videos on youtube! This is the best system purchase I ever made!I go from playing live poker with real people, to surviving zombie hordes , then to getting a great boxing workout that is actually fun! Everyone should get this!

Bought this for my daughter for Christmas. She is loving it. All the apps and things you can do with it is amazing.

I would highly recommend purchasing the 256GB version as games/apps can take up space quickly. I would also recommend purchasing the elite strap with the additional batteries.

This is really an amazing device. You do need to set it up for your room so that you can see the boundaries. It does require a Facebook account which could be a downside for some people. There are a variety of apps that could be suitable for a variety of ages, ability levels, and interests.

WOW, what a remarkable device. Battery life is not so great however that may be a good thing seeing how you can easily get motion sickness. I Highly recommend playing in a space with plenty of room. The Walking Dead game is super fun and the Thrill of the fight will absolutely wear you out.

Works very well, can be used wired to computer (can then play other library of games) or wireless, games are very well displayed and very fun.  Also, what player sees can also be displayed on their phone for others to watch (not pc).  After getting one, soon will have one for entire family.

Technology keeps getting better.  Christmas gift for 10 yr old. but so much fun for the entire family. the hand remotes come with wrist string so they wont come flying out of your hands. the headset is a bit heavy but nothing that can injure your neck. downloads are easy, as well as set up.

Fantastic. Yes there's some issues, but nothing I'm too bothered by. 
Warning If you're cross eyed you'll want to do some eye training. 
Facebook account is required. But, with any console you have to have an account with their store so I honestly do not understand what the problem is here.

These are fun! If your looking for exercise there are lots of options, i have only played Poker amd boxing really. The boxing absolutely wears me out! The poker is fun as well, you can sit down and play for hours. I later bought the different adjustable head strap, you definitely want that!

Phenomenal gaming device. I normally play Xbox or PS4, but this has me hooked for hours. Definitely a purchase you won't regret unless your a heavy duty gamer. For family gaming, this is great. Just make sure you buy the $50 headset upgrade so the gaming experience will be 100 times better.

I owned an oculus rift before and hated how it was connected to cables. This opened up a new way to play for me and a lot easier to relax. You have to plan ahead and have it charged but still an amazing piece of hardware. Love watching movies and playing pokerstars and beat saber on it. A+

I had the AirPod Pro and they were falling a lot. Got the Bosé Quietcomfort and they fit perfect perfect. I am no longer concern they will fall Will doing exercise. They are easy to use, and the sound and the noice cancelling is perfect.  
Great buy no regrets like usual with Bose products

First VR setup. Even better than I expected! I was waiting for one that you didn’t need to have it tethered to a computer and it works surprisingly well. The immersion is complete and there is so much content available to watch on places like YouTube. Great fun for exercise, time flies by.

Slightly better tracking than a standard WMR headset is a plus. Boundary system is awesome as well. Controller battery life is amazing(still half battery and average 1.5hrs a day! ). Only negative is if you use it with the link cable you might have random disconnects which are frustrating.

Best value for money VR set on the market! I would recommend spending the extra $100 for more storage. Graphics and tracking will blow you away. The build quality is excellent and the head is comfy to wear. Best of all, having no wires enhances the vr to the next level. Highly recommended!

Enjoying it so far. Totally worth the money. Been playing beat saber on it and it is a good work out if you put some movement into it.
I was against playing VR at first mind you. I’m pretty stubborn at change, but I’m really glad I was convinced to buy this. Again, totally worth the money.

Overall we have enjoyed it! We wish there were more games for the VR though. The strap can be a bit annoying but once you get it situated, it’s fine (unless you share it within friends/family). It does sucks you have to have a Facebook account to use. But all in all good purchase to enjoy!

Went to the store and Bought the Oculus set, estimated a week to pick up this item but they just cancelled it without any notice. Got my money back but it was an awful experience. It supposed to be a christmas gift for my 10 year old son. I’m not buying here again. Went to Amazon instead.

I purchased this to be more active and since I have been using this I have to say that I am impressed. Not only am I more active but this is fun. Setting this up was pretty much a breeze but it also fun, Just have to learn the basics and take your time. I would recommend this to anyone...

Too amazing! In fact, it's actually bad that it's so amazing and versatile, as nothing else is remotely as good. I don't like Monopolies, but it's going to be very hard for any other company to make a VR headset as useful and amazing as this headset. It's a 100 miles ahead or anyone else.

Purchased this for my 12 year old son and have tried it myself recently. It is amazing how far VR has come and I look forward to seeing all the possibilities the oculus 2 will offer in the future.  I would recommend this product to anyone looking to jump into the world of virtual reality.

Pretty amazing graphics!  Would have given 5 stars but was blurry for some members in family that do not wear glasses.  We tried using the 3 different settings but wouldn’t quite focus for them. Would be nice if there was a sliding aduster on outside of headset just like with binoculars.

Very easy to set and provides hours of fun. Out of all the VR units I've used, this by far had the best value for price paid. 
You can tell that this was set up to have the user's interest and ease of use in mind. The only drawback is that you need a Facebook account to fully utilize it.

I purchased the Oculus Quest 2 Headset for my birthday.  I'm a scuba diver and haven't been able to go diving during this COVID pandemic.  The underwater 3D videos are not the same as actually being underwater, but it's the next best thing.  The Start First 3D video show you how to use the controllers and has some fun interactive features (throwing paper airplanes, stacking cubes, flying an airship, dancing with a 3D animated character and a spaceage shooting gallery).  You can upload your videos and pictures to the Oculus Quest 2, however it doesn't turn them into 3D versions, but it does show them on a large screen.  You can access your Facebook account and there are lots of 3D Youtube videos that are very realistic. I haven't purchased or tried any interactive games with other people, but there are so many amazing 3D locations like Angel Falls in Venezuela, flying with the Navy Blue Angels, diving with Manta Rays and so much more, that playing interactive games online is not a priority of mine.

This thing is awesome!!!!  I've been waiting for this technology to mature and it finally has.  My family uses this thing until the battery dies and then charges it up and uses it again. Great family entertainment especially if you cast it to a TV so others can watch what you're playing.

As an original Oculus Quest owner, I wasn't sure if I needed to upgrade to the Quest 2.  In the end, I'm glad I did:

1)  The video quality sharper
2)  The motion is smoother
3)  The headset is indeed lighter

Using the Oculus Quest 2 for wireless VR experiences is simply fantastic.  However there are a few things that annoyed me:

1)  The all-white surfaces show the dirtiness faster
2)  The controllers feel like the grips are slightly smaller
3)  I'm not a fan of the new head strap.  I opted for a 3rd party adjustable head strap system and the headset is now much more comfortable.

The biggest disappointment with the OQ2 is the dark levels.  It's not something that's really noticeable in bright games and experiences, but if you use the OQ2 to watch videos and movies in a VR theater, etc., you're going to notice it.  It's actually pretty bad in my opinion - and there doesn't appear to be much you can do to mitigate the problem.

If you don't do much VR movie watching, it probably won't bother you.

It’s amazing the experience you get with this without it needing to be connected to the computer. My only issue and the reason I give 4 instead of 5 stars is that your vr Purchases on the headset don’t transfer over to the pc. That’s kinda annoying. If they fixed that, 5 stars no problem

It has taken me to a whole different world, and with all the Covid restrictions this has been a blessing. Works awesome with my IRacing, love the feeling of being inside the car. So glad I made this purchase. Even got my brother hooked and he bought 2 for his family. Awesome product!!!!!

Well worth the money spent .. the fact that I don’t need a console was that part that got me ... I love the system I wish the battery last longer but hey you need a break from it ... I have played games watched tv shows and all with this game .. only wish I can find bass pro fishing lol

I love the Oculus. My kids and I play it everyday. My favorite game is actually Audio Trip! If you are wanting to get into VR I would recommend the Oculus Quest 2. Don't have to worry about being tethered and you can create the space you want to play in for moving or sitting. I love it!
