I love the oculus quest 2. I have the original quest and this is basically same.
 I do wish they had kept the lens adjusters style the same. The original slider style was much nicer then the new click style. But the Quest 2 is definitely a great purchase!

Child was very excited to receive this tech for Christmas.  Only complaint was the pickup process.  The people bringing out the products should place items in bags especially around Christmas time as not to ruin the surprise if the recipient is in the car

Ten times better than the original oculus. The original oculus used to make me get motion sickness I don’t get it with this version and being cordless feels so nice. It also feel lighter than the older model on my head. Picture quality is way better too.

can’t say enough about this VR HEAD SET I ORIGINALLY BOUGHT IT FOR MY CHIKD but honestly I think I am having more fun then my son so many exciting games and on the plus side the games that we purchased give me a great work out! 
I definitely recommend it

A awesome headset for anyone starting their VR adventure! The wireless experience immerses you into your virtual worlds perfectly, and the optional oculus link feature means almost any VR experience is in your grasp. And it's a total steal for only $300.

Wow. 

This stuff is getting out of hand. I have 4 kids, they all love this. My wife and i also occasionally play some beat saber as well. Not gimmicky at all, and it’s super immersive. 

Best part is, you can cast out to your TV and everybody can enjoy.

This VR is excellent....very comfortable and fun.  I would definitely recommend it although it is pricy.  There is something for all ages.  Does not have the longest battery life and it froze a couple of times, but I think that is pretty normal with VRs.

We purchased this game system for our family Christmas gift. We all have enjoyed playing this system. It's like no other game system we have ever owned. Our ages are teenagers - mid 50's & we all are having a blast with the oculous quest 2. It's amazing!

Oculus Quest 2 is a really good starter VR headset. Great Product for a Great Price. You can turn it like a Oculus Rift S via Oculus Link with a USB-A (3.0/Blue) to USB-C cable. I would have given it a 5/5 but the VR requires a Facebook Account to login.

Awesome virtual reality with games, tv, videos and movies. This is a purely entertaining device here. Online with people from everywhere. The oculus 2’s clarity has greatly improved. 100% fun and addictive. Several great titles and more promised to come.

I love this headset. Had the Vive for way more cost and this is amazing for the price too! Portable and get the bigger space because you can download games and go anywhere or photos and movies and take with you. Even the baby wears it in her car seat :)

It's a cool gadget. However, my kid cannot play this for more than an hour because the front side is too heavy due to the battery. I purchased the elite strap ($49+tax) that makes the situation slightly better but not that much. This is a serious issue!

This is a great graphics upgrade from the original Quest headset.  The only reason I give it 4 stars is the head strap and face mask (padding that contacts your face).  The strap requires constant readjustment, and the face mask is not glasses friendly.

Worth the price. It is a pricey item. Which to me I see it as a luxury good. But I knew that this is something I wanted to play and use. If you are a gamer and into rhythm or just immersive games I highly recommend. First make sure you do your research.

This product is so family friendly, even my special needs son enjoys it. Myself could not use PS4's VR but this, NO PROBLEM, no motion sickness, its phenomenal!  People complain about the battery having a 2 hour in use but its a great limit of playtime.

My Son loves this. It's his first VR headset but it fits hem and the games are not that expensive. One drawback is you need a Facebook account so if it's for your kids you have to figure out for yourself how to handle that. overall its a really good buy

From a value standpoint, as an All-In-One it's a good value. Out of box comfort support for wide faces beware. Within minutes of using it the tops of my cheekbones ached. I ended up buying aftermarket accessories to make it comfortable for my wide face.

Birthday present for my grandson.  Family member pitched in to purchase it.  Not only is my grandson enjoying it but other members are asking to play with it.  My husband, 66-year old grandpa, plays gulf with it.  Santa is getting him one for Christmas.

I got this for my bf for Christmas and he loves it! Yes only downside is you have to connect Facebook for it but that’s why you can just make one specifically for the oculus if you don’t want to link your “personal” one. I love playing Beat Saber on it.

The best thing to take you away for a while and still keeping safe at home. This is the third Oculus that we have bought since the pandemic. Truly amazing experiences for the whole family. One of the best entertainment purchases that we have ever made.

Oh my. I can't express how good this is. Purchase as a family gift and it was a hit. It was worth every penny. Very easy, but note you need chromecast in order for everyone to view it on TV.  Was very disappointed. Games are very reasonable in pricing.

Can't stop playing VR. I have been playing games for the past month with no problems. Everything runs smoothly. Only critique would be the change from wireless to wired. For whatever reason it is hard to change from the oculus lobby to the steam lobby.

Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel! Spidonkel!

I love this! I sold my original Rift set so I can get this. I like the portability, and the fact that I don't have to worry about tripping over cables.

Also, if I wanted to play my old Rift games, I can! All I have to do is connect it to my gaming PC.

Love the new stand alone VR. Fits comfortable, nice adjusting for all types of eyes and included glasses frame. Only downfall is the battery doesn't last more than a few hours typical run time for me is about 3ish hours but still is worth the purchase.

This device was bought for my son he absolutely loves it it’s a very fun item especially during COVID times when you can’t go anywhere you can see videos such as skydiving under sea in really high quality as well as game. Excellent device for the price

This was a gory we bought for my daughter for Christmas. As we all know with Covid it is hard for kids to get together. This gaming system my daughter absolutely loves! She plays with others in chat and has been making some friends. So worth the price!

Purchased this product for my grandsons for Christmas. They seem happy with it - only complaint I have heard is that it was a little difficult to use the hand controllers at first because they are evidently different from those  for the Original Quest

Bought as a gift for my wife for the holiday and it was well received.  I was actually pleasantly surprised that other relatives and my neighbors also received similar gifts and were all soon participating in beat saber tournaments! Awesome purchase!!

I Love this VR head set. One of the best gaming systems to get you off the couch and Active. Battery Life could be a bit longer, I get roughly 2 to 2 and a half hours of gaming in before it needs to recharge. But I suppose that’s a good break from VR.

Could quest 2, I upgraded my version one to this model… graphics and cpu much stronger.. however, strap is cheap and does not work well, I upgraded to elite strap 2 with battery. IPD is only 3 selection vs original you could dial in a specific number.

It’s on another level of fun ! Kids are enjoying this so much , they don’t even miss the places we used to go to for fun before Covid-19. This product is so entertaining. You have to buy the games but they’re much cheaper than games for the consoles .

After trying out my brother’s  Oculus I had to get one for me and my family! It’s very much worth the price. The only reason I am giving it 4 stars and not 5 is because I feel like the power drains too quickly. But if you are thinking about it, do it!

Fun fun all the family is loving this. real life like experience so much i got motion sickness from the roller coaster lol now that wasn't so much fun  i would recommend this but it was pricey with putting warranty on it but i think warranty is needed

It was an easy process to set up but you have to have Facebook to use. You can purchase games when viewing the Oculus and you can also purchase games at the Oculus site. My family enjoy a good four hours of play time before it has to be charged again.

The Quest 2 delivers on all promises and more! It is the easiest straight out of the box VR experience available. You can set up just about anywhere and it is highly accessible to anyone. If you are interested in VR, this is hands down the way to go.

Its a great upgrade from the Oculus Quest 1.
My oldest son has a wide IPD and has issues using this headset.

I dont know how I feel about being tied to Facebook for the AppStore.  But the Oculus Link works great, allowing you to play pc/steam games.

My husband and kiddos love it it really makes you feel like you in another world for some it can possibly make you feel sick on some games depending on person but it’s a really cool game they play it almost daily since we got it for our sons birthday

I was skeptical about spending this much for a limited amount of pricey games. My kid enjoyed it for the first few weeks. I put it on and have to say that the system is pretty amazing, and really cool to see what it can do. It has a lot of potential.

This headset is such a step above the original Oculus.  It fits so much more comfortably and the hand controls are also a big improvement.  My teenager practically lives on his Oculus Quest 2 and the price was much more affordable than the original!

It's kind of annoying that you have to tie it to your FB account, but that's just life.  It's fun and better quality than I thought it would be.  The games can be affordable when they go on sale, which is not super rare, so I'd recommend it overall.

Great product tracking of hand movement is amazing! Only thing I don't like is the head strap it pulls it slightly back and blurrs my view have to readjust. I ordered the elite strap hopefully it will fix that.  Other than that it's a great product!

Exciting Family fun. Recommend buying the extended battery with better fitting headset. We bought 2 set ups so family could compete against each other in multiplayer games. Would be better not to have to have a Facebook account but it is what it is.

I’ve never tried anything like this before, but so surprised that I’m really enjoying it. I enjoy the adventurous part of it, and that as a player, I am not simply sitting. I like that I get a level of exercise while participating in the activities.

I haven’t received the Oculus, so therefore I don’t want to rate it.  At this point, my husband wants a refund but, I’m being very patient knowing it’ll be here soon. Because I got this for him as a birthday gift.  He went from being excited to not.

First vr headset I bought and i do not regret it. I highly recommend it anyone looking for a vr experience. Also go with the $400 one, because you’ll start downloading games and apps and before you know it that 64gb storage will fill up really fast.

I'm really enjoying this thing. i have the psvr too. i really like the no wires part and there is a lot of free stuff. be sure to go to sidequestvr.com. if no other reason, except to play serious sam, duke nukem 3d, doom3 in VR. bad.......only 256gb

The Quest 2 has been an amazing experience! The family loves it. It’s great entertainment when the family gets together. There are plenty of games and products to purchase. I highly recommend this product and can’t wait to see what the future holds.

This by far exceeds my expectations!! At first I thought, how can this be realistic and feel like I am truly immersed. You really do feel like you are in the game and no matter the game, you also get a nice sweat going. I would definitely recommend.

This seems ok.  However, just not sure if it something I would want to play too much or allow the kids to play too much.  Myself and my wife felt dizzy when playing too much.  I think thee will get better over the next several years with technology.

It’s an absolute blast. We enjoyed it so much that I bought a second one so we could have some multiplayer gaming in the house as well. There’s free apps you can download as well as paid games and every single one we’ve played so far, we’ve enjoyed.

Had zero desire to get one until my cousin was saying how great they are. She was right. Table Tennis and Synth Riders are worth it alone. I wish games could be shared within a family so multiple quests would make sense, but that's my only complaint

Love it one of my best purchases this year 
If my Apple Watch wasn’t used consistently oculus quest 2 would be my favorite electronic I have purchased from Best Buy I highly recommend being able to play vr without wires also got it for a great deal

This is definitely an improvement from the first model. It’s not perfect but improved in many ways. I do recommend the elite battery head strap. The included one worked fine for me but the other definitely helps balance the weight and adds comfort.

Great experience. Euphoric. Highly recommend it. Explore the world at home.

Purchased this product about theee months ago. Has been amazing. Just recently turned in my headset and the back light is on with oculus logo but the screen remains black.

It’s an amazing machine worth every penny if your ok with Facebook and keep a look out for vr covers and if you have a rebuff reality power pack it will work on og strap that came with it and i fits the elite strap also the elite strap with battery

I bout the Oculuc - Quest 2 for my kids as a chrismas present and they love it. We also got the cord so we could hook it up to the computer. found out your computer needs a type c port to hook it up. but every thing els works great. Setup was easy.

This VR headset is really fun to play. It's crazy how much gaming has progressed over the years, and these really are an entirely new experience as far as how you interact with the game/environment. Definitely well worth the price for what you get.

I havent played with a VR that impressed me as much as this one. I downloaded beat saber and vader immortal immediately and they both work flawlessly and are so much fun to play. I would recommend this to anyone who doesn't get motion sickness haha

I'm not really a gamer but I bought this after trying one a family member had . I had to have it and it is awesome! It feels like your flying, shooting, jumping or just visiting sites around the world.  A must have in these trying times. I live it!

Oculus Quest 2 is easy to use out of the box and offers a high quality VR experience without the support of a laptop device.  There is an abundance of info on line.   It can be used for exercise or to experience future  or past travel destinations.

I ordered this during the Black Friday special. It’s going under the tree so I won’t be trying it out until then. Best Buy still hasn’t sent the 70 gift card that goes along with the purchase.. so for that oversight..I’d give the company one star.

Oh My Gosh, I love my  Oculus - Quest 2 Advanced All in One Virtual Reality Headset - 256GB.  I will admit that I looked on the website many times at this product. I'm so happy that I finally purchased.  This is an Awesome item with a capital "A".

I love the product. The games are awesome. You definitely get what you pay for. My only complaint and the reason I rate it 4 stars is the lenses fogging up when I’m playing a game. Other than the foggy lenses I absolutely love playing the Quest 2.

I’m enjoying the Quest 2. It’s a very immersive and fun experience. I really like the experiences in YouTube VR. It takes some getting used to but it’s a lot of fun. It took a while to find a comfortable way to wear it but once I did it was great.

The quest 2 is a good headset. I purchased this along with the official cable. The picture quality is amazing compared to psvr. But the thing won't charge while linked to pc. So it kind of sucks always needing to charge it on a standalone charger.

The games are $40,$30,$20 this is a money pit even the free games are not really free. Plus face book control everything. I returned it for those reasons and the games are old and this unit is over a year old and they still want over $400 for it .

Before owning an oculus i hadn’t been a gamer since the Wii came out…. But now I play video games five days a week. This thing is so much fun! The quality of the video is not even close to a PS5 but I’m not a hard-core gamer so I’m fine with that.

Head set is doing good so far but I had to get in touch with oculus support because the foam of the headset gives me a severe allergic reaction so I'm waiting on a replacement for that. I play it here and there until I receive my replacement foam

It is like no other game I have played,
The graphics are amazing, has a couple free games but you have to pay for most of them, only down side the usb cable with that came with it stopped working after 20 days , so make sure you get that warranty

Love this VR headset, currently best in the market especially for it's price point.

So many people who weren't into VR before have started picking this beauty up.

Anyways I do VR Content on youtube, so don't forget to check it out

Coffee n' VR

I have watched videos on yt and all and thought this looks pretty good and wanted to get one. Money well spent yt does it no justice omg when I tell you I'm in there I mean it it feels like your in what ever world or game you are playing. Superb!

Bought this for my husband. I'm just getting started with VR. I got the hang of the controllers much faster than I expected and really love it. My husband has been playing this daily and I love watching him. I want to get a second one for myself.

First experience with gaming VR and my mind was blown. Very comfortable and ready to use right out the box. Love that it’s a stand alone system and does need to be plugged into a PC or console. Game prices aren’t that bad especially when on sale.

My son got this for his online gaming. He loves it. The games are NOT free for the most part - there are some free ones and some demos available.  I do not recommend this if you get motion sickness.  Some of the games are super cool and realistic

First VR headset I’ve owned. Inspired by Pat McAfee, I’ve played Thrill of The Fight and Eleven (ping pong). Both are amazing games and boxing can be quite the workout! Highly recommend checking VR out if it’s something you’ve never done before.

So much fun, my wife and I love it.  We have spent a decent amount on games but we are having fun watching each other.  I really like the Star Wars games and she is enjoying the Roller Coasters and we both love Beat Saber.  We really enjoy this.

This item was expensive as is everything obtaining to it! It no longer even is operable already! Occulus support told us its likely it was damaged in shipment! Now it's gotta be replaced! Rediculous item should have been better packaged to ship.

Tried VR out with this oculus unit finally and liked it a lot better than PS VR that I played with a long time  ago. This is also a standalone unit and not the ones you need to connect with a pc. I look forward to playing a lot more with it soon

Best VR headset for 99% of people (256gb version recommended if you have lots of apps). Wireless tracking, link-cable support, wifi-link support, good optics, good tracking.

Biggest downside is needing a Facebook account and phone app to setup.

System is decent. We opted for larger memory storage, however even then the memory filled extremely fast. Would be nice to have more memory or place for memory stick at the very least. Head band doesn't fit well on your head and weird to adjust.

My first video console in over 30 years. Not just for kids. I got this for the fitness games as they all have good recommendations on the oculus site. If it turn out to be a hit we will probably buy a second one to play together or with friends.

This is a pretty exciting product. I’m not too into gaming,  it this gift for my kids is one that I enjoy! The kids take turns on challenges and get their physical skills put to work. Still waiting to see one of the kids run into a wall, though.

Pretty awesome, the graphics are so much clearer. Would have given five stars but the adjustable headset part is very annoying. The way it adjusts to get larger or smaller is not very user friendly while wearing. Other than that it’s pretty cool

Excellent fun for the family and friends. Recently purchase the oculus quest 2. The graphics are amazing you feel like you are really there. Have so far played bowling, Star Wars, and Best Saber. All are very fun. Would recommend purchasing one.

This is my first VR experience and I'm completely blown away. I'm a 36 year old married guy who has never been much of a gamer. During this pandemic I needed something to stave off the cabin fever and this does it!! I recommend this to everyone.

This is my first VR headset and I am super impressed. It really is immersive and the screen quality is amazing. If you decide to purchase this headset I recommend getting Super Hot VR for your first game because it is a great introduction to VR!

Very good headset. Beautiful graphics and easy to wear. Only downside is most of the games on the oculus app are for the Rift S and how difficult it is to connect to your computer wirelessly if your computer can't use the headset with the cord.

My whole family enjoy this.  My kids enjoy riding rollercoasters and exploring.  Crazy how real everything seems.  I can't imagine what this technology will bring in the next 10 years.  All my friends that have tried mine have bought their own.

My son really enjoys this but complains that the included head strap doesn't feel secure and allows it to slip down. Considering buying one of the other types that are available. The whole thing is expensive and you still have to buy the games.

Best purchase I've made!  It really surprised me how immersive this is.  I didn't know what to expect when I bought it.  Soon as I put them on I was sold!  You can watch movies as if you're at an IMAX theater...games, etc.  Definitely worth it!

Love this set! Very realistic quality of games and games available for the whole family. Games can be pricey so be prepared for that but other than that, great set I highly recommend. Actually gets you up and moving some depending on the games.

Best entry level VR headset/platform there is at the moment. Make sure to purchase the Elite Strap, preferably with battery, and Fit Kit for the Wide foam visor attachment. And the official case. And VRCover lens protectors for when not in use.

This VR headset is a lot of fun and makes for a great motivator for my child.  The battery in the headset does not last as long as I would like, but this is good for setting limits for my young one.  Overall, its a good buy and no regrets here.

This is a whole new world of gaming and so much more. Stunning and emersive visuals the audio quality is decent. If you want the full emersive experience i would recommend some headphones. This is a purchase you won't regret its simply amazing.

Love this! I'm not a huge gamer like the rest of my family so I assumed this would be a good alternative and have options to do more than just game. I was correct.....the VR videos are fun and when my kids actually give me a turn I enjoy it :)

I like the fact that technology of the boarders is better then 1, with Quest 2 if you have a chair or some type of object in the way it shows up to where you can see it with your headset on and you want run into it. Also it is more affordable.

The Oculus Quest 2 is truly epic. This blows the doors off of your Playstation or Xbox! Get the 256 GB version or you'll run out of  memory fast. Don't waste anymore time and order one now. My Oculus is the life and entertainment of any party!

This is a much better upgrade and the new strap and eye foam cover was already included so I did not have to try to have oculus send me a part. Very well made and sturdy. My son is a rough guy and it’s taken him throwing and carrying all over!

The original purchase had a "glitch" with one of the controllers, but the Geek Squad team was able to quickly resolve with a replacement which has not had any of the same issues.  My kids have had a lot of fun playing both free and paid games.

I purchased the Quest 2 as a remedy for living too far from the gym. There a a number of apps that get your heart pumping and also give you quite a workout. The Oculus Quest 2 is the solution I have been DREAMING of and now it's become realiy.

Having an oculus is even better than I imagined. It’s fun to watch Netflix on or gaming. I personally use it for fitness and man does it give me a workout. Only thing is a low battery life. You can hook up a battery pack and POW problem fixed.

I loved the Quest 1 but the Quest 2 already has a number of issues:
1 - The Android app doesn't allow you to pair the headset, even after updating it.  You have to clear the app cache in order for the Quest 2 to appear (nothing tells you this unless you do a Google search and find other who have had the same issue).
2 - The left controller does not appear in VR even though it is paired and connected, and the battery level registers as 100%. (I have gone through all of the troubleshooting steps, but still no controller.)
3 - The audio sounds tinny, like there is no bass at all.
4 - Anything that should look black actually looks dark grey, apparently because they're using a cheaper form of display.
5 - Even the elite headstrap doesn't feel as secure as the Quest 1 basic headstrap.
6 - Anything white, like text, appears to have a streak of light coming off of it unless your viewing angle is perfect.

If you are happy with the Quest 1, you might want to stick with it for now.  It seems like there are a lot of issues to work out with the Quest 2.

Best product!  My entire family has found something they all enjoy.  Set was a little tricky but once got it ready and app installed all has been fairly simple.  I have had some drop issues buy my area is in the middle of optics being replaced

We bought this for oyr daughter as a Christmas present but actually the whole family is using it now. LOL Such a cool toy. And we don’t really play video games but now we are hooked with some game me like the Star Wars one. Highly recommended!

So realistic that is scary at first. I’m not sure what the complaints are about with the fact that you need to sync your Facebook account to it. I did buy the $400 device, and I use it almost everyday. My other family members bought one also.

Freaking awesome and so amazing that my husband opened his gift before Christmas and wouldn't share with me so we went and bought a second one !! Such an awesome gift and the graphics are phenomenal and I absolutely love the fitness games !!!

Great buy.  A lot of the games graphics aren’t the best but,  it will do.  My daughter loves it as I got it for her for Christmas.  The battery life could be better but hey,  it gives her a moment to get off of it or she would stay on all day

This vr is unlike any other. The prices on the games are good, the most expensive games are about 30-40 dollars. The features are great, one of the features gives you the option to trace where you want to play. Overall I would give it a 9/10.

I had a Quest 1, and wanted to upgrade to the Quest 2 and I am glad I did. The visual clarity is so much better. For some games it's nearly impossible to see the pixels. Colors seem more vibrant as well and not washed out like in the Quest 1.

Love love love this device!!!! My only advise would be make sure you draw the boundary with arm reach in mind and not just general body contact. Lol. It’ll save you from the horrible sound of your fist coming into contact with your TV screen.

This is so awesome. I think I am going to wear it out in a month. I got it early. This product is soooo. cool. And graphics are amazing. This is my first VR set. I have tried the older ones before but this one is truly emersive. 
Love it!!!!

Really fun. Super heavy and gives me a stiff neck sometimes. But it's really immersive and cool. Lots of free things to explore and do so I didn't have to spend a ton on games right away. Plus Oculus allows you to upload apps via side quest.

I wasn't sure about this item when I bought it, but we are having a lot of fun with it.  Everyone in the house that plays video games is enjoying this and the extra movement from playing the games help us get in part of our exercise routine.

Our son loves this VR!  We bought this for our 12 year old son for Christmas since we are all still isolated due to COVID.  Everyone in the house has used it and loved it.  My 18 year old son and 15 year old daughter have enjoyed it as well.

Product is pretty nice. My only issue is the lack of size, width wise. Would be great if it could extend the width on the headset. Games are fun but sweat pretty easily with it on. Another suggestion would be the fit of the rubber protector.

Shame on facebook/ocolus.

I expected this to be PC friendly but i cant even connect it to pc easily. 

It comes with spacers for glasses but still doesn't fit glasses.. 

The image-quality is worse than the rift, field of view is too narrow

Outstanding. Like a whole new world. Easy set up and makes me wish I had gotten one earlier. Now I see what the big excitement is all about. So far a great purchase. Can not wait to get deep into the games and all the features of the system.

This is my Children’s  favorite gaming system. It works great and the screen quality is amazing for this price point. We actually just bought a second so our kids wouldn’t fight over it. Great that you do t need another pc or gaming console.

Love that this works without a PC but can be connected to PC if desired.

Would like to see some educational or travel channel type experiences that I think are more powerful for learning situations.

Never used VR before but am interested.

Great VR headset. I enjoy the feeling and excitement and been using this Oculus Quest 2 headset almost every day. I like the games and experiences and loving it every minute. I definitely recommend this headset to anyone. I give it 5 stars.

Its light and display is really clear compared to my old oculus quest 1. the only thing that I dont like is the material they used on the strap is really low quality. I was forced to buy the elite strap just to have the comfort of using it.

Could never get it to look sharp. Resolution always looked liked 480dpi. I used the Sidequest app to change settings and no improvements. This was bad!! This had to be a bad unit because there is no way this is the way its supposed to look.

The only flaw with this is that it’s linked with Facebook.  Got it as a family Christmas gift this year.  It really is almost unbelievable & kind of messes you up if you have it on too long.  But the games & the experience is great overall.

My boyfriend loves it! He gets on at least once a day, even if it's only for 20mins.  It takes some getting used too and if you suffer from any type of motion sickness, then this is NOT for you.  Overall extremely happy with this purchase!!

This is my first experience with owning a personal VR. Love the fact that it can be used by itself (stand-alone) or connected to a gaming PC for that extra kick in performance and to play more graphically intense games like Half-Life: Alyx.

This was an upgrade from a dysfunctional Oculus rift s- the Quest needs the upgraded head piece which makes a huge difference to wearability.  Optics are entry level VR but lots of fun.  Need a powerful computer for running pc applications.

The best game set i ever bought! I think this is the future of games and hang out.  With this game system you can  do a lot of things... not just play... hang out with family &friends... watch movies/concerts... live sports and wide more...

Great product. I’m new to gaming but the oculus is a amazing. My husband plays golf and I like action games. 
I just wish they had yoga classes and that the classes they do have were not a monthly fee. But the oculus it’s self is amazing.

This is so much fun.   There are many games available end so many other experiences. The graphics are exceptional. You literally feel like you are there.  We may end up buying another one of these.  Everybody in the family wants to use it.

Excellent product- my son loves it.  He reports that it is very responsive, and works better than he had hoped.  It fits well, without being overly heavy, or uncomfortable, and allows him to explore the virtual reality he so desired to do.

I bought this for my son and he is enjoying it a lot.  I tried it once or twice and it’s a very interesting experiential sensation.  It was a little complicated to set up and I later learned it’s incompatible with my son’s gaming computer.

Works very well, especially now that that they're rolling out AirLink.  I'm not a huge fan of Facebook login requirement, hence the four stars.  Other than that, the unit is well worth the money and one of the best VR values on the market.

I’ve never been much of a gamer but as soon as I tried my sons I was hurt and 50 years old and just started playing games Due to my experience with the Oculus I just love it and it gets me up and moving I have recommended it to many people

ive been waiting for vr to hit the future. it has arrived. no cords just walk and explore. only drawback is you need a smart phone to activate. you can use someone elses  but you must log into your oculus facebook acct on their phone first

This is AMAZING. S o realistic, it's scary. Im not too into video games but this has something for everyone. My 5 yr old likes playing fruit ninja, my 80 yr old father likes to watch nat geo....a great purchase for the fam..worth the money

The Oculus Quest 2 VR is my first VR headset. Easy setup and good tutorials. Can’t wait to embark on the thrills with some of the exciting games out there. Suggest looking into some of the You Tube tutorials if you are new to the platform.

This unit has nothing short of amazing. My family finds hours of enjoyment with this VR unit. The only recommendation would be to order a extension battery that can be purchased in Amazon and the special head strap to support the battery.

We are really enjoying this purchase of the Oculus Quest 2 as a family. There is something from everyone to play in the family. I even can get a good workout with some of the games on there. Best purchase I’ve made for the family in 2020.

They say the best gifts that Santa brings are the one that mummy and daddy can enjoy too, well, here it is!
Loaded Thrill of the Fight boxing game and getting fighting fit when the progeny isn't killing off monsters of zombies or whatever

I gave this a three rating because I had to return two of them.  Occulus does not bench test them before shipping, poor QA/QC.  The third one works well, but should have better adjustability on the eye pieces.  You get what you pay for...

My first VR system since the Nintendo Virtual Boy and I’m very impressed. There’s tons of things to play, demo and experience for free.

It’s compatible with all the games on the original Quest, so there’s tons of games already out there.

I purchased this for my husband for Christmas and I must say it’s so much fun! Whether you want to play a game, watch Netflix, there’s something for everyone and such a clear picture! Even our 6 year old loves “riding roller coasters” lol

I didn't like the new design for the oculus. The head strap and outside components felt cheap and uncomfortable. Definitely a downgrade from the last oculus design. However the loading and game speed and much better than the last oculus.

A great BE headset to learn on. Facebook must be relying on customers to purchase apps because for the price you can't beat it.
No complaints with the headset but I would recommend purchasing the Oculus Elite Strap for better experience.

My son likes it and plays with it a lot. For me, the graphics are still medieval and not worth it. Not sure why this thing costs too much when there’s not a lot you can do with it. They need to improve the graphics and the response time.

I give this a 4 star because it doesn’t have any base games. You have to buy from the start. It’s an amazing and fun experience. The games are moderately priced. The charging cable has already stopped working, and I had to buy a new one.

I did curbside and the person was very kind and polite... the Game itself is Awesome!
The virtual is amazing, it has great sound and easy to use controls.
Just give yourself enough room to move!

Now we just need 3 more for the Big kids!

I purchased this for my son and let me just say wow! The graphics are so real you can play virtually and youtube has Educational channels that put you right in the middle of the documentary. I actually learned some things. Great purchase

This was a gift for my grandson, he absolutely loves it. Easy to follow set-up instructions, he had it up and viewing in about 15 minutes. Already has groups of online friends, fellow players. Ordered online and received in about 3 days.

best enjoyable moments ever. This thing is amazing. the games, and even watching movies...its like being in the theater...It feels like you are right there where its taking place. And it is easy to control and the charge lasts for hours

I am originally a retro game player but decided to give VR a try and boy ol boy this thing rocks. Excellent for work out or just to have plain fun. Definetely recommend this product to anyone that wants to jump into submersive gaming!!!

I heard the “hype” about how great this headset is.I honestly thought it would be just like all the other VR sets. But once I put it on... Wow! This is, by far, the best set I’ve ever used. If I could use one word, it would be, AWESOME!

The Quest 2 is a blast. Getting the head strap configured correctly took a little bit but is great once dialed in. 
Always feel like going to smudge the lenses though every time put it on or take it off. Have to wipe them off each time.

Very fun & amazing to play if youve never had VR before. My only concern is that it's just not enough games to be fully satisfied. My wife & I end up playing 7 games religiously on it. The rest are meh or fun for a tiny bit than boring.

Works great wirelessly as a stand-alone VR device, or as a wired PC VR headset. Tracking and screens have been improved over the first version of the Oculus Quest. Definitely recommend this for anyone that doesn't have a VR headset yet.

The system is great! Population one my favorite has me gaming all the time again. The only downside is that the battery life for the oculus isnt the best 2.5 hours max then u gotta charge. There are attachments to make it longer though.

Coming from the Oculus Rift S, I had high hopes for the Quest 2 since Oculus had discontinued the Rift S and the higher end segment of VR. I had done some research as I wanted to make sure the Quest 2 was able to run most of the apps I had already purchased for the Rift S.

Unfortunately support for those apps I discovered later required the side-loading of apps via developers loop hole. I still could not get Google Earth VR to run even though I invested in the $75 cable to connect the Quest 2 to my recently purchased (from Best Buy) Alienware Gaming Laptop. Sadly, I learned Google had discontinued support for VR 3 years ago.

Other apps I had would also not be supported such as Alyx.  Alyx was one of the best graphical apps/games I have but even though I was running it off my laptop I used with the Rift S the Oculus system would still not allow the apps to run on the Quest 2.

So for lighter graphics games like arcade and lower graphics the Quest 2 worked fine and the lack of cables and the need to plus in to a computer would make it fun for play.

This thing awesome would give it five stars but the only down side is there is not enough free games you have to pay for almost everything you want to do on this but other than that great experience would highly recommend getting this.

Bought this, have been enjoying it ever since, its better to buy this 256gb as opposed to the 64gb, youll want to buy a lot of the games, theyre not too expensive (highest ive seen was around 40). Definitely buy it if you can afford it

My husband had the choice of the Nintendo Switch or the Oculus Quest 2. He picked this because of the more uses for an adult. He loves it. Has downloaded a fishing and a golf game so far and can play with friends on the opposite coast.

The oculus 2 is a great VR system.  No cords, no wires - it allows you to actually use it and not worry about hooking everything up like a PlayStation VR (or where you can put it away when it’s not in use so you don’t have an eyesore).

Love this thing. Loads of fun for everyone. It's not made with little ones in mind so i cant complain but i do wish there was more games for the smaller kids. Really looking forward to the hand tracking tech getting better and cheaper!

My first venture into VR. After trying my friends Oculus I was sold.  I bought my Oculus Quest 2 at Christmas and though I haven't played a much as I'd like to, it's absolutely amazing.  Very immersive and the platform is so well done.

Ok so i was a bit skeptical on this product due to my lack of tech knowledge however it’s super user friendly and I’ve been hooked since day one. It’s also super fun when family and friends come over. I take it everywhere with me lol.

This is a great invention..this vr has amazing features and life like adventures.i would highly recommend this product to people of all ages.from solo playing to family enjoyment this is by far it....get one, you won't be disappointed

I am enjoying this purchase so much!  I have the oculus for pc but hated being tethered…games that don’t require internet can be played in your backyard on the Quest 2!!!  Just set up your play area and away you go!  Highly recommend!

Out of this world. Oculus transports us to other places, other worlds and we get to do it with friends and family. The headset can be a bit bulky but it’s a small price to pay for the experience of a lifetime. So I bought another one.

Got this specifically to use for exercise - using the SuperNatural app - and I love it.  Could there be improvements, sure, but I actually get off work looking FORWARD to putting this on and exercising with it for an hour or so a day!

0 regrets. EVERYTHING I've tried on it has so far been super fun. Kids like it, elderly parents lived it when I brought by, friends went out and got one after trying. Isn't the best thing in the world but it is the coolest and funnest

Good product. Nice to have the extra memory. Not really adjustable for glasses even though they give you a spacer. It "requires" a facebook profile which is troublesome. Possible programs are reasonably priced, but favor young people.

Love this! Been wanting one for years and finally got it. Easy to use and fun to play with! I recommend highly to anyone wanting their first VR system. No Computer required as well as you and set it up right away and play immediately.

So much fun. The original interface sucks and left a rash on my face.  They do send a different type free if you request it.  It's My only complaint.  The Oculus is super fun to play. You definitely get lost in an alternative reality.

Absolutely incredible. Ended up selling my Nintendo switch for this and I couldn't be happier. The online games you're able to play with friends is so much fun. But to be honest its a great party game when you entertain at your house.

Good for very casual gaming. There ate better headset for true VR experience if you have a gaming Rig and a place to play. Biggest draw back is lack of game selection and the inability to add steam games without add ons to the device

The graphics and games are great.  However, we have only had this for a little over a month and it is not working.  It won't even turn off for us to try and re-boot it.  It is now stuck on a blank screen with no way to try to fix it.

Enjoying it a lot. Did have an issue recently updating a program. In the end found out my quest needed and update then worked amazing again. 10/10 recommend for a first VR and as a wireless VR that you don’t need a computer for play!

Price, performance, and lower weight are welcome upgrades over last model. My gripes are with the light color (prone to super highlight blems), the mediocre head strap, and new controller size. Overall, still an excellent experience.

This a excellent gaming device, a few flaws but not everything is perfect.

Sometimes I find it to be laggy and I hope they update the software to work out some bugs.

Overall its a great way to burn off some of those extra calories!

Amazing device!  Only two unavoidable issues: 1) the weight on your face becomes an issue due to the length of time you are likely to enjoy the experience, and 2) the possibility of vertigo for folks who are prone to motion sickness.

I was optimistic about buying the oculus until my brother brought his over during Christmas. I absolutely love this machine! I do recommend you get at least 128GB because you will definitely be buying games. Overall great family fun.

I love this.  With all that is going on in the world, this is a nice get away.   I have swam in the ocean,  climbed Mt. Everest and even traveled to other countries.   The graphics are amazing!  I definitely recommend this to anyone.

My son purchased this with Christmas money and loves it.  I like that it gets him moving while he plays!  It requires movement which is something most video games lack.  He uses it more than his Xbox now and I'm hoping he continues.

The graphics are amazing. The games are awesome and good quality. I wish there were instructions in the manual on how to set up with the pc games but overall I rate this a 9/10!!! It is awesome!!! You can play with friends or alone.

Purchased (3) of the Oculus -Quest 2 Advanced All-In-One 
Virtual Reality Headsets. We have had so much fun with them they are so awesome. The wife can stay off of them.
The seals person was very helpful that's why we got 3 of them.

The Quest 2 is probably the best VR platform out there now in terms of value for your money and ease of use. It's been a blast since purchase and I am thinking about buying a second one for the household for some multiplayer gaming.

Being a first time VR user I was not sure what to expect. It was easy to set up and I bought Blade and Sorcery. The game is pretty fun especially when you kick the enemy and they go flying.. overall im really loving this VR headset.

Got this as an Xmas gift for the family.  Everyone loves it and can’t get over how life like it is.  Only downfall is you have to Facebook profile to create an account and my kids don’t have them so they have to play on my account.

I love to game so adding physical movement in a 3D simulation is incredible!  I had not looked at VR seriously until technology caught up with my expectations and now there is no way I can look away from it!  Absolutely incredible!

Graphics are awesome. Makes exercising fun! That's what I got it for was to get myself moving and that's what it does. I'm not a gamer just a middle aged mom who wanted a fun way to get some exercise in the extremely hot AZ summer.

The device gives a lot of headaches while using it for 10 minutes only. The VR feel and the games are amazing, but when you have a bad day after using it, it's not worth it. Not only I have tested it, but my friends also tested it.

Two things that would make this the (almost) perfect system. If your not lazy, and enjoy a good moving about (or can play in stationary mode) and as long as you know when to quit then this game system could be what's right for you.

My whole family loves the Oculus-Quest 2!  It lets us visit the world, get up and move while playing games, go to concerts, and more!
The graphics are AMAZING! It is quick to set up and easy to learn.
Even the grandparents love it!

Definitely takes gaming to a while new level definitely recommend this product to anybody crib the young to the old was the best thing i spent that type of money on in a long time and the games are just getting better well worth it

We are so glad that we couldn't get a PlayStation 5 now.  We got the Quest 2 Advanced and our son couldn't be more happy.  It also is giving him great exercise instead of just sitting in the chair with a controller.  Great product!

Bought it for my son.  He's very happy with the device and likes many of the games.  I've used it many times myself and have been very impressed by the technology.  Thinking about getting a second one so we can play games together.

We purchase this for each other for our anniversary and it’s the best gift we ever bought each other. Absolutely LOVE our Oculus, we use it EVERYDAY. We have purchased several games for it and one is just as spectacular as the next

Awesome experience and fun for everyone. Hate that its owned by Facebook and tjrrforr have to maintain an account. Facebook is the place happeness goes to die. But at least you'll experience some sweet VR technology in the process.

By far the best V.R. equipment to invest in getting. If you plan on downloading alot of games on the unit itself go with the 256 GB one. If you plan to connect through your PC you are safe going with the 64 GB one. Great purchase!

This Oculus quest 2 VR headset is absolutely a great gaming system. The graphics are awesome the controls are easy to use everything seems to work really good. My kid really enjoys playing with the VR system. I would recommend it.

LOVE THIS!  The whole family has enjoyed this VR set.  Very entertaining to watch and great if you have what the player is seeing on a screen.  Highly recommend the extra storage space.  Great gaming that will get everyone active!

Overall very happy with it.  Wish there were more games available for a younger audience.  Also, after prolonged use, the padding that contacts the face can get moist and lead to mild skin irritation for those with sensitive skin.

My 12 year old grandson said he only wanted the Oculus 2 for Christmas.  I eventually gave in and bought it for him; however, he doesn't know it yet because it isn't Christmas yet.  He will be thrilled on Christmas Day, I expect.

Besides the great VR that comes from a unit that doesn’t require wires connected to a computer the thing I really like is that you can build a virtual wall around a safe area and it will warn you when you comes close to the wall.

My son LOVES his Oculus.  He and I don't like that he had to create a Facebook account in order to use it. The system itself is GREAT; however, I really didn't want my child to have a Facebook account.  That really is not needed.

After receiving two defective Quest 2s from WalMart I received a good one from here. The product is robust but the main downside is a facebook account is required and you cannot opt out of letting them collect and sell your data.

I’ve always wanted a all in one headset, I’ve tried PlayStation move, cell phone VR and early oculus models that plug Into PC. This model is THE BEST one yet! Only issue is the battery life is just under 3 hours on a full charge.

The most fun you can have virtually.  This is a experience that during Quarantine takes you on new and amazing adventures.  It’s unbelievable how phenomenal the 360 is as your surrounded by life like scenery.  Worth the purchase!

It's wireless! Is VR ready for prime time?  Graphics wise I am not impressed, I still think they are all in Nintendo area from years ago.  We have a few more years till we hit the PC graphics era.  Is it cool, yes I think it is.  The boxing is fun: Thrill of the fight, Gorn is fun, Star Wars games were great, but all cartoony like Nintendo. But a good work out and getting people off the couch is a good thing!  Easy to get sick if you are walking around in the game, but games have ways around moving and not bothering you so much.  The lens also has a blur, you can download SideQuest and easily tweak that a bit, but still has a blur. The field of view I wish was a little more wider, can see the edges slightly on the sides.  Oculus keeps updating with surprises like 90hz and then 120hz.  They also are finally doing PCVR with native Air Link that allows you to play games powered by your PC wirelessly and get access to Oculus Rift games.  Still the graphics are not as good as a PC.  Hopefully people keep pushing it forward, I'll try again in another 4-5 years.

I like the Oculus because I can do a lot of things with it. I have rheumatoid arthritis so I can use the Oculus to keep moving. I also like games and I can do things that I a afraid of in real life,  like riding a roller coaster.

Best Christmas gift of 2021! Kids love these, and with the physical interaction they are getting a lot more exercise of arms and torso than thump clicking Xbox. Might get them weighted wristbands so they can really burn calories!

We love this! It’s been so fun to experience the beautiful graphics and daredevil experiences. We also love the ability to cast to the television or laptop, so everyone can see what the player is seeing. Great fun for our family!

I love it ! It's my first V R headset, so I can't compare it to any others. But the Quest 2 is a mind blowing experience for me. You get totally immersed in it and it becomes reality ! And there's plenty of different apps to try.

So much more fun than I anticipated!!! Got it as a gift for our son, and I love it as much as, if not more than he does!!! I foresee me losing sleep because playability after he goes to bed will quickly become my normal routine!

This is by far the best purchase I have made in a long time! So much fun and so many things to do and not everything is a game. I very highly recommend the Oculus! We were tired sharing the one Oculus, so we bought a second one!

Worth it. My kids have been enjoying it since the opened it for Xmas. I even had time to enjoy before they did. Go Mom and Dad! Didn’t have a choice but to get the 256 gb but might be worth it. It’s is a lot of fun and worth it.

So much fun and easy to use without worrying about getting tangled up in chords. Only problem i have is the tracking can get messed up sometimes. The games are a bit limited due to Facebooks policies but i still can't get enough

This was a surprise family Christmas present and it didn’t disappoint. It’s ready to go out of the box with plenty of free things to explore while you get used to it. If you wear glasses it takes some adjustment but no big deal.

Was fun at first but now after the latest update I get an error message that reads "oculus assistant services keeps stopping" every time I try I try to use the keyboard and it crashes.  Which frankly makes it completely useless.

My 8 yr old daughter absolutely loves it! I was surprised how easy it was to get started. The play experience is awesome! Kids teens and adults in my house love playing on this. Makes an over the top gift. I highly recommend it.

No where to demo product just displays-bolted down and if you open box cannot return it.store policy frustrates people with visual problems .
I Would know as soon as i put them on if they worked or not . Need to see a solution?

My husband loves it. I've only got the chance to play with it about three times, he has been on it every since.  We will have to buy another one so that I can have the oculus experience, sharing no longer seems to be an option.

I really like the Quest 2, but out of the box is kind of limited. You really need to get the better head strap if you want comfort. I picked up the battery power headstrap and quest link cable and I’m having a pretty good time.

Good family fun. Grandkids loved this and the videos I got of them playing are priceless. I enjoyed the different scenes and the roller coasters were so realistic. I would definitely purchase again and I recommend for all ages.

Good family fun. Grandkids loved this and the videos I got of them playing are priceless. I enjoyed the different scenes and the roller coasters were so realistic. I would definitely purchase again and I recommend for all ages.

This is everything that I was hoping it would be.  It has great features, resolution, sound.  The user interface is very nice and super easy to navigate.  I would recommend this device to anyone who is wanting to give VR a go.

I'm really enjoying the Quest 2 so far! I would recommend against the 256 gb version, as it is pretty excessive for most casuals. I hate the facebook aspect of it, but online privacy flew out the window a long time ago for me.

I was skeptical of how immersive they could be, but honestly they far exceeded my expectations.   Whether I'm staring down from the sky or looking up at the northern lights, the experience is amazing.  Well worth the purchase.

Simple set up and ready to go! Very comfortable and amazing technology. Free games and demos are fun...can't wait to get more and more in depth with everything. Huge difference from the only other VR I can compare (Samsung VR)

Had to choose this or the PS5, I have no regrets. Graphics are insane and even the wife uses it for a few games. No complaints so far. Go with the more expensive one so you can get more storage, unless your using it with a pc.

If you want to get an amazing VR headset, standalone or PC, without shelling out the big bucks, I highly recommend this.
Bought two of these because why not! It’s so fun playing games with my kids, it brings everyone together.

Miraculously fun.! VR is amazing and the Quest 2 is super easy to use. The fact that it can be used standalone is great: our TV’s and computers have way too many things attached. Everyone in the family waits in line to use it.

Really a cool device. VR has come a long way and will continue. For an untethered experience this is your device. It can also connect to a computer. I have done that wired,  ut not wireless yet as it requires a specific setup.

This is absolutely amazing! My son loves it!  He has been wanting a VR system for a while so we looked at a couple different ones.  Someone recommended this particular one and we are so glad that this is the one we went with!

This is absolutely amazing! My son loves it!  He has been wanting a VR system for a while so we looked at a couple different ones.  Someone recommended this particular one and we are so glad that this is the one we went with!

you cannot be this VR headset for the money! no need for a PC but if you have one you can play higher quality PCVR games via the link cable or my favorite using an app called Virtual Desktop which allows you to stay wireless.

It seldomly "glitches", but overall a very good buy! My wife and I likes it, but my daughter LOVES IT!! :-) I'm thinking about buying another one, so I can play online with my daughter, and also because she takes it over. :-)

I bought this on release day and I love it! I had it for a little over a month and it did start randomly shutting off so I returned that one and got another and haven't had any issues. It's a great vr and is fun for all ages.

Amazing entry into the world of VR. Replaces the rift S with a better screens, and refresh rate. use stand alone, or wired for pc vr. I absolutely love mine. only caveat is you need a facebook account that's in good standing.

Oculus - Quest 2 has the best features in this All-In-One. Decided to treat my husband to the best, and am now official the proud owner of his previous Oculus (:-)  He uses it constantly and keeps saying how much he loves it!

Well worth it for the wireless, especially in smaller spaces, so much better than the current PSVR. Time will tell when the new version comes out but i still imagine it would be wired so this would still beat it by that alone

Bought this for my girlfriends son.  He absolutely loves it.  Setup was a royal pain but once that was done we were all set. Lineup of games is average compared to a console but it’s a unique experience for sure and worth it.

This is so much fun but GET THE PROTECTION PLAN!  Needed to replace it 2 times in one year but Best Buy was great with replacing it. We originally bought the Oculus in December of 2020 and first replacement was in April 2021.

My kids and I love this VR. My son Downloaded a lot of games on it. I can go on YouTube and watch some exercise videos. My daughter can go on a roller-coaster without leaving the house. The boxing games with keep you moving.

Though I wish I could have access to more games I enjoy the experience overall. Do recommend you to get used to feeling slightly strain on your eyes and to buy the battery pack because the battery is used way too quickly too

Love! Love!! Not a gamer whatsoever, however, this is a whole new world. I get transformed into a new world and escape the bad day that I had. Love this and can’t wait to see what else there is to discover with this product.

Christmas present for my son.  It has gotten many hours of use and no issues so far. Read about the issues with Facebook and Oculus but it appears that is only affected a few customers. We had no set up or connection issues.

Bought it online they came out and delivered it to us which was great did not have to go in the store. Oculus is fun and we can see other family members at least their virtual image and we can play with them family fun time.

My first time stepping into VR and i love the experience.the controller's are very comfortable, you almost forget your holding them.i will be getting my brother & sister's their own.i love the fitness apps,roller-coaster app

After only a few months, the tracking starts to go faulty in the left controller, especially after playing games like Beat Saber. The left analog stick also started to go faulty. I have a group of about 5 friends, all of which are experiencing the exact same issues with their headsets.

Customer support is being notoriously strict about using the warranty. I had to actually send in a video demonstrating the issue and despite clearly showing it, they are continuing to make me re-do troubleshooting steps that I already performed. I have never had any other company do this to me before when resolving an issue with a faulty product. It is obvious that at least one batch of these headsets had a manufacturing issue, and they want to blame everyone but themselves. I now have a lowered trust in Facebook and how they do business, and I now actively avoid their products. I was skeptical ever since they deleted the account of the guy who broke his neck playing VR. If the warranty doesn’t work out, I will be purchasing a different headset, possibly with full-body tracking.

This is a really good VR system. Not too heavy so that you can use it for a while without it hurting, but also not too light so that it feels cheap. Also it is easy enough for all ages to use...even my 70+ year old in-laws.

No oled?????????????? I returned mine just because no oled screen, the old ones looks better in dark videos or space, contrast over the resolution babe, sorry but is a big NO for me, make the next one oled and I’m in again.

This is an awesome piece of technology! It’s fun and easy to use. My son loves it! The only down side is it makes you a bit nauseous and you can get a little sweaty lol but I guess that’s when it’s time to take a break lol.

Love this headset. Definitely has a couple quirks, but the enjoyment I have gotten playing far outweighs that. I haven't experienced some issues I have heard about like lenses seeming blurry. Great headset at a great price.

These worked directly out of the box.  The experience of VR is absolutely amazing.  Customer Service people at Best Buy explained their use and I am completely satisfied with the purchases.  I actually gave 3 away as gifts.

Great gift idea. There is so much you can do with this device. I purchased the larger storage option since I discovered you can make art work on it as well and didn’t want to have to delete anything. Oculus tv is great too!

Easy to set up and comfortable standalone virtual reality set. The unit is lighter than the original version, being an improvement on its predecessor. With the price tag, you get a sharper image and a more powerful device.

Really good for what you pay for, my one complaint are the controllers are bigger than the previous gen, and they feel big. Other than that small gripe, it’s a great headset for beginners trying to get into virtual reality

Awesome feels like your inside the game. Ive notice that i dont get headache after playing not likr the previous models you get headache right after you play. So i guess did something about it for this model i give this 10

I love this console!! The graphics are off the charts! An excellent way to get exercise if you must or to escape from reality. VR technology has gotten much better. This is not your smartphone attached to a cardboard box!!

I purchased 2 headsets for my grandsons. The packaging was amazing and delivery was quick and without issue. Headsets are made of a strong sturdy quality and is definitely worth the price. My grandsons love their headsets.

My 11 yr granddaughter want this system for her birthday. Sadly, we didn't research the system well enough to be aware that some people get dizzy and disorientated while playing these games. Our loss is someone elses gain.

Unbelievably Awesome!  I have been putting off buying one of these because I want sure if the hype lived up to its name.  I have now been using it for only 24 hours and I am 100% thoroughly impressed .  Fantastic product !

I was not ready for the realism of this VR unit. I saw all the tic tocs and thought they couldnt be that fun. I was wrong this is entertainment at its finest. The more space u have the more fun u will have. Cant go wrong.

I have never been into gaming, but VR is different. I was instantly hooked when I tried my brother’s Oculus 1. I immediately drove down to Best Buy to picked up the Oculus 2 right before they closed. It’s worth the money!

I was not ready for the realism of this VR unit. I saw all the tic tocs and thought they couldnt be that fun. I was wrong this is entertainment at its finest. The more space u have the more fun u will have. Cant go wrong.

The best way to play games and entertain yourself it keeps you active moving and burning some calories while you’re at it! Definitely worth it! And the fact that you can connect it to your PC definitely makes a difference

This was the hit present at. Christmas this year. It’s such a cool experience and so much fun to play with. From young to old everyone enjoyed it tremendously. I bought two this year and plan on buying a third for myself.

We have 7 kids and all of them and us parents really enjoy this. Would definitely recommend. The only thing we’ve noticed is it can cause mild motion sickness and you have to make sure your boundary is clear of obstacles.

Well all I can say is it must be a good product because I don’t see my son anymore. He’s constantly locked up in his room with this thing on his face and he has a permanent dent in his hair from the strap on his head. Lol

Pretty cool technology.  Nothing else out there to compare it to so can’t say much more.  A complaint could be the cost per game required to use the device is pretty pricey.  The device was enough at $399.99.  Just saying

I mean let's face it.. regular reality has pretty much sucked for the past two years.  So why drudge through the day-to-day slog of real life when for a few hundred bucks and some disapproving looks from your family, you can escape to a reality that is virtually your own?

Sure, this reality may seem like you're looking at the world through a screen door attached to horse blinders, but isnt that a small price to pay to eliminate all that pesky personal exposure to coughy, sneezy people?  And the fact that you are untethered to an electronic anchor allows you the freedom of movement that will have you feeling like you are *actually* running through fields of flowers and dispatching zombies with your bare hands.

Unlike reality reality, you will find yourself unburdened by a breadth of options and choices of things to do.  Much like an episode of the Kardashians, the content doesn't run deep.  But again, you get to live in the shallow pool of your own design and that can't all be bad.  There is enough to keep you interested - at least until actual reality improves.

Outstanding effects, must get use to it. Makes you somewhat dizzy, but the experience is out of this world. Gamers will love it. Games range from 20 to 40 and there are some free games. Alot of fun and family's can enjoy.

This replace an Oculus Go that was having issues.  WOW, what an upgrade!  Not sure the SW is completely solid, but a factory reset is easy and quick.  The second time thru you may see things you didn't see the first time!

Its Okay,  I not sure I would recommend it, the first two apps I installed are actually broken and don't run.   The roller coaster is great, and I am looking at doing other things with it; BUT, its more hype than actual.

Absolutely love playing with this. I have the PSVR but find myself enjoying the Quest 2 more. It’s nice to play so many games untethered. Thinking about getting a second one for the household to play multiplayer locally.

Love this thing!!! Hours upon hours of fun. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because of the head strap that comes with it. Feels cheap and stretches too much. Ended up buying the upgraded one, and so much better.

This product is well done, it engages and brings you into your surroundings. The 1 draw back, it consumes your kids. It is so life like, games I’m sure will develop into what gaming systems have now. Look out after that.

It is simply the best standalone VR headset you can buy.  So happy with my purchase!  Have the Quest 1, and this is such an upgrade.  From the smaller size to the better screens, and faster processor, it is just amazing.

Controllers won’t pair after two weeks of having it. If I would’ve realized I was close to the return date I would have returned it. Great game console, poor execution of hardware. Kind of upset, I really had my hopes up

Bought 2 of these for both of my boys for Christmas .  They already had the PlayStation VR units but had to have the oculus as well.  Definitely an upgrade in the VR world !  Quick shipping and happy boys for Christmas !

If you like technology you should get one.  If you don't play video games you can enjoy videos and experience things like swimming w sharks or a day in Venice for example.  No cords to deal with like in an early version.

I surprised my two sons with this for Christmas - they were ecstatic!  They have played with these for several hours and are thoroughly enjoying the experience.  Heard alot of "oh my gosh, this is great!" during the day.

Better than I ever expected and I expected a LOT! The feeling is so real, like you're in the environment! Clarity in the wireless so key when you're beating it with Beat Saber! Love this and hope for more and more games!

This is so much better than I could have ever imagined. I love to look at the 360 videos from National Geographic, David Attenboro, etc. So realistic like you are really there; the video and sound quality are excellent.

Easy to use, lighter and smaller than previous. Should have more settings for eye distance and could be better around the outer rim of the lens from the user point of view (blurry for me looking at anything off center).

This has to be the best winter workout gear out there! Yes, I said workout. Playing BeatSaber, SuperHot VR and others can be a considerable workout when you can't get to the gym or go outside, and you have fun doing it!

Perfect for anyone who wants to play VR. Cheap and has a $20 app that lets you remote into your gaming PC and play the higher quality games if wanted. I replaced my OG Vive with this and have not touched the Vive since.

Our whole family loves this ages 8-18 for children and adults 38-40.  This is our second one.  Comfortable and easy to set up and link devices too.  We play games, use the meditation apps and also do exercise with this!

I specifically bought this to sign up for the Supernatural workout programs. I am glad I did. I have found all sorts of other content that is great too. I have recommended the Oculus to several of my friends and family

It was fun for about a week, now noone uses it. Not as fun as it seems and it makes my head hurt. Its not for me but you might like it. The graphics are good, sound is also good. Interface and controls are very smooth.

So much fun!! Way better than the PS5! It has kept me and my son on our toes and off our butts lol!! Recommend Beat Saber and Audio Trip! You do have to buy the games and are $15 and up. Some are too pricey personally.

I never would have thought I’d be into VR, and yet it’s awesome!  I’m not a gamer, but a friend had this, and I got hooked on Beat Saber.  Now I’m also hooked on Supernatural, and having a blast exploring the VR world!

I don’t know why I waited so long to purchase a VR. This is by far one of my best purchases. I love using my VR. It’s so realistic and helps keep guest and kids entertained. I am considering of purchasing a second one!

I received this product and watched a lot of videos before buying it. I debated between this one with the highest amount of memory and the lesser one as well as the rift. I decided on this one, and got the cable to run to my PC. 
1. Haven’t used the cable, there has been enough memory for what I use. 
2. This will most likely make you motion sick. It does me on a lot of the games, but you get use to it with time. It’s one reason I don’t play it as much as I first intended. 
3. The feature to cast can be tricky. I could get it to cast to my phone (IPhone) but not my TV (Samsung). 
4. The head strap is a bit uncomfortable so I got the upgraded version at $50. 
5. The pupil distance feature requires you to move the lenses by reaching inside the Oculus. Would be nice if it had a dial that you could adjust. Only has 3 settings but should allow you to fine tune. 
Overall if you have the money to spend on upgrades and you plan to use frequently then I would recommend. Upgrades are all pretty expensive. So far I’ve spent almost $200 on the cable, head strap and case for it.

Facebook may be evil megacorp, but they did this one right. Virtual desktop over my 5GHz 802.11ax wifi equals wireless VR gaming bliss powered by my RTX 2080. All I need is a full motion treadmill to complete my setup.

Great implementation.  Great exercise.  Pick your games carefully. Some games are really good, some are boring.  Overall, this is a wonderful piece of hardware that I can see eventually be used at work as well as home.

Best present ever!  It is loved by everyone of all ages!  Playing Poker, getting into Bar Fights, Dancing and lots more!  Warning, may interfere with sleep schedule, I hear that it is so much fun, you can't get enough!

The family loves this. My only problem is it Has too be charged often. Should have more hours of use before charging for the price. Best Buy is great to order from though. Fast shipping and I’ve never had any problems.

The kids absolutely love this thing. The coloring book is beyond awesome. Unfortunately no games come with it but you get to try them out and can swap them out. The kids were super stoked to get them. Definitely a hit.

So much fun and great exercise. The only draw back is, you need the better strap if you're serious about playing. It's a little pricey with the extras like the extra power strap and dock, but we're not tired of it yet.

Awesome is an understatement. My family has enjoyed every minute of this. I wish the controllers were rechargeable but that’s my only negative. Would definitely recommend and highly likely to Purchase this item again.

Awesome product!  You can go anywhere, do anything, all in 3D!  I've never been a gamer, but was hooked immediately by the 360 views and excellent graphics!  For all of the gamers out there, 2D systems cannot compare!

Great for the kids and adults, I was thinking n this for a week straight. I do recommend only using the game for like an hour and then taking a break cause your head would hurt but it’s fun and the experience is there

Upgraded from the Oculus Quest 1 and was very impressed.  Noticed big differences while playing Half Life Alyx and Beat Saber.  Very happy with the purchase and was grateful for availability.  Still waiting for a PS5.

It’s a great place to be, the MetaVerse. Really fun and immersive. Be careful where you play, I accidentally punched my friend IRL !! Battery life is about 3 hours. Play with the lenses in order get the best clarity.

My son loves his Oculus Quest 2. The charge lasts a long time, it comes with everything you need, it's easy to use, and it's comfortable to wear. It has access to many free games and there are fun games for purchase.
